Turn her left 3/4 of a turn to face me. 56 continue basic. === Alternate #2 4 spin her GENTLY out and catch her right hand with my right hand. 56 Spin her the other (left) way. lift her left hand over my head and do a cross-body out. === Alternate #3 Connect with my right hand to her left hand. 456 Left up, right lead around her hip into hammerlock position. 123 Lift right hand walk under it and drop right hand. 456 Free spin her out. GOOD place to add a rotator on the end.

open position l-r 123 Forward, back, back open back to my right. 456 Lead her to pivot behind me and face forward again. I am left to her left both facing the same direction. Lead her back then forward, take our hands over her head to turn her LEFT pivots... follow her and change hands. R-L ?Foward back, she pivots? 456 - Elbow over hers, elbow, down. now do a cross-body out.

Basic in open position - two hands. 123 - Basic 456 - She does reach turn into hammerlock. 123 - Back Forward, turn right 90. You are leading her back, forward, forward and taking both hands DOWN. 456 - Back, Forward, forward, turn left on 56 under my right arm. She does Back, forward, forward (not moving too much) We are facing each other r-l. Next: coca cola: My right hand on her left shoulder, etc... Then: Rotating cross body lead

Open basic. R-R 123 - Forward, back, back Raise hand and wind her up to: 4&5&6 - She Pivot, Pivot, Pivots and settles to face me. (I do x-body footwork) (Make sure I lead her to go forward then she should do a curving pivot around me) ------ Add a: 123 Change of place, 456 I hook turn 123 Face look her 456 Rotating x-body out ----- Add a: Wave left hand 123 Change of place right hand up, left hand down 456 Hammerlock my self Rotating x-body out or free spin her out.
x-body to Sombrero 123 - Change of place 456 - Hook turn. (repeat?) 123 Change of place 456 - Draw her in with mt left hand and open her up to 90 deg. 123 - Her headloop and 456 - Rotator out

Straighten leg Keep right arm forward (don't let frame drift) Don't step early... Quickly move leg forward (with frame) ==== Swing: 1 - Sugar 2 - Lead down 3 - Twist left hand ... Toe (drape leg inward, keep heel down) Heal (Point leg outward) Cross (and twist) Texas out.

1--------------- L-R 123 Change of Place to pizza waiter 456 Hook turn 123456 X-Body 2---------- L-R 123 Change of Place, lower right hand 456 hook turn Swing hand up and around 3--------- L over R (hold hands) 123 Change of place both hands over 456 Hook turn x-body out 4------- L over R (hold hands) Same as 2, with two hands 5------ Hold hands 123 Change of place 456 Hook turn ----- Add a disco turn. Two hands over to exit.

Footwork: 1 - Left Straight Forward (Turning left) 2 - 3 - Elvis and Curtsie on left foot 4 - Right foot straight back 5 - Cowboy swing left foot to open 6 - Close right foot (to diagonal wall)
Notes: Hips always toward line of dance, body tilted away from line of dance. Spot down or reverse line of dance.

Remember Heal-Toe, Ball Toe?, Toe Toe? down Start Diagional Center? 1 - L Forward (Push right elbow hard left... this is MY hard turn I need to turn alot) 2 - R Forward (2 is the biggest step) 3 - L - Together 4 - R BACK (Push left elbow hard around corner...) 5 - L Back (largest step) (Don't step too large as this is her difficult turn) 6 - R Together (Change step:) 7 - L Forward (Don't turn) 8 - R Forward 9 - L Together (Start leading right so she knows of spin change)
10 - R Forward 11 - L Forward (2 is the biggest step) 12 - R - Together 13 - L BACK 14 - R Back (largest step) 15 - L Together (Change step:) 16 - R Forward (Don't turn) 17 - L Forward 18 - R Together (Start leading right so she knows of spin change)

Slow, Quick, Quick Forward, Side, Together (Usually rotate left 90 deg)
Back, Side, Together (")
Forward, Side, Together Back, Open onto Left, Turnstyle footwork turn onto right. (next basic)----- Slight Forward Left, Side, Together
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Back Right, Side, Together Forward Left, Forward Right, Pivot on Left 180 deg to Left. (next basic)----- Slight back right, Side, Together

DanceStep.Comment:
Typically after cross-body lead to open - two hand connection
Slight forward left, Side (left), 5th position 90 deg to left. Open 90 deg right to face her, 90 deg to right (step forward.. open her up), 90 deg to left to face her.
(This is a nice time to (left) turn her by raising my hand)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Mirror

DanceStep.Comment: (Typically from grapevine - open position) First, I do fifth position then Drop right hand, raise left hand. She spot turns left. I do 1st position: Step 5th (L), slight side, together (L) (Same as in salsa... lead my left hand to my left to start her in the spot turn) Step (R), in (L), place (R) ---nice exit (5th position and rotate 45 deg to left [Basic with rotation])
DanceStep.LadysSteps: (Cumbia, then spot turn) Step 5th (R), Slight side (L), together (R) Forward (L), Turn right 180 deg on (R), Side (L)

DanceStep.Comment: Forward Left and Pivot Left, Slight Back Right, Side Left (keep rotating left), Together.
(straight) Forward left. Back right pivot. Side (Keep rotating RIGHT), together

Forward (L), Forward, side (turn her slightly to right), together. (Facing diag-wall)
Forward (in front of her pivoting right to against line-of-dance), Step (R) while continuing to rotate. Side (l), together (r). You may want to overroatate a little to put you back in promenade.
Left forward with slight left rotation, Side right, together + second half of rumba basic
Right to side, Shift weight to left, Together onto right. Same on other side. (Start second half of basic... Right back...

Footwork is as follows: Weight on right foot... 2 - Spin 90 deg left, 3 - Spin 90 deg right (rotate right foot from toe to heal) 4 - Back left (at 45 deg angle) & - Side Right 1 - Forward Left ... Repeat for other side. (2) patterns:
Open break (on left) 4&1 - Side, together, side... Hold back rotation with right hand to keep her from rotating to her left. ---------------- Pattern 1 2 - Pressure right hand to rotate me right. On Left Foot, spinning 90 deg right. 3 - Pressure left hand to rotate us back. On left foot, spinning 90 deg left. 4&1 - Slowly transfer weight from left hand to right hand. Back, Side, Forward ---------------- (repeat) exit: 2 - Push her straight back... 3, 4&1, 2=open break. continue basic in open break
Pattern (2): Start from cross-body lead: 2,3 4&1 - Switch hands, open path and hold her in front of me. 2,3 - Lead her forward, forward 4&1 - Turn her left into shadow (NOTE: she synchopates, I WALK, WALK to match her feet) point 45 deg to right ----WE ARE BOTH ON OUR LEFT FOOT---- 2 - Rotate left 90 deg 3 - Rotate right 90 deg (right foot goes toe to heal) 4&1 - Back, Side, Forward --------------------------- (repeat) Two exits: Easy exit: 2 - Hold back on my left hand (she will turn 180 deg left to face me) 3 - 4&1 - She synchopates backwards, I WALK, WALK to change my feet back. Hard Exit: 4& 1 - Drive her FORWARD. 2 - Forward 3 - Forward 4&1 - Lock step Forward 2,3 - Forward, Forward 4&1 - Lock step Forward (Rotate right 90 deg at end) Hold back with LEFT hand to rotate her 180 deg left 2,3 - Walk, Walk 4&1 - She synchopates, I WALK, WALK 2 - Forward Left - Lead her back (Start of normal basic)
NOTE: Enio exits and changes with feet back with a: 2 - Tap right 3 - Left 4 - RIght & - Left 1 - Right 2 - Forward Left - Lead her back (Start of normal basic)
(Or her will do a: 2 - Tap Right 3,4&1 - Spin (Left... land on right foot) 2 - Forward Left - Lead her back (Start of normal basic)

Cross Body, start with left hand low (ie., East coast swing position) 123 - ROTATOR FOOTWORK - FORWARD, BACK, HOOK BEHIND. Wind her up 456 Rest of rotator, I fold right hand across my chest, lead her in an eliptical motion over her head, and ROLL and LOCK to finish. 123456 - Rotator out.

Right Over Left Rotating Cross body footwork: 123 Forward, Back, Open Side. Lead with left hand to make her turn right, rotate her to my left. Stop her with my right hand down on her left shoulder and my left hand across her stomach. 456 - She does a rotating pivot to her left. --- Now unwind her into hammerlock 1 - Cucharacha left 23456 - Pivot her to her right twice into hammerlock. Faceloop her with my right hand. --- Now unwind her to pivot left until she is wrapped the other way. 123 - Rotator: Forward, back, hook Lead DOWN to have her pivot into a wrap. 456 - She pivots left. --- Now cross in front of her and them spin her in front of me. 123 - I do a Jazz box left. My lead to her is FORWARD (for her), BACK (for her), and catch her left hand with my right as I pass it behind my back. I cross quickly in front of her on 2. Lead down and to her left. 456 - Spin her in front of me.

Tomas' basic for Rumba (similar to Cha-Cha)
2 - Forward (R), 3 - Back (L) 4 - Side left (onto L) - HOLD 1 ------- Open Break: Cross body lead 2 - Forward (R) 3 - Back (L) 4,Hold1 - Open (L) STAY IN CLOSED position 2 - Back (R) 3 - Turn and forward (L) 4,H1 - Side right (R) 2 - Lead left hand thru to break forward on (L) 3 - Back onto (R) 4,H1 - Face her .... Repeat pattern, and to exit: Lead with left hand in a sweeping circular (from bottom to top): (she spot turns to her right, I spot turn to my left after her) 2 3 4H1 ----- Back to basic

Basic: 234H1 234H1 ----Get her into hammerlock 234H1 - Front part of basic 234H1 - Lead her to spot turn left into hammerlock. -----Turn her right to Elbow lead 234H1 - Both of us back-break, I start turning left 234H1 - Make her come forward to my right, catch her elbow with mine. ----- Cross body and turn her around left to face me 234H1 - Cross Body 234H1 - Turn her around left to my left ----- 234H1 - Send her across my back 234H1 - Spin her with my right hand to face me. --- Back to basic

1 - Forward Left (straight forward) (HEAL lead) 2 - Brush Right (Swing hips) 3 - Together Keep down; Keep hips in front, body back; Head left (Spine left); spot forward and back. 4 - Back right (straight back) (Push off with heal) 5 - Bush back and swing hips open 6 - Close
Do less that 180 deg to do a right turn on the short straightaways.

1 - Forward 2 - Hold 3 - Hold
4 - Back 5 - Hold 6 - Hold
Can combine with Turning basic (on the front or back half) to get out of a jam.

123 - Basic to twinkle (turn her toward inside) 4 - Forward 5 - Back (Release her forward) 6 - Together You should be holding left-right both open, facing down line of dance. 1 - Forward left 2 - Open side right (to face her) 3 - Together (press right hand into hers) Push slightly to get her to face line of dance again 4 - Forward right 5 - Side left ( You should be facing away from each other) 6 - Together (facing away from each other) --------- repeat until: 4 - Push off right to spin her left 5 6 1 - Connect l-r, cut her off to closed position.
Basic forward
Basic Reverse Basic Cumbia Cucharacha, with front cross, with back cross Break (Turn 90 deg, step)
Spot turn Double-Spot turn Reach Turn Full Reach Turn Double Reach-turn
Pivot Reverse Pivot Triple Pivot (Keep feet in-line, Rotate the BODY, Step side to land, Spot in direction of motion)

12 3 - Step SIDE hand goes out to my left 456 - Basic as she spot turns right
Press my middle finger down into her palm and when I circle her halo keep my palm to the floor, middle (and next finger) point straight down so she can double if she wants.

456 I Open Break, she does back basic (We both cumbia) 1 - Lead my left hand right thumb down across her face 23 - She cumbias into a cuddle 4 - Lift left hand 56 - She cumbias to face me. ---- To Exit, step into her on 1 ---- Stop and Go Same, except I left go with my right hand and I move toward her on the cumbia and stop her should with my right hand.

Start with cumbia Usually easier to start by changing hand (to r-r) 1 - I break BACK and have her break back to start cumbias 23 - cumbia across 4 - With my right lead her left arm to step back (cumbia) 5 - Have her step forward 6 - Finish cumbia ----------- To exit, step forward into her on 1

123 - change hands to (r-r) 45 - Lead outside turn with my right hand 6 - Drop elbow to stop her Caress her head on 1,2 123 - Cumbia 456 - Cumbia repeat ---- to exit turn her 90 deg left AND lead her progressive forward: 1 - Take my right hand over her head and lock it on her right shoulder (she steps back), and 2 - Forward (she) 3 - Forward (she) Lead her to pivot left 90 deg left on 1. 4 - (she) Pivot 5 - back (she) 6 - back (she) Follow her out
Never practiced: Hand over her hand 123 - Cumbia opposite 456 - Cumbia opposite -----------Exit 12 - Lead her forward and then block her so she spins to face me.
123 - Forward basic, I step back and turn 90 deg left on 3 4 - Lead her forward into a pivot (hug) 5- Back 6 - Back ----------- to Closed to Open to Crossover
1 - I break back and lead her to break back 2 - She does forward 3 - Block her forarm so she does Pivot 4 - Reach 5 - Turn left 6 - Forward
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1 - I break back and lead her to break back 2 - She does forward 3 - Block her forarm so she does Pivot 4 - Pivot 5 - Pivot 6 - Side

DanceStep.Comment: Open Two hand hold 123 - Lead Cuddle, raise left hand 456 - She rotates in to cuddle. My right hand is low on her hip. Lead a turn with my right hand, raise my left hand (direction on my right tells her whether to do a spot or pivot out) 1 - Lead her FORWARD 2 - She goes Back and start right pivot 3 - Pivot 4 - Pivot 5 - Pivot 6 - Side to: Basic

r-r Rotating x-body lead 123 - Back, forward, forward ; Lead hard down with my right She: 4 - Pivot, 5- Pivot 6 - Pivot and I place her right arm on my shoulder.
123 - Rotate across the front of her 456 - Hug her to rotate across the front of me and then step back to open

DanceStep.Description: Cuddle, to Rolling off the Arm (34:31)
DanceStep.Comment: 123 Lead her into cuddle (Curving cumbia to wrapped cuddle) Lead her to pivot back with my right hand. 456 Hook back, side, in front (Roll her off my arm) --- To side-by-side cumbias, then block her to exit. We are now side-by-side: 123 Lead her to do back back basic 456 Turn and do a side by side back basic 123 Same 456 Brake so she pivots out (left)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 123 Cuddle in Then back pivot: 4 - (right) Pivot (back onto left foot) 5 - Pivot 6 - Back (or side to stop)

DanceStep.Comment: 123 - Lead the lady Back, Forward, FORWARD MY next steps are behind, small side, FORWARD (to catch up with her) 4 - Have her pivot left 5 - Back 6 - Back (a Little) (Go into pizza-waiter to get her not to step back too much)

DanceStep.Description: Triple Turn Variation (of Ladies inside turn) (35:56)
DanceStep.Comment: 123456 Same a Ladies inside turn. 123 - Basic - Lead her forward (without turning her) Natural top footwork, but step forward on 6 (since she has pivoted past you) 4 Lead her to pivot (hook) 5 Side 6 FORWARD ------To add triple turn: Pizza waiter 123 - I spot turn right 456 - She spot turns right

Basic (123 Open break curving 456 Hook, side, in-front) 1 - Lead her back slightly (I start a level 2 cumbia) 2 - Lead her forward, start making her turn toward me 3 - Face her in closed position 4 - Hook behind (she steps between my feet) Keep turning by rotating my hips 5 - Elvis (she crosses in front) Keep rotating 6 - Hook 7 - Elvis 8 - Hook 9 - Elvis 10 - Hook 11 - Elvis 12 - Cross in front to open her up. --------(Start hip twist exit)-------- 1 - Rotate and press forward (she will be in same position) 2 - Lead her forward (for her) and turn her in 3 - Lead her forward (after turing her back) 456 - Cross body lead exit. (or inside turn exit) --------Roll and Lock entrance------- 1 - Lead her back 2 - Lead her to cumbia (same as change of place lead) and put right knife edge on her back 3 - Roll and lock (and rotate myself about 180 deg) continue Natural top --------Wrap entrance--------- Two hands: 1 - Lead her back (same as cuddle lead)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Her following step is: Left foot Side Right Foot Forward between the man's legs (Follows man's left foot)

DanceStep.Comment:
1 Open her with my right hand (left foot back) (open her left) 2 - Close. 3 Together left 4 - Open left 90 deg. Step forward right 5 - side 6 together
Finish with a basic or a cucharacha

DanceStep.Description: Open to Dance position and Man's underarm turn
DanceStep.Comment:
Q - Forward Left Q - Open her to the rail S (left) - Raise left hand and walk under S (right) - Reach turn left to closed dance postition, backing line of dance.
---- To cuddle Last slow - hold two hands q - Step left q - step around her back s - continue around her s - step to her side
---- To sweetheart (SAME footwork as 'to cuddle') except on first q: Switch hands r-r
q - Put her on the left rail q - Step between her legs and pivot to backing line of dance s - step back onto the left rail s - step to forward line of dance

After an underarm turn, twist her hand to the inside on 6 (twist counter-clockwise) 1 - Flat rolling twist clockwise to opposite side. She rolls right knee around to step on little toe on right foot. 2 - Reverse
--- Underarm or sugar to exit ---

From Left turn: 123 = Forward Left, Side Right, Elvis Left 456 = Back Right, Open left, together right. 123 = Forward Left, Side Right, Elvis Left --- Transition step (to left rotations) 456 = Side right, hook behind (and twist left), Side right (PULL Partner from my left side) 123 = Walk (L), Walk (R), Walk (L) (keep rotating, PUSH partner forward with my right side) -------repeat--- -------- to change direction:-------- 4 - Side right 5 - Twist deeply into LEFT leg, 6 - Replace right, --- Transition step (to right rotations) 123 = Side left, hook behind (and twist right), Side left (PULL Partner from my right side) 456 = Walk (R), Walk (L), Walk (R) (keep rotating, PUSH partner forward with my right side) -------repeat ----------to exit (to right turn):--- 6 - Go DEEP forward into your RIGHT knee. 1 - Back Left 2 - Back right (HARD right turn) 3 - Together 456 - Forward R, Forward and side L, Together R (standard start to right turn).

DanceStep.Description: Crossbody to cuddle to rock and roll
DanceStep.Comment: Crossbody to cuddle. She in in my right shoulder ----To do rock and roll: I do: Back side forward. She does: Forward side back which is: 1 - Forward right 2 - Side onto Left (starting to pivot) 3 - Pivot back onto right (She is now in my left shoulder... I lead her to pivot BACK on her RIGHT foot) (leftward rotation) 4 - Pivot back onto left 5 - Pivot back onto right 6 - Pivot side to stop rotation ----- Usually finish with a rotator

DanceStep.Description: Rolling off the arm to rock and roll
DanceStep.Comment: Natural Top Footwork. 123 - Lead her to turn left into cuddle on my right side. 456 - I turn 90 deg right as I lead with my right from her hip (she pivot, pivot, pivot to my right side) 123 - We both do a back basic 456 - Brake with my right (and continue hanging on with my right) she pivot, pivot, pivots to my right side. 123 - Rock and roll her across to my left shoulder. 456 - Pivot her back with my left hand (pulling down) she pivots left to face me (after I rotate 90 deg left)
Cross body footwork. 123 - Forward basic, open Place my left hand on her right shoulder to lead her in a cross-body 456 - She does 3 pivots, I roll and lock on 6 and 123456 - do a rotator

Start with Generic Whip: 12 - Same - Angle rock, step (Stop her with my left hand so she swivels) 34 - Same footwork. Into closed, turn left hand across her face (telling her to turn left.. but she DOES NOT turn) 56 - She steps forward, place my right hand on her right hip to change her direction to backwards 78 - Turn left 180 deg to face her (or face open) while going under my arm (or I can release and just turn) 90 - Free spin 360 deg right and grab her wrist to lead her out

DanceStep.Description: Cuddle to Hammerlock rolling off the arm
DanceStep.Comment: Cross Body Footwork. 123 XBody 456 Cuddle to my right side. 1 - Have her step FORWARD 23456 - Pivot her back (Pivot, pivot, pivot, pivot, side) to hammerlock The heal of my right hand is on her hip. 1 - Push her hip to step back 23 - Forward Lead DOWN with my right hand so she will 456 - She can triple pivot or synchopate to: Pivot, Pivot, Pivot, Pivot, Side (I do cross-body footwork) 123456 - Rotating cross body out.

DanceStep.Description: Crossbody to crossover to Ladie's free spin (Vacilala)
DanceStep.Comment: Start is similar to the cross body to crossover, but I overrotate her and tap left. 123 - Start of Crossbody. 45 - Over-rotate her r, l 6 - Tap Left --- Now she does: 123456 - Pivot (right) , Pivot, Pivot, Pivot, Pivot, Side I do: 123 - Back basic 456 - Progressive forward. or I can: 123 - Pivot, Pivot, Pivot, 456 - Progressive forward

Crossbody and change hands Right over left 12 - Back break (both of us) 3 - Lead her to pivot forward right by leading down with my left hand and balance her spin with my right hand 4 - She pivots 5 - Pivot 6 - Side I do a headloop for both of us and: 123456 - Cross body (or coca cola) out.

DanceStep.Description: Generic Whip with Turn and Whip
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Same Generic Whip 34 - Same Generic Whip, except open left hand hinting that a turn is coming 56 - Lead a full turn with my left hand and then lower my hand to her neck (or waist) and continue pushing 78 - Turn 180 deg left to her side (I have her locked on my left side, right hand now on her left hand on her waist) 90 - Get her to check forward my pressing forward with my forarm on her back and then pulling her back (my footwork, hook behind left, then back right) 12 - Turn towards her (triple step?) Do twists until the start of the phrase.
DanceStep.LadysSteps:
12 Forward right, side left 34 Back, together, forward right 56 Side left, pivot 270 on left land on right away from partner 78 Spin 180 +360 on right and feet together (now facing partner)
90 Check forward right, step back left 12 Anchor Do taps until lead out.

DanceStep.Comment:
Same entry as change of place. Change hands to r-r 123 - Open break (we both step back and I slide in back of her) Gently twist her hand down for 456 - Cumbia (Holding both hands) --Repeat
-- To Exit 123 - Lift my right hand over her head (still step behind her, but twist her to face me) 456 - Hands across each other's shoulders 123456 - Crossbody exit
El Dos:---------- 123 - Change of place, but lift my right hand over her head. Then slade in front of her. 456 - Continue to do cumbias, remember to bend at the elbows -- Repeat
-- To Exit 123 - Turn left hand palm up to pizza waiter... 456 - Cross in BACK of her and do sombrero
123456 - Cross body out.

From two hands open, lead windup with left. Left hand over her head, right hand across her back and down her left arm. 123 - Level one cumbia Lead my windup (for a left turn) with my right hand (elbow in, turn head Left) 456 - Level one cumbia (for a change of place) repeat --- Natural Top Exit: 456 - Make her step SIDEWAYS on 4 into a natural top --- Hook Turn Exit: Exit with two hands over on 123 + a hook turn on 456

DanceStep.Description: Enchufe con Vuelta (Change of place w/turn)
DanceStep.Comment: 123 Open break 456 Hook turn (looping my hand)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 123 - Turning cumbia 456 - Cumbia in place

DanceStep.Comment: Make sure she is close and to my right. I need to have my head left. Starting diagional wall. (do Quarter-turn) Slow - Forward Right. (Heal lead to a flat foot) Quick, Quick, Slow - Side, Together, Side (Toe, Toe, Toe-Heel) Backing Diagonal center (do progressive chasse) Slow - Back Right (Flat foot) Quick, Quick, Slow - Side, Together, Side Slow - Forward Right.

Starting the same as a basic: Diagional wall. Slow - Forward Turning Right. (Heal lead to a flat foot) Quick, Quick - Side, Together (Turning right) (Toe, Toe, Toe-Heal) --- Now do a (large right turn/spin): Slow - Back onto my left foot (Pivot right). Slow - Forward right (continue pivoting right... hold at the top of the step) Slow - Down onto left. --- Back into a basic Slow - Back right ... continue.
12 Back, Half-back 34 Kick left, step across left 56 Kick right, step across right

Inside turn to Ladies Wrap...
On First Slow, Push forward lightly with my forearm and pull back with my hand to get her to turn right (I start turning right) On Second Slow, Cross my left hand across my front and turn all the way to face line of dance and progress forward. Connect my left hand with her free hand.
--- To exit: Slow, Slow: Lift my left hand and step under Qucik, Quick, Walk around her back to wrap her again.

Starting the same as a basic: Diagional wall. Slow - Forward Turning Right. (Heal lead to a flat foot) Quick, Quick - Side, Together (Turning right) (Toe, Toe, Toe-Heel) --- Now do a (Slow right turn): Slow - Back onto my left foot (Drive right foot back). Slow - Together right (continue turning right... KEEP her LEFT) Slow - Forward Left. --- Back her into a forward basic Slow - Forward right ... continue.

DanceStep.Description: Tuck inside roll, double man's faceloop
DanceStep.Comment: Right to Right, Wave left over, I open a little. 12 - Lead her forward, then into my stomach with my right 34 - She does free-spin foot work to headloop (her right hand around my shoulder) 56 - I switch sides to her left and place her left arm on my shoulder (my right arm is on her back) Now lead a two-hand tuck (except start by leading her back) 12 - Rock her back 3456 - Rest of two hand tuck (lead with my right arm on her back, on 3 give her a push to turn)

Back basic. Quick, Quick, Slow - Side, Together, FORWARD (left) (Toe, lower to heel) Slow - Forward right (outside the partnership, Heel-ball) (Keep your body facing your partner, Turn your head and hips in the direction of motion [forward]), Quick, Quick - Forward (Left), Lock Right behind left Slow - Forward (Left) ---- Typically Exit by doing a spin turn: Slow, Quick, Quick - Forward (turning right), Side together... etc.
Start Generic Whip: 12 - Same, Open palm to signal turn 34 - Same, lower hand to ladies middle on 4 56 - Push hand out so she fess-spins right and reconnect l-r

Side Balance: Slow - Side Left Tap Together Right Hold Left.
Forward Balance: Forward Left Tap Together Right Hold Left.

Side Balance: Slow - Side Left 1/2 Slow - Tap Together Right 1/2 Slow - Hold Left.
Forward Balance: Forward Left Tap Together Right Hold Left.

In 1 measure: S - Forward (to my Left) S - Forward Right Q - Side Left (Face her again) Q - Together Right
in 2 measures: S - Forward (to my Left) 1/2 S - Brush Together Tap Right 1/2 S - Hold Right. S - Forward Right Q - Side Left (Face her again) Q - Together Right
in 2 measures: S - Forward (to my Left) S - Brush Together Tap Right S - Hold Right. S - Forward Right S - Side Left (Face her again) S - Together Right

S - Side Left Q - Hook Back Right Q - Replace Side Left
repeat for other side
S - Side Left S - Hook Back Right S - Replace Side Left

Natural with hesitation: SQQ - RLR - Forward, side, together (Turning 90 deg right) Back (stall?) with hesitation: (My post is my through my left side) S - Press left foot straight back and pivot 50 deg right S - Draw right foot next to left changing weight (move her in an arc) S - Hold (stay on right foot) and keep her right so she won't step down Right progressive chasse: S - Right Forward turning right Q - Left Side Q - Right Together S - Side Right Impetus (Heal turn): S - Back left onto heal (set post and turn right 90 deg) S - Onto right ball continue turning 90 deg right S - Back Left ----Into basic: Progressive chasse SQQ - Back R, Side L, Together R

Footwork: Forward: Don't bend ankle. Swing leg through. Heel first (as heel of other foot lifts) Do not drop to ball of front foot until other foot brushes through.
Backwards: Swing leg back, ball touches first, Forward leg has weight on HEEL. Do not roll to flat until forward heel brushes through.
Initiatiation: Roll shoulders backwards, stop back/down. Straighten body with head over shoulders. Raise arms with left palm toward partner. She moves forward to connect to my left hand and raises her left arm. I move foward and place my right hand on her shoulder blade, pointed slightly up.

DanceStep.Description: Generic Whip w/inside turn and push back
DanceStep.Comment:
1234 Generic Whip, left palm between partnership. 56 Lead her forward and then she turns left (Remove my RIGHT hand quickly from her back and replace it on her back to hold her in closed) 7 - Push her back with my left hand (in her right) and 8 - Hold her back (I should be on my left foot pointing my right foot forward)
Patterns: Wave to man's headloop Generic Whip w/inside turn and push back

Pattern: Natural: QQS - Forward (right), Side, Together (while turning right). Reverse Lock: SQQS - Back left (Lead extremely left... pull left hip, shoulder back left), Back Right, Lock Left, Back Right. Toe turn?: QQS - Back Left (she goes forward outside me), Open side right (toe), forward left (toe-heel). Technique note: Keep her very left as I power her around to my right. Natural: SQQ - Forward (right), Side, Together (while turning right). Followed by a spin turn.

To enter: Quarter turn, w/Hesitation Forward Chasse w/impetus. (SQQS SSS) (LRLR LRL) To start, open her up into promenade: SS Forward Right, Hop Left. Polka Chassay: Chasay left: QQ&S: (&) Turn 180 deg right (S) remaining on Left, (Q) Side Right, (Q) Together (left), (&) Side right (hop and remain on right) and (S) Pivot right (rotate 180 deg right, stay on right) Continue... To exit: Forward lock step: QQS - Very Forward Left, Lock behind right, Forward left Followed by a spin turn exit.
1234 Sugar Now, walk her back: 5 - Push my right arm forward 6 - Left Forward etc.... even - Pop her into a Texas push
Side pass position 1234 - Have her pass and set her (right) hand on my (right shoulder) 56 - Turn Left 1 rev.

Natural Top Footwork: 123 - Back (small), Forward, Side (Lead her BACK, forward, pivot right) (push her hand out and DOWN) place my right (other) hand on her hip and wait for her hand to spin around into mine. 456 - Hook, close, forward (she does pivot, pivot, side) Now you are right to right thumbs down almost facing each other. Draw lead: 123 - FORWARD, back, back Turn her on 4 into hammerlock. (her footwork is cross-body lead) 456 - hook, close, forward (she does Pivot, back, back) ---- Now I can exit her with a right or left turn (I should be slightly open) Left turn exit -------- 123 - Side rock, replace right (wind her up to her left), replace left (she pivots right) 456 - basic - She pivot, pivot, side Exit with cross-body Right turn exit -------- 123 - Side rock, replace right, replace left (she winds up right) 456 - She Pivot, Pivot, Pivot (I roll and lock her) Exit with rotator
------------variation------------ 123 - Same You should be connected right to right at her hip (at her hip is the only way you can be connected this early) 45 - She pivot, pivot 6 - AFTER she is done turning, turn on your right foot on 6 Follow with basic

Rise and Fall is in the ankles and very little in the knees. Timing is: SSQQ or SQQ Footwork forward is: SSQQ - Heal, Heal-Toe, Toe, Ball-Heal Backward footwork is: SSQQ - Toe-Heal, Toe-Heal, Toe, Ball-Heal On backstep, bend at the HIP, reach your TOE back and then push back onto your toe-heal
On QQ (side) - You should be arcing like a rainbow
S - Forward left heal S - Forward right heal Q - Forward left heal-toe (raise) Q - Forward right ball-head (lower)

Similar to a basic box: SQQ - Forward left, open her up - back right, together left (come down fairly hard so her weight is down) We are in promenade SQQ - Forward right, Close her - side left, together right

Similar to a basic box: SQQ - (S) Forward left, open her up - (QQ=S) Raise and fall back onto your right We are in promenade SQQ - Forward right, Close her - side left, together right
Steering: 1 (Same) Forward Left Now decide to go to 10, 12 or 2 o'clock (2o'clock requires an angled step on 2) 2 (Same) (Angle right) 3 Point your left ribs in the directon of travel (Together left) should be facing new direction.
1. Generic Whip w/inside turn and push back 2. Pushback sugar 3. Ladies inside tuck 3. Man's headloop 4. Ladies free spin 5. Man's left spin to add two counts (Step left w/left, spin, together right)

Underarm to: R-R Wave left over, I open left 12 Lead her forward and start cranking her in 45 Turn her (free spin style) she headloops me. 56 I pivot 90 deg left my right on her shoulder, my left have her headloop me. Tuck out: 12 Rock back 34 Press her shoulder so she 56 double or singles right
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Free-spin footwork

DanceStep.Comment: 1. Side pass her... she slows down. I do sailor shuffle on 78 2. Side pass + 1 texas 3. Side pass + I spin left on 78 4. Sugar + walkbalk = 8 + underarm

----Entry From basic left turn 123 - Forward, Side, Together, but under turn and open her up so I'm facing her and there is some distance between us. ----Pattern: 456 - Forward (down line of dance) right, side right (Back to her), together left (Back to her). 123 - Forward (down line of dance) left, side right (Facing her), together left (Facing her). ----Exit: 456 - Push her arm so she spins once to her left (I spin to my right) 123 - Cut her off and connect to start a left basic 18 step pattern

Start facing Diagonal-center. S-1 Forward Left Q-2 Side right (turn left) You should be backing line of dance. Q-3 BACK left (not together) --- S-4 Back right Q-5 Side left (turn left) Q-6 Together right (facing diag-wall)

Work on footwork: Forward: Heal strike, push with back foot, don't lower to ball until back foot brushes by Backward: Bend at hip, push toe back and push onto toe, release forward ball (onto heal), don't lower forward (rear) foot until other foot brushes by:
Pattern: 3/8 Turn: 1S Forward 2Q Side 3Q Back 4S Back 5Q Together 6Q Forward (Under turn and turn nose and elbow in direction of travel) ---------------Exit 1:? 1S - Forward 2Q - Forward, turn her 3Q - Forward outside partnership ---------------Exit 2: I am outside parnership now, keep left, keep her right Twinkle variant: 1S - Forward Left (outside partnership) and open her up for twinkle 2Q - Toward her right (between her legs) 3Q - Forward (down the line of dance) (I should be AHEAD of her now) Turn: 4S - Forward right (across the front of her) 5Q - Side Left (I should be turning hard right, she is continuing straight down the line of dance) 6Q - Forward (down the line of dance - We are in promenade position now) Back and Forth Twinkle thing: 1S - Forward Left (she is going backwards) 2Q - Side right (I turn left) (turn her around) 3Q - Replace Left (do not close left, just step forward on left) (she is facing forward, so she goes backwards on 4) 4S (same, reverse direction) 5Q 6Q REPEAT ---To switch to the other side (Do same rotation move, to right) 4S - Step across the front of her 5Q - Side 6Q - Together REPEAT ----Exit 1S - Forward, but I DO NOT turn (I still turn her the same) 2Q - Forward 3Q - Back. 4S - Back 5Q - Side 6Q - Together (facing her... ready to do a basic)

Start with a regular Twinkle (going outside partnership): Hybrid Twinkle: 1L - Forward 2R - Side (between her feet) 3L - Back and together (and down) I am now to her right ready to step outside partnership (Feet down line of dance, Hips, Shoulders toward my partner) 4R - Forward (progressing Diag-center) outside partnership 5L - Forward 6R - Turn right (to Diag-wall) and down ---repeat
--- Simple exit: 123 To closed partnership

First to a basic w/left turn: 1L - Forward 2R - Side (turn left) 3L - Back (and together) --- Start backward twinkle 4R - BACK (toward Diag-Wall) 5L - Side/Back and up 6R - Down and turn LEFT --- Repeat (now in direction of diag-center)
---Simple exit 456 - Turn her around so she in closed in front of me.
--- Exit to Forward progressive twinkle 123 - Turn her hard around me to my right and 4 - PROGRESS FORWARD (doing forward progressive twinkle

Locked Whip 123 same 4 Step back only slightly, start to press my left arm into her side. 5 - Draw her back (to step on her left foot and pull her to turn away from me) 6 - Continue turning her 7,8 Her down hard and roll her wrist, so she turns 1.5 times right into hammerlock --- 12 step off to my left and Lead her forward and 3&4 turn her to face me
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1R2L - Forward , Forward 3R&L4R - Coas, ter, (back stightly) step 5L - Onto left and pivot (right) to face away 6R - Step forward (away from partner) and (push with R on 7) 7L - Spin 1.5 turns right 8R - Stop spinning ---- 1L - Forward 2R - Forward and pivot Right 3R&L4R - Back, together, Forward(tap, so you can go forward on 1)

DanceStep.Comment:
Start facing diagional-center & - Starter step left forward SQQ - Feather - Forward R, Forward L, Forward R (Shoulder lead right to outside partnership left) SQQ - Reverse - Forward L, Side R (Hard turn left to backing line of dance), (straight) back Left SQQ - Feather Finish - Back R - Open L (turning left) - Forward R (facing diag wall) SQQ - Three Step - Forward L, Forward R, Forward L (Start shoulder lead here) SQQ - Natural - Forward R - SIDE Left (Cut her off - backing line of dance) - Back R SSS - ? - Back L, Open R, Forward L (Diag-center)
SQQ - Feather - Forward R, Forward L , Forward R (Shoulder lead right to ouside partnership left) - ? - Forward L, Side R (Inside Toe, Inside Heal), Together L (Touch only - Keep weight on R), Forward L (this is the "and" starter step to repeat this pattern)

Usually enter from open break to underarm turn. ---- Switch hands - R-R, place left hand on her BACK Break forward L, back R, She breaks forward R LRL - Side, Together, Side R - Open Break (Small Step Kind of Toward her) (Wind her up) L (Start turning her left), RL - Lift arm to have her spin left and place hand on her back to lead her FORWARD R. --- Repeat

Open position 123 Forward basic 456 Underarm turn, switch to R-R 123 Open left. keep her back 456 Lead DOWN, then over her head (she turns left 1 full turn and forward) 123 Lead her FORWARD (my left hand on her back), then turn her right to face me. 456 Underarm turn 123 (Similar to 123 of a x-body, but up on my toes on 3) 456 Into running position (left knee bent, facing back) (She is leaning back into my arm) 123456 Cross body to open 123 Open break (back then FORWARD) reach my right hand around her left side and connect with her right hand 456 unwind her to face me.

123 Ba 456 sic 123 X-Body to 456 Ladies Double (Left arm down, then mid-chest) 123 X-Body 456 Lead 123 Change hands to R-R and do one Ba 456 sic 123 Open break (lead her back, then to her LEFT) into 456 shadow (Change my footwork to hers) 123 Sha 456 dow 123 Sha 456 dow 123 Lead her to turn around right to 456 face me (with my right hand) 123 Bas 456 ic 123 Coca-cola, but face SIDE. 456 End up with my left hand across her back and on her right hip 123 Break left, send her across right. 456 Kneel, hand on her knee, she spins left. 123 Bas 456 ic 123 x-body 456 R-R left under 123 Open break 456 Sombrero 123 Start x-body 456 backwards (partnership rotating counter-clockwise) 123 backwards 456 lead arm over her head, she rotates left done

Waltz: Wisk: 1 Straight forward 2. side (left) (lead her around my back) 3. Slide left foot behind right and bend knee
1. Diag toward her &. Toe 2. Toe (Close her) 3. Toe-heal
1. R -> Forward (do 3/8 turn)
Technique: Do starter step to right STAY LEFT

Wisk to: Natural: RLR - 123 - Outside partner (Right turning to backing line of dance) Spin Turn: WIND UP to spin HARD left 1 - Back left to a right pivot. (Make sure you both stay LEFT to increase angular momentum) turning right 2 - Forward left (Heal-toe) up onto my toe, KEEP my right toe pushed down into to floor for stability. Keep turning right. 3 - Smooth toe-heal down onto right, and start sending left foot back for next (1)
TECHNIQUE; Keep left, Chin down, ballroom knees
3? - Tap Left (to left) 1? - Step Forward Left, turn RIGHT 2? - Step Slightly back on to the side Right repeat
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Same

DanceStep.Comment: 123 Bas 456 ic 123 Open Break to 456 Underarm turn 123 Open Break to 456 Scallop ----------- 123 Cucharacha cross 456 Cucharacha cross 123 Cucharacha cross 456 Cucharacha cross ---------------or scallop, but continue turning left so we are facing the same direction. 123 Back left (lead is my left hand over hers, pull it down), forward, slightly forward 456 Forward, face your partner, open again (repeat) Exit: 456 - Underarm turn 123 X- 456 Body Turn 123 X- 456 Body-double Hammerlock: first to open 123 - Same as x-body (on 3 lead her to her right) with my right hand 456 - Lead in toward me and turn her around to hammerlock (I am facing side, she is to my left facing the other side) --- Cross to underarm turn 123 Side Left, replace, turn right 1/4 turn (bring my right hand over my head) and 456 Free spin her left (or underarm turn her)

Waltz: 1 - Forward 2 - Side right 3 TOGETHER left (is a twinkle. back is a wisk) Twinkle (Feet together, instead of feet back) ... 3 variations: 1. Open us 2. Open her 3. Open me
3 Variations on 456: 1. Close her 2. Close us 3. Close me
Hybrid twinkle. 1 same 2 Step and turn on Right 3 Step open on L

123 - lrl - Twinkle Hybrid 456 - rlr - Natural (I open more, so we are both facing against line of dance) 123 - lRLR - Shasay (She passes me and remains facing backing line of dance, I turn to face line of dance) (remember we have our knees bent here) 4 - L - Step forward with legs bent (her leg remains locked - can't move it) 5 - x - Raise up - she does develope 6 - x - Down 1 - Back R 2 - I turn to close L 3 - Together R

Basic footwork: Forward: 1 - Soften knee, PUSH heal forward. 2 - SIDE to toe 3 - Together and DOWN Backward. 1 - Soften knee, Push backward toe-heal 2 - Side to toe 3 - Together and DOWN
Body contact with partner; Soften knee and feel the inside of her knee on mine.
STAY LEFT Rotate her hard around corners...

Variation 1: - Two-hand tuck
Variation 2: - Ladies ?Inside roll 1 - Open and lean forward (to let her through) 2 - Stop her by raising my left hand and making her bend her elbow by placing my right hand on her elbow. 3 - Two fingers pointing down as she cups her hand (she pivots 3 & 4) 4 - 56 - Triple step
Variation 3: - ? 1 - Lead her quickly forward 2 - Stop her with my RIGHT hand to make her 3 - She 4 - Pivots 56 - Triple step
Also learned how to get into closed position using a generic whip: 12 - Same 3 - STOP her backward momentum and Triple - & to- 4 the left 5&6 - Triple in place

Left Turn: 123 - Forward, Side, Cross 456 - Back, Side, Together Twinkle: 123 - Forward, Side, Forward (Make sure your knees are BENT) Open her: 456 - Forward, Down, Rainbow Back (Keep left hand in same location during 456 to open her) Together, then turn: 123 - FORWARD, side, cross in back Lead her to turn left on 4 (I turn right) 456 - Pivot forward, pivot, step (can repeat ^) Turn her RIGHT: 123 - FORWARD (prep her to pivot right), lead her back to Pivot, Pivot (I walk, walk, walk and slow down so I'm in back of her) connect hands to hands. Forward 3: 456 - Forward, Forward, Forward (she does Back, back, back) Developee: 123 - Down (Forward left), Up (stay here) Down (stay here) 456 - Back, Turn 90 deg left, Together (she does: forward, Pivot left, pivot left to face me) Left Turn: 123 - Forward OUTSIDE her, side, cross ...
Option: It is easier (and not very pretty) to do a butterfly instead of going forward: 123 - Close to my partner 456 - Open

DanceStep.Class: Phil Adams and Mary Ann Nunez
DanceStep.Comment: 1-4 Same hands as Underarm pass...except roll and lock open left hand flat to hers. 5 Open (L) left and keep her close, so she turns 180 deg 6 Small step (R) face her (L) (back) (signal her to spin just after 6) 7&8 - RLR in place
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1-4 same as under arm pass except forward on 4. 12 - Walk R walk L 3&4 - Pivot left, Back R, Forward L 56 - Pivot right 180 deg (onto L), pivot R 180 deg onto R (foward facing away from partner) &78 - LRL - 1.5 turn right (facing me) Note: can do 7&8, but earlier is better

DanceStep.Class: Phil Adams and Mary Ann Nunez
DanceStep.Comment: Same as Underarm turn except roll and lock: 12 - LR 3&4 - LRL Roll and lock Place left hand on her left hand and right hand on her back. KEEP your weight on your LEFT foot and: 56 (do not step) Open right (My left hand should be hooked above her left hand) 78 RL step, step (small) - Lead her to spin in front on me 910 - RLR - Anchor in place
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 12 RL - Step, Step &34 - RLR - Pivot, back forward. 5&6 - LRL - Pivot back forward (weight is on BACK foot) 7&8 - RLR - Pivot, Pivot, Pivot 9&10 - LRL - Anchor in place

DanceStep.Comment:
Timing = Slow, Quick, Quick Twinkle: 1 - L - Forward left (heal), 2 - R - Forward (agressive, between her feet) (heal-toe) (up), 3 - L - Feather (down) Reverse: 1 - R - Forward 2 - L - BACK 3 - R - Together Heal-pull, Twinkle: 1 - L - Back, turn right on left heal (outside partner) 2 - R - Forward 3 - L - Feather (I am ahead of her) Promenade: 1 - R - Forward 2 - L - Forward (Turn her to promenade) 3 - R - Forward (Turn her to backing line of dance)
Tech note: 1 - DOWN + SL (NO STEP!) 2 - Step + OW 3 - Up - Quick 4 - Down - Quick

Footwork: Bent knees: Step with straight leg, bend leg when you put weight on left
1 - R - Back 2 - L - Side 3 - R - Diag forward 4 - L - Diag Forward 5 - R - Together - Lift to lead her to do crusada 6 - L - Forward - Turn her left and step between her legs 7 - R - Side 8 - L - Together

1 - R - Back 2 - L - Side, open her up 3 - R - forward, she steps forward (in promenade) 4 - L - Forward - Close her up 5 - R - Forward 6 - L - Forward 7 - R - Together - Lift to lead her to do crusada 8 - L - Forward 9 - R - Side 10 - L - Together

Sugar: 1 - Back 2 - Lift left hand over my head (flat, palm to sky, pointing left, shoulder toward partner) 3&4 - Same (Stop her with my right palm) 56 - Same ---- Variation: &4 - Spin right ---- Sugar: R-R (shake) 1 - Back 2 - Right hand over head 3&4 - Stop her with my closed left hand on her hip 56 - Same ---- Variation: &4 - Spin right

Inside whip variations: 12 - Same 3&4 - Same, left hand up, pointing to right 5 - Walk, Move right hand from her shoulder to her right hip and 6 - Walk, lead her back 78 - Walk, Walk (left to right) 9&10 - Triple in place ----- variation: 9 - Hook right behind left & - reach around with my right hand and grab her hand 10 - Step ---------------- Whip variation: 12 - Same 34 - Same, Lead her backward with my left hand 5678 - Change hands to shake hold and hold her back 12345678 - Hold her and let her play

Twinkle: 1 - L - Forward left (heal), 2 - R - Forward (agressive, between her feet) (heal-toe) (up), 3 - L - Feather (down) Promenade: 1 - R - Forward 2 - L - Forward (Turn her to promenade) 3 - R - Forward (Turn her to backing line of dance) (Next steps are similar to Jazz step) Reverse: 1 - L - Forward 2 - R - Side 3 - L - Back (CBMP - Body is twisted, facing her) Forward: 1 - R - Back 2 - L - Side 3 - R - Forward (CBMP)
Tech note: 1 - 2 - 3 - Up - Quick 4 - Down slows me down for the next slow
123 - Same 4 - open palm, my left foot crosses in front of right 5 6 7 - same 8 - Forward L 9 - Forward R (lift her to do a crusada) 10 - Forward 11 - Side 12 - Together

Side pass 12 - Same 3&4 - Same, palm toward sky, head loop myself 5&6 - Same --- different end: 5 - Left shoulder toward her & 6 - Right shoulder toward her Free tuck out: RIGHT hand leads this: 1 - Lead her to step back 2 - Same tuck 3&4 - Extend right hand to wind her up 5&6 - End of tuck --- different tuck end: 5&6 - hook my left hand on her left hand, have her step forward and spin her left 7&8 --- different lead for tuck end: 5&6 - Slide my right hand off her back and hook her bicept 7&8 ============= Can also do a headloop from R-R handshake hold.

DanceStep.Description: Left side pass w/ladies inside roll
DanceStep.Comment: Facing her, L-R 12 - Lead her forward, and raise her hand 34 - Hook her arm and pull it toward me so she spins left 5&6 - Anchor as she spins
Close to basic: 123 - Same = Twinkle 4 - Forward 5 - Forward and turn her around to her right 6 - Back (To Closed position)

Sugar and Side pass: On 3456 Instead of triple-triple, do Tap-step (Raise hip for more style)
Sugar and Side pass: On 56 instead of triple, bring feet together and: Rotate hips or Bump hips or Rotate shoulders or pulse shoulders down

1 - R - Back 2 - L - Open to Promenade 3 - R - Step 4 - L - Side (facing partner) 5 - R - Hook behind (lead partner to do same) 6 - Un- 7 - Wind 8 - Slide right fo- 9 - ot to left and change weight to right 6 - L - Forward (normal 678 tango finish) 7 - R - Side 8 - L - Together
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 12345 - Mirror me 6 - Back Ocho 7 - Side (To face me) 8 - Forward ocho 9 - Forward ocho 6 - L - Back (normal 678 tango finish) 7 - R - Side 8 - L - Together

DanceStep.Comment: 123 - Twinkle - Let go of left hand ---------- 4 - Slow - R - Forward (Cut her off slightly) 5 - Quick - L - Side (across) (Try to hug her and go across (and not down the line of dance) as much as you can) 6 - Quick - R - Forward 1 - Slow - L - Forward - Lead her forward and slightly in front of me 2 - Quick - R - Forward - Pass her from my left to my right arm 3 - Quick - L - Forward - Forward --------- Close: 1 2 3 - Quick - R - Grab her right hand with my left 456 - Close her from promenade

1 - R - Back 2 - L - Promenade 3 - R - Forward (in promenade) 4 - L - BACK - Deeply bend left leg, she leans forward (My lead is hard - forward in prom direction so she faces me, then turn her and have her step forward) 5 - R - Forward and back to promenade 6 - L - continue or do promenade (and finish basic)

Easiest breaks are: & point, the draw my leg back in. or: Out - Out (then roll hips for break) or: Back Back (Don't jump, place your feet) then bend, bend (knees), bend, bend ----- Generic Whip Breaks: ----- On 3: 12 - Same & - Place left foot on right knee and keep head pointed in direction she came from start turning right 3 - Finish turn and WHIP head around. Hip roll through the break ----- On 5: 12 same 34 same Brace her hand with my left hand (my palm against her fist) and do & - Back Left 5 - Back right (Legs apart) hip roll thru break ----- On 7: 7 - & Point ----- On 1: 1 - & Point
Shoulders back, align neck w/spine --------------------- Need to stand on a foot. Balance weight over a single foot, then push off the other leg.

Underarm turn breaks: Other break: & Out Out --------- On 3: 12 - LR - Same - Back, Forward (cross to left) &3 - Scuff left foot on the way past right, bend left knee and PRESS into floor. Left arm went over her head and on her left shoulder, right arm on her hip to lock her in place. 456 - Slow unwind to the right and slowly slide right foot to the left of my left foot an then: 1 - Continue ---------- On 5: Lunge (or other break) ---------- On 1: Lunge (or other break)

Remember: on Chasse: Ankles up, Knees bent. Remember to brush foot before going forward or back. HEAD LEFT! Spotlight left Elbows pulled out above shoulder level. DON'T TWIST SHOULDERS. be sure you get onto each foot fully. On spin turn: feet: 1RS = Heal-toe forward 2LQ = Toe side 3RQ = Toe heal together (or slightly back) wind up!
4LS = Back pivot (ball) 5RS = Forward (HEAL-TOE) leave right toe back and on floor for balance 6LS = Back toe-heal
Continue w/Progressive chasse.

1R - Back 2L - Side 3R - Diag (Get FULLY on left foot) START OCHO LEAD HERE (Before she puts her heel down) Lead her to do a back ocho (to her left) and then step BACK aL - Back Lead her to do a back ocho (to her right) and then step FORWARD bR - Cross right in front of left and then step FORWARD R 4L - Forward 5R - Together 678LRL - Forward, side, together

Remember to settle in hip (especially on slow) ---- Timing is: QQS - Finish with standing leg straight, settled in hip. ------ Whip (both whips) technique changes: 1L - Back 2R - Forward cross (lead her left turn by turning my left hand to face and pushing it to my left) 3L - ++++BACK!!!!!++++++++ &R - Replace 4L - (A)Cross slot (she is in my right shoulder, right hand on her right hip, left hand on her left shoulder) This leaves you very close to your partner 5R - Forward 6L - Forward 7R - Sail &L - or 8R - Shuffle

--- 1-4 Same as regular locked whip --- 1L - Back 2R - Forward (cross) 3L - ++BACK++ &R - Close right to left 4L - Cross slot -------- She is in my right hip and shoulder 5R - Forward (lead her back, and then spin her 360 deg while I...) 6L - BACK PIVOT across the slot onto my left (she is in my left hip and shoulder) ---- Finish with regular whip finish 7R - Forward (lead her back) 8L - Cross slot and turn to face her 9&0 - Tri-ple-step
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1-4 same as regular locked whip-- 1R - Forward 2L - Forward 3R - Forward &L - Together 4R - Back 5L - Post on left and do 360 deg back pivot onto 6R - Land 7L - Back 8R - Back 9&0LRL - Tri-ple-step

DanceStep.Comment: 1-6 Start with a shortened whip to close: 1L - Back 2R - Forward (block her so she turns into closed) 3&4 - Tri-ple-forward (in closed) 5&6 - Tri-ple-back (in closed) -------- Now do free tuck turn ---- Let go of left hand 1L - Forward (Open her up to step back) 2R - Back (Lead her to step forward) 3 Tap L - Press right fingers in so she tucks 4 Step L - Open right fingers so she does a tuck double on 5&6 RLR - Tri-ple-step (she does pad-dle-turn)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1-6 obvious ----- 1R - Forward 2L - Forward 3R - Forward &L - Cross 4R - Post on R 5&6 - Paddle turn

DanceStep.Comment: Starts like a sugar: 1L - Back 2R - Together (Wind her up slightly with my left hand [to my left]) 3 & Lead her to my right (so she crosses and winds up) 4 - Flat left palm against hers and left to the (my) left of her her so she can: 5&6 - Pad-dle-turn (halo her head)

Natural, Spin Turn to Outside partner: RLR - SQQ - HT,T,TH - Forward, Side, Together LRL - SSS - TH, HT, TH - Continue rotation right - Back, Forward (into stall) - Back (Wait for end of 6 to place heal down) Right Shoulder lead back (she is outside partner) RLR - QQS - Back, lock left in front of right, back - Stay in CBMP LRL - SQQ - HT, T, TH - Back, Dig in right TOE for a quick and push off 90 deg to my left, straight CBMP left shoulder lead (forward) for outside partner (she is on my right). RLR - SQQ - HT, T, TH - Forward, Side, Together (Natural) LRL - SQQ - (Spin turn)

Break on 3: 12 Same ( Back left, open right) 3 - Sink deeply into left left, face your partner, keep left hand close (she should change footwork from 3& to &4) 456 - Slowly raise up and change weight to left foot --------- Break on 5: Lunge, out-out, hop back --------- Break on 7/1 Same.

1 - R - Back 2 - L - Open to Promenade 3 - R - Step ----- Hard lead to side (left) abc - Unwind and change weight to L ----- 5 - R - Forward 6 - L - Forward (normal 5678 tango finish) 7 - R - Side 8 - L - Together
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Her footwork for abc a - R - Side (facing partner) b - L - Cross in front c - R - Side (5 is cross behind which brings her back)

DanceStep.Comment: Quarter turn, Progressive Chasse, Forward lock: SQQ - (Left Shoulder lead) - Forward R HT, Forward L Toe, Lock behind R Toe Natural (Normal [not outside partner]) SQQ Spin Turn SSS Reverse Lock: QQS Running Finish SQQ Progressive chasse: SQQ

Entrance: Progressive chasse: SQQS - Back - side - together - side (L) Q& Forward R and skip, turn right Q& Backard L and (back) skip right Slide Right and stop on right with left foot to side. ----- Start charleston on right, with left foot to left side. left to front, toes pointed out Left to left, toes pointed in left to back, toes pointed out Left to left, toes pointed in STEP left to front Toes pointed out Right to right, toes in right to front, toes out Right to right, toes in STEP right to back, toes out REPEAT -------- to exit: on foot touch to right, STEP forward 7 (R) Q Step forward (L) Q, -------to Natural: R Forward S , etc.

Break on 1: out-out, jump back, or lunge. Break on 3: Very similar to Sugar Tuck (but hold on 3 and unwind slowly) 1 - Back L (same) 2 - Back R (Instead of small back) &3 - Scuff (L) press (L) Left Hand is open, leading her into a: slow (5678) turn (nice to do a salsa hip roll before leading her out on: 1) Break on 5: out-out, jump back, or lunge.

Back R Side L SIDE R (Lead her to rotate left into a back ocho) Together (touch) L ---Ochos: Side L, Touch R Side R, Touch L --- Forward Side L, Touch R Side R, Touch L ---- Both Side L, Step R Cross (to left) R, Touch L ---- Out Forward R Forward L Together R . Forward L, Side R, Together L

--------Break on 3 12 - Same - Back L, forward diag R &3 - Scuff L, Press L, Right hand on her Right hip, left Hand on her left shoulder 4 - Step on R, Lead her slowly back where she started (release left hand, lead her back from right hip) 5 - Cross L foot diag backwards 6 - Replace R 1 = Back L --------Break on 5: 12 - Same - Back L, forward diag R 3&4 - Same Triple across the slot (a little farther that usual) 5 Step deeply onto right foot (place my hand on her back to keep her from going back) 678 Slowly release her to go back ---or--- 678 Prep her with left hand to turn 1.5 turns left and be open (we are l-l mid body height) --------Break on 7 Lunge/out-out/pop --------Break on 9/1 Lunge/out-out/pop
Be DOWN in your knee on 3. Push your TOE straight back on 1, keep your spine vertical

Go back and forth across the slot: ------------- Left side pass: 12 - same - Back, open to side 3&4 - Facing sideways - Back L, Replace R (don't move), Forward (accross slot) L. 5&6 - Step pivot R, Replace L, Cross in front R. 1 - Straighten and move back ------------- Two-hand tuck: SAME footwork.
12345 - same, except tap on 5 6 - Step wide R (she does forward ocho) 7 - forward ocho 8 - forward ocho 9 - forward ocho 0 - forward ocho (I follow her and make her crusada) 789 - Finish

R-R Do tuck, connect L-L under 123&45&6 (tuck footwork) R-R, L-L R under ---- STAY facing the same way until you start turning 123&4 Lead her forward toward me lead my left hand over my head, lower my right hand and grab her wrist (lightly) step across to my right I I lead her left, place my arm over her head and circle backwards for: 56 78 90 Transfer from my left arm to my right on 11&12, then free spin her out on: 123&45&6, optionally, I can spin right on 5&6.
123&4 same: Open facing diag to the slot, on 5&6 either do: back, replace, forward OR (forward break) Forward, replace, back Then square on 1
12 Back Side 3 Together (Lead her diag) back A (I step Left) Side (Lead her to do a back ocho to the right) B Back ocho C back ocho D Back ocho 4 Forward right 5 Crusada 678 Std ending

456 - rlr - Change step Setup from a back basic Left turn: 456 - lrl - Left turn (underturn so you are backing line of dance) 123 - rlr - Back (Toe heal), Forward (UP - HEAL-TOE), Side (down, Toe-heal) 456 - lrl - BACK (Toe heal), BACK (TOE), SIDE (open to my left) (diag wall) outside partner ----- Finish with natural (starting outside partner) 123 - rlr

Start from a left turning basic: 123 - lrl 456 - rlr (underturn facing WALL) 123 - lrl - Forward, side-back (keep her moving backing line of dance) and, plunk her 4&56 - rlrl - Forward (heal toe), Side (Toe), Side (Toe), Forward (diag wall) Toe-heal (you must turn her from facing line of dance to backing line-of-dance) 123 - rlr - (Start a natural)
RAISE on your toe on 2 Close SLOWLY on 2 close on 3 (this is not vienesse) Sway towards inside of turn

Generic whip + 12 - Same 3&4 - same 56 Turn her 1/2 turn (same as usual) and I ALSO TURN and WALK R, L Down the slot 7&8 - Same or Step pivot R (perp to slot), Replace L, Cross in front R or Keep walking her and remain in closed (and tuck out)

Same as previous move, until C: R Back, L Side R Together (Lead her back) L Side - Lead her into back ocho and then DOWN, so she stays on her right (back) foot R Forward/Side (on right side of her forward foot) L Together - On other side of her foot R Side (open up) to my left (May want to release my right hand from behind her back to her upper arm) -- From her she is standing on her left foot and with her right she can: Draw circles Shoe polish Develope Kick inside my left until she starts to do (forward) ochos again and I do: close, 6, 7, 8

R-R 12 - Back - open to side 3&4 - Lead down to right hand on shoulder, thumb down (** alternate ** back, back, back to turn her all the way around **) 567890 - Prance (on 10, wind her up) 11&12 - Double her right ----- Underarm turn: 1 - Kick left &2 - Step L and forward R. 3&4 - Forward, Cross, pivot (facing her) 5&6 - Triple step

12 - Whip same 3&4 - same (stay closed) 56 - Merengue walk forward 78 90 11 12 - Pulse (tap) back right, step right (she pulses back) 1 2 - step L, step R (she steps back to prep for tuck) 3 4 - Tap L, Step L (she does, step & cross [of tuck]) 5 & 6 - Triple step RLR (she does double to finsh tuck)

Spin turn
Wider step on 2 Close slowly (to 3) on 3 land on toe and lower
On Wisk: Lead her DOWN not BACK (so she stays balanced) Keep my neck straight but stay left

Basic throwout: 3&4 5&6 +++ Same left pass footwork: 12 - Back, open - Start to raise left hand, single finger should 3&4 - Halo her head as she turns 1.5 turns to her left 5&6 - Lower hand --- or turn her around by: 12 - Back, BACK (I turn hard left) 3&4 - Back, back, side (keep turning left) 5&6 - Send her out (she ends up where she started) --- or (whip-like) variation 12 - Back, BACK (I turn hard left) 3&4 - Back, back, side (I'm now on the left (her right)) 56 - Forward R, Replace L (She does forward, back) 7&8 - Triple step (she slides back into slot)

Two hand hold in open: 12 - Back, B A C K (diag out of slot). Lead her forward 3&4 - Stop her with right hand, left hand to her shoulder (CBMP) 56 - Dont move, lead her FORWARD, and turn her left (she should circle her foot and wind up left) I am sitting back on my left leg, arms entended to: &7&8 - Don't move, Lead her forward and have her 1.5 moving pivots (ppp+l) to her left (lead with my left [to your right] hand) 9&10 - Triple in place

Basic: Left shoulder forward and hips facing diag center, Heal lead... 1(brush) 2(step) Left forward, 3(brush) 4 (step) Right forward, (5 6) right SIDE, left together, hold 7 8, (and step LEFT on 1) To open for Promenade, Rotate your body rightwards and lead her behind your right side on 6! Promenade (Left shoulder forward, look over left shoulder): 1(brush) 2(step) Left forward, 3(brush) 4 (step) Right CLOSE HER ON 4, 5 Right forward, 6 Side, 7 Together, Hold 8

Foot catcher: 1 back R 2 side 3 together 4 side (she starts back ocho) 5 touch R together 6 right side 7 L touch together 8 FORWARD DIAG LEFT 9 - HOOK her foot and move it 10 - Bring her foot back 11 - Left together (Keep her away from me as we SPIN RIGHT) 12 - Back RIGHT 13 Diag Forward L (Tan- 14 - go 15 - close ----Spinner 1 - Back R 2 - Side L 3 - FORWARD R (cut her right foot off) and make her cross 4 - forward L 5 - forward R 6 - DON'T STEP, move forward and she crosses --- repeat ---Exit with tan-go-close --or: Lead her side (to my left) Cut her off (my left foot forward to her left - inside to inside) Side right Hook behind left --Slowly walk backwards and spin her until: Lean back (right back left together) (She is leaning on me) Left forward (she doesn't step) Right Forward (diag) Left Forward (crusada) tan-go-close

From closed: Triple Triple --- 12 - Back, Open to side left palm up and then over MY head as I circle around her 3&4 - forward, forward, turn 90 deg right and step back to face her. (make sure I lead her all the way around the corner behind me) (She ends up where she started) 5&6 - Tri-ple step

12 Back, open 90 deg. Left hand up and close to me, right hand down and away. 3&4 - Do advanced footwork (back, replace, FORWARD (diag across slot)) 5&6 - Forward push off and pivot, replace, forward (back onto slot) --- & - Turn to face her (no step) 1 - Back
12 - Back, open ---- Keep hands LOW and brace her with my left hand so she can free spin 180 deg or 1.5 revs 3&4 - Nothing fancy 5&6 - Same

R-R, L-L over THUMBS DOWN 12 - Back, back 3&4 - Triple (around her) (left over head, right hand down and then behind back, wrist hold) 56 - Back, Back circling her 78 - Same 910 - Same 11&12 - Triple in place, slide left hand down her arm as she backs out.
----- or free spin ending 9 10 - Reach right hand across her front and then on her shoulder to 11&12 - Pull toward me, so she free-spins (180 or 1.5 revs)
My footwork is the same, except I Stay behind her on 3&4 because she holds my hand on her left shoulder
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 12 - Forward, Forward &3&4 - (rotate 90 deg left) Step side, tap in, Step side (L), tap in &5&6 - (rotate leftwards) Step, Step behind, Step, Step in front End up in slot facing 90 deg to left -------- (&)1 - Rotate 90 deg left (on left), and step forward R

DanceStep.Comment: Head STRAIGHT, and UP! -------Basic Variations: When opening to promenade, Rotate 45 deg right and rotate her 3/8 to face her down the line of dance. -------Back tango close: 1 - L - Same 23 - Forward L, Cut her off R and pivot around to face her +tango close 4 - Back L 56 - LR - Side, Together ---------OCHO: Make sure have your RIGHT side forward before trying this: 1Q - Forward L 23Q - SIDE R 34S - L Side and behind right, the switch her from closed to promenade 56S - R Promenade, then close (AGAIN, Turn your hips to have your RIGHT side forward) +repeat 1Q - Forward L 23Q - SIDE R 34S - L Side and behind right, the switch her from closed to promenade 56S - R Promenade, then close (AGAIN, Turn your hips to have your RIGHT side forward) + Tango close 1QL Forward 2QR Side 3SL Close
Same as regular tuck, but right hand goes high and over her head (instead of left) (leaves us in R-L hand hold)

Similar to sugar-push: 12 Back, Back 3 Start winding her slightly to my right 4 Turn my body slightly to the left, right hand low and slightly forward (since my body is turned), left hand up and IN (TOUCHING MY LEFT SHOULDER) 56 - Lead her to triple 1 full turn to her right

DanceStep.Description: R-L Left side pass var - Free Spin
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Open left (this makes her wind up on 1, so she can start her pivot on 2) 3&4 - Make a small circle to make her spin 5&6 - Triple (as she spins left)

DanceStep.Description: R-L Left side pass var - Wrap w/ release
DanceStep.Comment: R-L 12 3&4 - Just like free spin, but DO NOT let go of right hand, and step across slot (to R) --connect my hands to the front of her hips and lead her backward 5&6

DanceStep.Description: R-L Left side pass var - Wrap w/ unwrap
DanceStep.Comment:
12 3&4 - Same as left side pass, except keep R-L hand. --- Get next to her (to her left) and unwrap her LEFTwards with my right forearm 5&6 Connect to her left HIP (slide my hand around) and prepare to: 7&8 - Have her spin RIGHTwards DOWN the slot 9&10 - Let go as she continues to spin rightwards to face me
OR
9&10 - Do not let go with my left hand and REVERSE her spin on 9&10 5&6 - Continue pattern
Closed basic: 3&4 5&6 --- 12 - Open up (lead her back or in place) &3 - Lead her to wind up 4 - Let 56 - Her go.

--stop and go? 1 - L Forward 23 - R Forward 4 - L Break forward 5 - R Break Back 67 - L Step Forward 8 - R Break Forward 9 - L Break Back 1011 - R Step Forward 1213 - Tan 14 go 1516 close --Open Move (From Promenade) 1 - L Forward 2 - R Break forward (open her up) 3 - L Step Diag toward her 4 - Pivot left and step through the middle 5 - Turn her to face me 678 - Tan-go-close

DanceStep.Description: Tuck Variations - Two hands over + Basket whip
DanceStep.Comment: Two hand tuck - Two hands over: Remember - Both hands Fingers to Fingers: 12 - Back, Open 3&4 - Prep, Two hands Over 56 - Lead her straight forward (left wrist bent down to clear her head), Catch her shoulders 78 - Lead her straight back like basket whip (right hand slides down arm to catch two hands) 9&10 - Triple in place

DanceStep.Description: Tuck Variations - Hammerlock to Underarm turn
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Back, open (right hand straight down) 3&4 - Into Hammerlock 56 - Lead her forward like a underarm turn, but KEEP both hands 7&8 - Triple in place

DanceStep.Description: Tuck Variations - Shake hand hold to left side pass
DanceStep.Comment: Shake hand hold - (R-R) 12 - Back, open (Right elbow UP to signal that she will be going under) 3&4 - Triple then open (to prep for side pass) --- Left Side pass (Remember to look DOWN the slot) or --- Free Spin: 5 - Prep her out slightly 6 - Flick wrist down to 7&8 - Free spin her 9&10 - Anchor in place

DanceStep.Description: Tuck Variations - Inside spin to shadow, spin out
DanceStep.Comment: L-R Hold: 12 - Lead her forward (like an underarm turn), then flick hand down to spin her right 180 deg. Catch her: Right hand on back, left hand over her left hand & - Prep her back 3&4 - (she) Pivot, Pivot, Pivot (left) 5&6 - Triple in place

To change from forward on 1 to backwards on 1, Drop slightly into your knees on 8 ++ 12S - L Back, open hips hard left so she is in promenade (Toes still facing same direction) 34S - R Step forward and pivot to face her 56S - Repeat (starting facing the opposite direction as 12, but repeat same pattern) 78S - Repeat 12S - Repeat 34S - Repeat 567 - Back Tan-go-Close hold 8

Basic to 5, but don't step right, tap behind right. Lead her forward like a forward ocho, but hook her right foot with my right foot. Pedal a few times. Turn her right, then left to signal end. Lead her to forward ocho, then right turn.

Basic to 5 Step BACK Left, Lead her to do a forward ocho (to my right) Cross Right in front of left, so she can forward ocho in front of me (right to left). Step FORWARD RIGHT in FRONT (left of) of her left foot to block her and lead her to step forward as I unwind and ronde with with left leg. Step forward LEFT behind (right of) her foot and lead her to forward OCHO - she kicks her right shin into my left leg. Lead her back and forward a few times, then Lead her across my foot to my RIGHT. Cross RIGHT behind left and unwind while leading a right turn, then close

DanceStep.Description: Whip variations - Open Whip + spin variation
DanceStep.Comment:
Same (locked whip) footwork - Let go, catch her right hip w/my right (open) hand and lead her backwards on 4
--- spin variation: Place my left hand on her left shoulder, open her up on 6 after she steps back left (on 5), so she can triple-turn right.

DanceStep.Description: Whip variations - Inside whip, Outside turn (+double)
DanceStep.Comment: Generic whip variations: ----------Inside whip Lead straight left, elbow up ----------Outside turn (+double) Flat hand-to-Hand bring arm close to my left side and lead her to single or double.

Generic whip, on 5, I continue spinning RIGHT Left hand to pizza waiter, then release her hand at my neck Catch her hand with my right hand open, palm up --- nice following move: lead her forward, and I rotate LEFT as she passes, same technique, finish L-R

DanceStep.Description: Whip to open position so lady can play
DanceStep.Comment: Generic whip, but sweep left hand in a large cirlce, as I open left and step down the slot (and remain on the rail---change to R-R hold) -- lead her slowly down the slot

Start DIAG-center Left Turn/Reverse: Him: SQQ - LRL - Forward, SIDE (Rotate HIPS hard left Across the slot to cut her off), Back (down the LOD) Her: Back, Side, Forward Feather Finish: Him: SQQ - RLR - Back, OPEN HIPS LEFT step side (down LOD), Cross R across L Little Toes Hit First to (CBMP hard right hips FACING my partner) Head in dir of travel (Diag-wall) Her: Forward, Side (R), Back (CBMP right) Head facing reverse line of travel Twinkle: Him: SQQ - LRL - Forward, Forward HEAL-TOE Connect with her thigh (my r to her l) (CBMP HARD RIGHT so she is behind me) into promenade, Forward (Diag center or more rotation for a corner) Her: Back, Back, BRUSH then, Forward Feather: Him: SQQ - RLR - Forward, Forward (Close her NOW), Forward (into closed position) Her: Forward, Pivot Left to Face him, Back To prepare for a left turn now I should winding up by already starting a HARD CBMP to my LEFT ----- Technique: Heal-Toe, Toe, Toe-Heal Compress and Push Extend Thigh on Back-Steps DO NOT FLATTEN FOOT UNTIL YOU BRUSH! Stay left Head left, rotate head on spine to turn it.

Locked whip to 4: 12 3&4 Bring her in very close straighten left hand (straight down) 5 Open left and flick her hand across her back to my right hand (right hand Thumb down, palm to the right) 6 She continues turning (to Face me) --- Two options: 7&8 Hand her right hand to my left hand and anchor --- Or Keep R-L, 7&8 Anchor 1 Lead her forward 2 Flick hand across (away from me across the slot) and down 3 Catch her shoulder 4 Into closed 56 - Regular locked- 7&8 whip ending --- Or (Level 3) On 5 - Place my left hand on the front of her left hip (to stop her spinning) 7 Hook behind right (and start rotating backwards) 8 Raise her right hand and place it on my shoulder 9 10 - Back, Back 11&12 - Slide hand down and anchor. ------- ALT ENDING: 10 Push right hand straight out, rotate right and 11&12 Lead her to rotate right once.

1 - Back R 2 - Back L 3 - Back R- Start opening right 4 - Cross behind L, Open shoulder hard right, she is in promenade (she steps behing) 5 - Hook R hard right and behind, she steps side she steps in front x - I STEP to the right of her right foot as she pivots right She steps side Left x - I PLACE MY FOOT (NO WEIGHT) to the right of her left foot x - She slides my foot right (rightwards) x - I sandwich her foot with mine and STEP BACK right x - She slides my right foot left ...

L - S - Diag Wall R - Q - Diag Wall L - Q - Turn to Diag Center (brush and step diag-center) --- R - S - Diag Center L - Q - Diag Center R - Q - Turn to Diag Wall (brush and step diag-center) ---- Exit L - S - Diag Wall R - Q - Diag Wall L - Q - Turn to all the way to B-LOD --- R - S - Step and let her out, so she can do a: Hold Right - QQ - (She developee) --- Spin? L - Q - Back R - Q - Forward (in a circle) L - Q - Forward R - Q - Forward -- now facing backing line of dance -- Back twinkle L - S - Back R - Q - Next to L, CBMP, hard right L - Q - Forward
R-R - Start an underarm turn: 1 Back L 2 Forward Diag right, place back of right hand on her left shoulder 3&4 - Roll and lock as she does back, together, forward 5 - Open left 6 - Step 7&8 - Anchor
Generic Whip to 4 5 - Open right and rotate more so I am facing down the slot 6 - Step SIDE LEFT 7&8 Triple in place (we are now in closed)
Whip to 4 Place my left hand (holding her hand) on my left HIP 5 Open right 6 step 7&8 Turn around, let go of her hand and rotate one rev to the right
Whip to 4 Lower LEFT hand and continue turning her, 5,6 Catch her on her right arm and left shoulder. she Steps left, right 78 she Steps left, right wind her up 9&10 - LRL - 1.5 spins to her right.
RL - Forward, Forward (drag L behind - wind up hips slightly right) LR - Fan with R and Step R LRL - Back, cross in front, back

Lead her to step forward to my left, then I shift to my RIGHT. Lead her to do the pattern: Side, back, side, forward, then I cross behind with my left I unwind then polish shoe R behind L as she does side, forward, side, back Exit on her back.. I step forward R L - Forward R - Side (she steps side) L - Step behind (She steps forward) R - Together (She forward ochos then steps forward) L - Turn her to face me 789 - Tan-go-close

DanceStep.Description: Whip Variations - Sugar to Roll and Lock
DanceStep.Comment: Sugar to R-L: 1 Back 2 Flick her hand out to right 3&4 - Roll and Lock 56 - Finish 7&8 - Whip

1 - S (Don't step) 2 - Heal 3 - Toe (Q) 4 - Toe-Heal (Q) 5 - KNEE (Sink into knee to slow down) (SL-) 6 - Step Toe-Heal (-OW) ------------ Pattern: ------------ Outside partner left: R - Q - Forward - Heal, up to Toe - Pivot right (about 90 deg) to outside partner right L - Q - Brush, then Back - Toe - Heal - Knee R - Q - Back - Toe - Pivot left (about 90 deg) to outside partner left L - Q - Brush, then Forward - Toe, heal, KNEE REPEAT

DanceStep.Description: Whip Variations - Whip to Free Spin
DanceStep.Comment: Whip to 4. 5 Open Left 6 Release left, bring my right hand toward me 7&8 She free spins to her right
Whip to 4 Right hand on my hip. 5 - L Lift my foot over hers and place next to mine 6 - Step across R (Turn a FULL 180 L) Repeat until throw out x&y - Triple step

DanceStep.Description: Whip Variations - Locked Whip to Ladies Free Spin
DanceStep.Comment: Locked whip to 4: 5 - Forward R on her left side 6 - Replace L, LOWER LEFT HAND 7 - Step across to the R 8 - Forward L (Lead her back) 9 - Start to unwind her w/my left hand 10 - She 11&12 Turns to her left.

DanceStep.Description: Whip Variations - Whip to Underarm turn
DanceStep.Comment: Whip to 4: 5R - Step Forward diag left to get out of the slot - Lift her arm over my head and drop it to my left shoulder 6L - Turn and replace Left foot (prepare to wind up) 7&8 - Spin to the left, finish turned ACROSS the slot, FACING down the slot -- side pass out

Instead of close on 5, cross left behind right Lead her forward, block her foot (right of) with my left block her next foot with my right block her next foot with my left foot Lead her to forward ocho, close her and Tan-go-close

Forward right Side left Diag back right (she forward ocho) Lead her forward (from my right to left) Lead her side and block her foot (left of) Lead her back Lead to to back ocho (block the right of her foot) Lead her forward (left to right) Lead her side Lead her to forward ocho Close her Tan-go-close

From? could start from a back RB L forward into promenade R Forward in prom L Side R Back * Turn her to face me LF + turn 90 deg RB + turn 90 deg repeat and take her out into ocho LF Ocho RF Ocho and drive her forward to close. + tan-go-close

Spiral: Diag-wall - Feather to Promenade: 1S L - Diag-wall 2Q R - Between her legs 3Q L - CBM to Promenade (pointing LOD) --- 1S R - Straight step, Pivot right 2Q L - Side, then Pivot all the way around LOD 3Q R - Step down LOD --- Repeat--

Feather to Spiral (underturn so I'm facing center) QR - Forward QL - Pivot 90 deg left and step back -- repeat 8 counts out: R S - Forward, move her to closed L Q - Center (step between her legs) move her to right L Q - into promenade ----

DanceStep.Description: Whip Variations - Inside Whip to Tandem Free Spins
DanceStep.Comment: Whip to 4 12 3& 4 - Lead an Inside whip 56 Swing arm down and forward, so we both spin on 7&8 (I spin left, she spins right)
Basic to 3 1 - BR 2 - SL 3 - Diag FR --- L - Forward R - Side L - Back -- R - Back L - Side R - Forward -- Exit 4 - L Forward 5 - R Forward (Crusada) 678 - Tan-go-close

L-R Left over on 3 (Pizza waiter), Right palm stops her --- or: R-R Right over on 3 (Sweep R hand under to slide down her arm), Left hand stop her hip. --- Either one can add a man turn. 3 - Start to turn & 4 - Turn away to right 5&6 - Finish turn (to R)

Starting R-R or L-R Turned R side toward lady, facing across the slot: 1 - SL 2 - Cross in front R 3 - SL & - Replace R 4 - Cross in front L 5 - Side R (Toward lady) & - Replace L 6 - Side L -- Square to partner here or on 1
