Underarm footwork: R-R: 1 - BL 2 - F Diag R 3&4 - Raise my R and place it behind my head, turn L 90 deg, catch her shoulder with my left hand We are both facing across the slot --- 3 endings ---: ---1: Ladies free spin: Let go of R 5 R - Lead her Forward (and start her turning R) 6 L - Step back as she: 7&8 - Triples in place ---2: Ladies outside turn: (Same lead as previous, but guide her and halo her as she spins) ---3: Arm turn? 5 R - I hook behind R and turn 90 deg R 6 L - Back slightly L and straighten R arm, look at lady 7&8 - Lead her to turn 180 deg to her R (not a double as in the previous patterns)

Same foot work as Spiral: Diag-wall - Feather to Promenade: 1S L - Diag-wall 2Q R - Between her legs 3Q L - CBM to Promenade (pointing LOD) - Release left hand --- 1S R - Straight step, Pivot right 2Q L - Side, then Pivot all the way around LOD (Hug her) 3Q R - Step down LOD --- 1S L - Step LOD (start leading her across) 2Q R - She pivots across the front of me 3Q L - She steps forward
--------Technique points------ Always BRUSH (especially on 3R-Before steping forward) DO NOT step (or swing my leg) side on 3R (check my rotation on step forward)
-------Develope tech points:------ on 3L - Sink into knee (as I usually would since the next step is a S) on 1R S - NO H-T, land on a flat sideways foot and immediately sink into the knee to KEEP HER FROM BRUSHING. Straighten my R leg slowly so she can develope
---- Tech: ---- Remember every LEFT step should be large/strong

Normal hand hold (L-R) 12 - Same 3&4 - After she turns, KEEP her close and go to pizza waiter, then headloop 5&6 - Triple in place into closed (right hand on her back) --- typically side pass her out
--- R-R 12 - Same 3&4 - Head loop myself, on 4 catch her back with my left hand 5&6 - Triple across and catch her back with my right hand -- Side pass or tuck her out

DanceStep.Description: Left Side Pass variations - Ladies Free spin
DanceStep.Comment: 1 Open to left (Lead her to step to her left by leading my hand out) 2 -- Do a circle around her waist to free spin her out 3&4 5&6 - Triple in place

Left side pass variation: 12 - reach across and Catch her elbow with my right hand and raise her right arm (bend her elbow) with my left hand 3&4 - Pull her elbow towards me and halo her head 5&6 - Triple in place

DanceStep.Description: Left Side Pass variations - Reverse whip
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Free spin lead 3&4 - Step-acc-ross and Keep hooked into her hand (with my right hand) and catch her waist with my palms 56 - Lead her back from the hip, step back into the slot and turn to face her 7&8 - Triple in place

DanceStep.Description: Left Side Pass variations - Wrap and unwrap
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Lead like a free spin 3&4 - Keep her hand with my R, and FOLLOW HER down the slot, so my forearm is pressed against her back 5&6 - Lead her FORWARD down the slot with my forearm and unwrap her (leftwards) and begin: & (No step, PREP HER TO FREE SPIN) 7&8 - Free spin her back down the slot (I can tandem spin) 9&10 - Triple in place.

Basic to 4 1 R B 2 L Side 3 R Diag back 4 L Diag back
then, Lead back ocho: 1 R B 2 L Side 3 R Together (Lead her back diag) 4 L TAP BEHIND (Lead her to back ocho a few times, then lead her side [start of a left turn]) 5 Left Step Forward (Lead her to step forward across to my left) 6+ Lead her to do a left turn (side, back, side, forward) until she is going back, and BLOCK her foot with my foot. (Right side of her right foot with left side of my left foot) Lead her to step right to my left, then Kick right, sandwich right, sandwich left, open right and repeat --- Exit by having her doing a forward ocho then tan-go-close

Basic- - Remember latin hold - Start side (4&1) Spot turn: Release her (my right hand) on right foot basic (release on forward 3) Do cumbia on left foot (Right side) basic and lead her to spot turn (on my right foot basic) --- Open break --- Reverse break (Remember to step straight down-- NOT BACK)

Lead her like a sombrero, but with only right hand: R-R DRAW LEAD: 1 L Back 2 R Together 3 L Side (open right 90 deg.), Raise my hand open palm to check her motion and get her to start pivoting --- 1 R Small back (as I lead her to single or double pivot) 2 L (She is still pivoting) 3 R Replace (open the shower door - sweep and down and through) -- Two endings: ----1---- Box 1 L - Cross in Front 2 R - Side 3 L - Back (Raise her arm over my head and place on my shoulder) (My right arm goes behind her back) --- Switch her to my right arm 1 R - Back 2 L - Cross in front 3 R - Side -- Now I can swivel and cross-body lead her out
-- Alterate beginning: -- Cross body into shadow: R-R 1 L Back - pull her forward 2 R Back 3 L Side Hand on her shoulder, thumb down - 1 Lead her forward 2 Back 3 Lead her OUT TO MY RIGHT to wind her up for her triple
Work on footwork, articulation
STAY LEFT Rotate your head as if you are looking around the corner. DON'T HOP = Footwork SWAY! Raise hip that is in the direction of travel. Learned: Right turn Left turn

Cross body to open,
Hammerlock, by leading her forward. 1 = Forward 2 = open left, on 2 = raise left hand flat palm on 3 lower and turn right hand, she does (R) pivot, pivot, pivot, land
Lead her to cumbia, but leading her hip back on 1, fwd on 2, face her on 3
Then do: Disco turns (remember to maintain body contact) also, CUMBIA, do not step BACK
To exit, do hook turn (after stoping her by placing my R hand on her back)

DanceStep.Description: Right side pass variation, Man's right turn
DanceStep.Comment: Normal right side pass to 4 12 3&4 - Hold her back a little, and raise my left hand 5&6 - Triple-left-turn under my hand

DanceStep.Description: Right side pass variation, Man's left turn
DanceStep.Comment: Normal right side pass to 4 12 3&4 - Hold her back a little, and raise my left hand in pizza waiter and close my elbow to my chest 5&6 - Triple-right-turn under my hand
R-R 12 - Lead her forward, Lead her down in a loop and 3&4 - around my shoulder. place my left hand on her back 5&6 - switch across the slot and place my right hand on her back
L-R 12 - Lead her forward, bend her arm up and pull her elbow toward me 3&4 - Go to pizza waiter and rotate rightward under my hand 5&6 - Anchor-in-place

Go to closed basic: L-R 1 Forward - Step her back to wind her up 2 Open Left - Step her forward to start PIVOT (right) Start roll and lock 3&4 - Back, replace, FORWARD diag accross slot (roll and lock) 5 right Pivot right foot, facing away from her (we are both moving DOWN the slot) 6 Bring my left hand back toward my shoulder to keep her from turning again and Pivot RIGHT down the slot 7&8 - Side, cross in front, back
----- Different ending: 7&8 - continue by rotating right 1 more rev., and pass her hand from L-R-to L

Basic to 4, tap behind with right foot lead her forward to my left While I step forward with my right foot She does 8 steps of left turn (Forward, side, back, side, etc) while I clean my right shoe, then hook my left behind my right and unwind, when we are facing each other and place my outside foot on the inside of her outside foot. Lead her forward, then kick, step (sand), step (wich), step back and open. Lead her forward again and repeat, to stop: Lead her forward and face her. Brace her and have her move right and left, she kicks between my legs. Lead her to forward ocho, then tan-go-close

basic to 5- but lead her out far (away from me) on 5. right foot Ronde, lead her forward to my right, then slide my right foot to the inside of her back foot. Lift her back foot, then drop it. Lead her back onto that (her left) foot, and twist her leftward (she kick her foot back). Lead her rightward, to back ocho, then side, forward ocho, close her, then tan-go-close

1234&1 - Cross body 1234&1 - Fan - R forward, L replace, (cuban cross) cross right in front of left, replace right, push side as you send her out into Fan (she is facing me, I am facing forward) Lead her elbow straight forward and look at her in the window. Lead her down the hockey stick two steps, then turn her 180 deg left to face me. chase her using lock step. Beak forward L toward her, replace R, then do cuban cross L back, side slightly R, Replace L Forward R, Replace L, the (cuban cross) Right in front of L, Replace L, Side right as I lead her into FAN

1234&1 - Basic, start to lead a spot turn 1234&1 - Lead it and pull her hand down and towards me so she is facing me (we are in basic)
--- or
Don't lead her arm hard, so she turns under her own power on 2 turns away, 3 turns toward, I lead her strongly to lock towards me 4&1 and catch her in closed 2 Step strongly forward and lead her back so we are both facing the same way. 3 Turn her back to her right (hip twist) and have her 4&1 lock in place 234&1 - Cross body to fan (forward, back, cuban cross)

DanceStep.Description: Pattern - Wrap her, turkish towel, pivot in front
DanceStep.Comment:
Two entrances: ------------ 1: Sombrero, ta-da finish 123 Turkish towel (remember handwork - heep arm in front of me, one hand at a time) 456 Lead her to turn right into hammerlock ------------ 2: R over L Cross body, wrap her in my direction 1 - Forward 23 - to hammerlock
--- continue pattern:
-- do cross body 123 forward, replace, side 123 Basic in place -- lead down with right hand, she pivots right until she is fully wrapped on my left 123 Jazz box left, lead her across my back to my right and grab her hand 123 - Lead her to pivot across my front and roll and lock her 123 R forward L step R hook in back Go with her around the corner 123 cross body out

Open position 123 Cross body 456 -- Lead Forward (slight) and DOWN with my right hand and block to get her to pivot into me (guide her with my left hand), then hold her on 3 123456 - Lead her forward onto her right foot then ROTATE her onto her left (back) foot and lead DOWN so her can do right pivot (back), pivot, pivot, side 123 - Lead her to cuca- 456 - racha
--- Similar move R-R 123 same 456 - same footwork, lead her into sweetheart (right arm across the back of her shoulder) 123456 - Same same exit

R-R 4&123 - basic to cross check (REMEMBER to keep back foot on ground when you break forward) 4&1 - shasay back and face down the slot 2 - BACK BREAK and lead across and DOWN to get her to 3 - pivot across the slot (I replace) 4&1 - Place my left hand on her back and lock down the slot ---Repeat (Forward check)
-- To exit, lead her to do a spot turn

DanceStep.Description: Cross body to face loop to free spin
DanceStep.Comment: R-R Cross body 234&1 - Cross body to face her 23 Forward, replace (face loop her) 4&1 - take her left hand with my left hand and lead down to get her to pivot, pivot, side continue.

Backward change step Nice to do before reaching the corner. 12cross(3) of left turn 123 Backward change step (make sure to swing-have plenty of wind up) 123 Start right turns (this one is backwards)
---- Also try coming out of the corner ----
Remember: Timing = Slow Quick Quick Keep rotating body at an even pace Release back foot on back basic Deep into knee on 3

Instead of triple step: Tap or Kick (Side, back, or forward)
--- Also - If you end up on the wrong foot : do a ball-change

DanceStep.Description: Kick ball change on side pass
DanceStep.Comment: &1&2 = Lift knee, Kick, ball, step diag forward (best to do a manual lead forward on 1, in case your partner doesn't do a kick-ball-change) 3-6 Same

Underarm turn, to R-R, open left (slot is clear) 1 - Lead her forward 2 - Lead her toward the outside rail 3&4 - Lead down and lower my right hand to put her in hammerlock (she triple-pivots left) My right hand is flat against her hand on her back, my left hand is holding her left hand in front 5 - Lead her to step forward left (as i step forward right), by applying pressure with my palm 6 - Pressure on fingers 7 - same as 5 8 - same as 6 9 - Slight pressure straight forward (I step in place) (loop left hand over her head and turn her to face me) 10 - Now she is straight in front of me R-R under L-R 12 - Lead her toward me and to my right 3&4 - Raise my arms as she passes behind me and across to my left I drop my left arm behind her head and start rotating BACKWARDS 56 - Walk backwards 78 - Same 9&10 - Release her and run my left hand around her back and down her right and connect

DanceStep.Description: Tandem turn away on side pass
DanceStep.Comment: L-R 1 - Lead her straight 2 - Lead her toward the far rail 3&4 - Lead DOWN and turn her hand around (I am still facing down the slot, she has her back to me) 56 - Flair my right leg in a circle and turn to face her (either step on it, or synchopate out on the next step)

Bacic to 5 I step side L (she steps side R) I step diag forward R (she steps back L) I lead her to back ocho (turn, back, side) I rotate right and step side L) I lead her to forward ocho and then tan-go-close
---variation--- After rotating and steping side L, I tap forward (no weight) R as she forward ochos into my leg. I turn her to back ocho and follow her out with my right leg first

Basic to 5, but tap right. Lead her forward to my right Step forward right (weight on right) Rotate hard right (turn her to face same direction as me) and cross left in front on my right (she does the same) Cross my left behind my right and catch the front of her (right) foot. Lead her to step forward left (forward on my right side) Step forward with my right and block the front of her left to make her step side then back Now back ocho her close, then tan-go-close

R-R 2L Break Back 3R Replace 4&1 Forward, Elvis, Side Lead her forward (in an eliptical path) to pivot, pivot, pivot, side (roll and lock her) --- now do natural: 2R Hook behind (make her step side) 3L Side 4R Hook Behind &L Side 1R Elvis --- Optional jazz box around her 2L Forward 3R Side 4L Back &R Back 1L Side connect with her back and do the natural here ... --- Do Hip twist 2L Forward - lead her back don't know steps in her, but she is returned to the same position -- Exit - to Fan R Forward, L replace (Lead her from my right to my left across my front) Cuban cross R cross in front of L, Replace L, Side hard R and lead her to fan with my left hand

Need skill - Lead her to do a full reach turn Several ways to lead her into shadow: 1. R-R L-L over Lead her in a cross body to my right. 2. R-R L-L under Lead her to my right and turn her right on 5 3. Hold hands, cumbia L, Cumbia R into cuddle (right hand loops her), lead her straight out (L-L, R-R), lead her to reach to shadow
When she is in shadow, lead her back (I go forward), replace, to pizza waiter
another way to get to pizza waiter: 4. Lasso (window) - Hold hands, lead right away, left over her head, around and into pizza waiter.
Now do a jazz box all the way around, circle her on first half, lead her to spot turn right on second half
-- To exit, do cumbias in place and then do a progessive cumbia to lead her out

Tandem turn left L-R (I turn first)
R-R (bend elbow in front of face, both turn at once)
Tandem turn right: R-L (bend elbow)
If I turn only, I need to do it quickly so she doesn't get a lead.

DanceStep.Description: R-R L-L Over She pivots, I do reach turn
DanceStep.Comment: Forward break, face her, shasay, Face same direction as her change hands to R-R L-L over 2L - Break BACK, lead down and across my front in an eliptical motion to get her to pivot, (I replace 3R, forward 4L) pivot, forward &1 - Forward, Forward (Lead our hands straight out in front) 2R - Reach turn, take both arms over my head one at a time 3L - replace 4&1 - Lock step down the slot

Roll and Lock L-R 123 - Forward, Back, Back Left hand point thumb down 4 (lead her to turn left on 4) 56 - Chase her --- Finish with a spot turn: 123 Forward, replace, side 456 Spot turn --- or, 123 pizza waiter right hand - spot turn right cucaracha left?

Pendulums: on 3: step (l), step, back
on 2: step (l), back, step
--- Draw lead w/turn on 4
1L Close 2R Back 3L Back - Raise left elbow, thumb down, wind her up to (my) left --456 = Turning (r) jazz box 4R - Hook behind (lead right, so she can pivot left) 5L - Side (turning R) 6R - Forward (curving R)
--- Nice to finish with: pizza waiter (right hand) on 6 123 - Reach turn to face away, set her arm on my shoulder 456 - Reach turn to face her to closed

Right turn: Back to promenade Forward Side (face her) Back Lead her to: Back ocho, side, Forward Ocho --- Now slide my left foot behind my right foot and in front of her back foot so she does a back ocho --- Now push my left foot forward into her other leg and flip her to step sideways Now do a gancho (Right foot hook around the front of her right foot, lead her to step back) Another gancho on the other foot lead her to back ocho, then countine with a right turn to tan-go-close

Notes: Connect by placing my right foot slightly behind my left and pointing it out slightly, then settling into my right hip - This shifts me back slightly and connects me (through my left hand) with my partner.
Notes: Lead should be DONE by 1. Sugar (right hand to lead her back on 4) Underarm turn (lead UP on 1) Left side pass Whip (Generic)
Notes: After pattern do: WALK, WALK instead of leading her out. (Just to make sure she is not charging me)

Generic whip to 4, lower left hand and 56 Open left and pass her hand behind her back 7 Read accross to my left with my left hand and stop her from spinning right (by hooking her elbow) 8 Lead her in the opposite direction, drop my right hand to her hip, then raise it to be shoulder, while I place my left hand on the front of her left hip (Now I have her locked from moving forward or backward - actually, She needs to be far from me so she doesn't think she breaks back) & Pull her forward (TOWARD) me, Then tuck her out 1 Back 2 Replace 3&45&5 - Free Tuck her out

DanceStep.Description: Open her up and reverse whip her
DanceStep.Comment:
Connect L-R 1 Back L 2 Rotate 90 deg left, Back R, lead my L arm forward (to open her to face the same direction as me) 3 Kick Forward L & Ball R 4 Change (forward) R 5 (reach Turn on L) 6 (Replace R) - Raise my L arm (bend my elbow) and reach turn 7&8 - Triple in place to face her
--- Follow with a sugar, or a reverse whip Reverse hand hold = R-L L Back slightly (Hard manual lead - her forward) R Replace ( Push right hand toward her, she turns left 180 deg to closed) 3&45&6 - finish whip

Two hands R-L, L-R --- Lead her forward on my left, to turn right on 5: 123 = Forward, back, open left 4 My right hand to her right shoulder 5 My left hand in front on her (then lead her to turn to her right) 6 - Both hands crossed in front of us ---- to Pizza waiter right hand up, turn to right 123 turn to right, take right hand over my head to my left shoulder 456 Make sure I lift her hand onto my left shoulder with my left hand as I turn to face her.

Butterflys forward and back in open and close (lead on the cha-cha)
--- also
Hand to hand and switches
--- Also turns
Lead on hand-to-hands, double her when she if going forward.

Right turn in Shadow: Left hand in her left (outstretched) hand, right hand (palm/wrist) on her right hip. REMEMBER YOUR SWING! (Downstream hip is high) 123 - Same 456 - On 6 I should have my knees bent under, shoulders behind hips.
------Also: new starter step BACK and UP on 2 Forward and DOWN on 3 GO!

Posture, alignment: Head (Too forward and up) - Rotate down, shift back Shoulders (Too forward, arms rotated in) - Shoulders back, rotate arms slightly out Chest - Expand ribcage (place fingers about 6 inches below armpits) Ribcage - Align with hips Hips - Rotate slightly back (Lizard tail thing)
---Connection--- All connection points are very light, I am pushing THROUGH her Don't lock muscles, until you need them for resistance Keep frame in tact - Don't grab, don't break frame! When I'm going back (ie., Tango), don't pull my arm in (toward's my chest) When I put her in promenade, DONT BREAK MY RIGHT WING

Rotator (slightly different from E&T's): R-R Forward, back, open side Wind her up slightly AFTER (bringing her forward) 3 456 Lead down and in a loop and connect with her back -- 123 - I pivot around her (remember to keep my frame on 1, so she steps slightly back) 456 - Cross-body out
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Back, Forward, Forward - slightly right (wind up) Pivot, Pivot, Pivot -- Back (slight), march, march Cross body out

DanceStep.Comment: Hold Both hands 123 - Forward, back, open left (stop her with my left just after 3 [wind her up]) 456 - STEP IN PLACE (not back), Forward, Forward in CBMP (Lead her forward with my left hand and lead a small circle toward my navel with my right) (we are in a V, I lock her back left hip to my front right hip) 1 Step (do a reach turn) And lead DOWN with my right hand (on her hip) 23 456 she does pivot, etc as I balance her with my left

Prance: 1 - Back 2 - Open left (prep her toward far slot) 3&4 - Lead down and to her back 5R - Step 6L - Step 78 - repeat (Prep her out slightly on 8) 9&10 - Lead DOWN with my right (on her back) and she should double to face me (Possible to single her out)

1 Lead her forward 2 Lead her to my RIGHT place my STRAIGHT right hand across the back of her right arm and 3&4 - Step right across the slot, as I lead her behind me (from right to left) Straighten my RIGHT arm and take it STRAIGHT back and to her back 56 Lead her from my left side to my right (hug) --- Tuck her out

1 Back 2 Back Left hand into pizza waiter 3&4 - Move from the right slot to the left slot, taking MY left hand over MY head
-- Exit 1: 56 7&8 - Left go of her hand behind my back and reach accross right to her right elbow and turn her right 1.5 turns
-- Exit 2: 5 Step back, lead her forward on my right 6 Replace forward, lead her back behind me 7 Lead her back across my back 8 to my left 910 Turn Her 1 turn right (from hammerlock, keep both hands) 11&12 - Anchor

Similar to box, w/ different feet: 1 R Back 2 L Side 3 R TOGETHER Lead her to step back and rotate her (to my) left 4 L Forward (between her legs) 5 R Side (kick her leg out) 6 L Back (Rotate hard left, so she can kick my leg on the next step) 7 R FORWARD 8 L Forward (repeat of 4)
-- To exit, walk straight out [on 7] (Remember I am on the wrong foot)

Entry - during right turns, typically across the short side. Right Turn 123 - rlr 123 - lrl - Underturn, so I can send my lady straight down the line of dance (ie., straight down the short side) --- Open my right turn to get her turning, raise my left hand to signal a turn. 1 - r Down line of dance - and lead her to turn 360 deg right 3 - l Close L to R (weight on right) --- Change hands to R-L 3 - R Step side R (down the LOD) [we are both open, facing the same direction] to put her in open -- Now bring her into shadow: 1 - Shift onto L and lead flat (straight toward me) so she spins left into shadow 2 - Shift quickly onto R 3 Shift back onto L - Right hand on her hip, left hand outstretched in her left hand --- Now start right turns in shadow: 123 - RLR 456 - LRL --- Tech notes: Swing hard when you are on outside, down line hip high. Step between her feet. (She steps between mine when we are traveling backwards) 123 - RLR --- Lead from her hip (with my right hand) raise my left hand and let her go: 456 - LRL - She spins 180 deg to open --- we are R-L again, this time I am leading her to closed, so I need to lead down and circular, and roll and lock. 3 - I change my weight so my left foot is free, and after I roll and lock, I continue with a: 123 lrl - Left turn

Left Turn on 1L: 123 LRL - Run, Run, Run (Rotate left) (Man forward) 456 RLR - Run, Hook behind, Side (Rotate hard left) (Woman forward) Repeat and change direction by: Bend deep into R leg on 6 and: 123 LRL - Check forward, Replace, BACK Right Flick er: 456 RLR - Hook behind R, side, forward (Lady forward) 123 LRL - Run, Run, Run (Man forward) Exit: 456 RLR - Same, Sink deep into R on 6, then 123 LRL - BACK, Side, Together (Start of right turn)
Start CBM on 1

(Single) Tuck turn from closed
Tuck turn from open
Tuck turn with elbow catch: 12 - Same (Back, open left) 3& - Same (Turn her, forearm to forearm) 4 - Single turn, RELEASE right hand and catch her forearm thumb down 5&6 - Side (Down the slot), Cross in back, Side (back up the slot) [She is now moving up the slot] 7&8 - Raise my left hand, so she turns 1.5 turns to her right to face me 9&10 - Triple-in-place
Back and forth variation: 5&6 - Slide my hand down her arm and to her shoulder to change her direction 7&8 - Slide my hand back accross her back to her elbow To exit, turn hand thumb down in 7&8 and lead her to do a double inside turn exit.

Body moves very little, keep centered, move feet.
Back L, Replace R Forward L, Replace R
Basic Timing: 1234
Synchopated timing: &1,2,3
Back L, Replace R (inbetween her legs) Side L, Hook behind R
Same as change of place, except lead her to turn left by passing left hand between up, thumb down slide right hand accross her back and into her left hand

Toe-Knee
When stepping on 2: Extend Ankle, Bend knee on 3: Extend Knee
While dancing: Look in the direction you are aiming for.
also:
Extend BACK of my neck.

& - L Back 1 - R Replace Lead left hand between partnership so she turns left Lower right hand and run around her back onto and down her left arm 2 - L Side 3 - Hook behind ---- & - L Back 1 - R Replace Raise my right arm, close my elbow and turn left While I place her hand on my middle with my left hand 2 - L Forward (turning) 3 - R Back

Starter step ----------- Open tuck: 1 Back L 2 Open R -- Tuck her 3 BACK L (This winds her up) & Replace R 4 Forward L 5&6 Face her ----------- Variation: I turn right on 5&6 ----------- Regular tuck variation: I turn right on 5&6 ----------- ----------- Sugar Tuck Single (Remember to bring my left arm all the way into my body) Sugar Tuck Double (Wind her up more and flick my hand more) ----------- Sneeky sugar tuck: 12 Same Lead a single sugar tuck 3&4 Close my right shoulder forward and under my arm 56 Forward side 78 Side back two exits: -1: Push my left (lead) arm straight out to my left 78 Let go so she can free spin 9&10 Triple-in-place two exits: -1: Push my left (lead) arm straight out to my left and raise it 78 Lead her to single turn to her right 9&10 Triple-in-place ----------- Fancy tuck: 1 Back L 2 Open R 3&4 LRL Triple-in-place as I: Slide my R hand down the inside of her arm and hook the top of her shoulder the hook the bottom of her upper arm from the inside 56 RL spin her the opposite (left) way as I travel down the slot next to her and stop her with my right hand 7 (side R) 8 (Back L) I turn left under my arm. 9&10 RLR Triple-in-place

Technique: When traveling backwards: Lower fully into your heal on 3, fully extending your leg back. Push off with your forward heal and don't land on the other heal until that foot passes.
Pattern: Wisk: Facing Wall: Forward, Side (and up early at the end of 2), Cross in back and DOWN on 3. Down the LOD in promenade: 1 - HT & - T 2 - T 3 - TH Outside partner Follow with a right turn.
Rock step - Don't step BACK, only my foot goes back Think of propelling myself FORWARD Rock step - step straight back (not to the side or diagional)

&1 - Rock - Step Release right hand and place it straight out to my side Sweep left hand toward me and to my right in a circle 23 - In-Place, together (she turns right and ends up on my side) ------- &1 - Side, together Lead her FORWARD with my right hand 23 - In-Place, In-Place She goes back out.

Regular: 12 - Back, Cross-in-front place the back of my right hand on her right shoulder Raise my left hand (keep it entended so she doesn't try to turn) 3 - Turn her 180 deg left &4 - Send her back where she started Raise my left hand again so she knows to turn back 5&6 - Triple in place ---- w/Tuck ending 12 - Same 3 - Same Get close, Left forearm to forearm &4 Lead her to double-turn right 5&6 - Triple-in-place ---- Tandem turn: 12 - Same 3 - Same Lower my left hand to pizza waiter Send her back down the (where she came from) slot, so she doesn't turn again I like to place my right hand on the FRONT of her left shoulder so she knows not to turn, but to just stay facing me &4 - QUICKLY bring my left hand over my head and turn right 5&6 - Anchor in place

12 - Back, roll her hand down and I turn left 90 deg 4 - Scuff L, step across and forward L 5&6 - Roll her hand back to face me ----- w/her turning left 12 Same 4 - Same, flick her hand out, so she turns around to her left 5&6 - Same (can also turn around right when she turns) ----- w/us turning opposite (me left, her right) 12 Same 3 - Step her w/my left hand Extend my left fingers and lead her back &4 Both of us turn around 5&6 - Anchor in place

Telemark: Facing Diag-Center: 1 - L - CBM , plant her so she can't swing on 2 2 - Turn my body around her and rise onto my R toes 3 - Continue turning, open her to promenade and go slightly forward and down into my Left leg - Now facing Diag-wall, she is facing Diag-center --- Follow with a chasse down the LOD then a right turn (now backing LOD) DEEP INTO my right leg, so I can start some serious CMB back-left to start my: natural spin turn (Now backing diag-center against LOD) Right turn (to LOD) Repeat: (Telemark)
------ Technique: BEND my left elbow to allow the lady to be more right. DOWN on 3 to get power for CBM on 1 Long steps on Chasse Don't stick my butt out when traveling backwards, especially on spin turn
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Telemark: Backing diag center 1 R - back in CBM to L 2 Close L to R (Body continues to turn left, head stops diag-wall, body stops diag center. 3 R - Forward (down into this leg to do CBM on next 1)

DanceStep.Comment:
&1 - Rock Step (Wind her up) 23 - In place (bring her into cuddle) &1 - Step forward (lead her back), then lead her forward 23 - Step in place, she pivots back in front of me
(I stay in place the whole time)

&1 - Rock step - lead her toward me (my left side) 23 Pivot and turn to face her (I lead down and turn my right hand so she turns to face me) (Lift my left hand over her head)
&1 - Rock step - Lead her back where she came 23 - Side, hook behind (Lead down with my right) (over her head with my left)
----------Add a double turn: 23 Same, Keep my hand up 23 Step, step, have her turn around again &1 Next step

R-R w/shake-hand hold: Same footwork, etc ----- R-R Shake hand w/left under Same footwork, etc. Be sure to raise Both hands Right hand PALM-UP, press left wrist against right hand while she goes under End in Diamond hold (R-R, L-L, Left over) Finish with a basket whip. Same, except I lead her back from her shoulders. ----- Hold hands: Same footwork, etc Be sure to raise Both hands Right hand PALM-UP, press left wrist against right hand while she goes under End (R-L, L-R, L over) hands crossed Finish with a basket whip. Same, except slide my left hand toward her right shoulder before leading her back Lead her back from her shoulder and hip

DanceStep.Description: Basket whips - Change of direction, turning
DanceStep.Comment: Change of direction - Basket whip 1-4 Same 5 Forward, lead her back 6 Back, lead her forward 7 Hold her in place as I step across right 8 Lead her forward, then 9 Lead her back 10 Back 11&12 - Triple in Place ----------------- Turning Whip 1-4 Same 5 Raise left hand, Lead her back slightly with my right hand (on her hip) keeping forward pressure so she doesn't step onto her heal 6 She turns right to face me (180 deg), lower my left hand, raise my right to keep her turning 7 turn her another 180 deg as I connect with her hip and shoulder 8 lead her FORWARD, then 9 back 10 back 11&12 Triple in place

Telemark: On 1 agressively step forward so she steps back onto her HEEL and DO NOT rise on the end of 1. If she can't rise, she will not swing. Hard rotation around her body - still do not rise until the middle?end of 2 when she had done her heal turn and is in promenade position. Footwork is ball-toe (NOT TOE) Step out on 3 (in promenade)
Push my hips forward under my partner on forward step Use Proper footwork. Toe on back foot pushes onto heel of front foot.

Tummy whip: Basket whip footwork. L-R 12 Lead her straight forward toward my left hip 3&4 Catch her right hip and lead her straight back 56 same, reconnect R-L 7&8 Anchor in place ------Tummy whip w/tandem free spins--- 12 Same 3&4 same, place my left hand on her left shoulder, thumb down 5 Step her back 6 Turn her left 90 deg, and let her 7&8 1.5 turns right (I turn 1 turn right) ------Shoulder catch 12 Same 3&4 Same, HOOK my right hand around the front of her left arm and (slowly slide it down to her wrist) 56 WALK, WALK forward in a tight circle (she is locked into my hip), Put her arm around my shoulder 78 Walk, Walk forward (she circles backwards) 910 - Slide my right hand down her left arm as I let her down the slot. 11&12 - Triple in place.

Inside whip: (Generic whip footwork) 12 - Same 3&4 - Same (Lift left arm, thumb down) 56 - Arm across her face (l -> r) 7&8 - Triple in place. --------Inside whip to hammerlock to prance to free spin to double inside turn 12 - Same 3&4 Same, except move left hand toward my left (to wind her up) 56 - She inside turns, I DROP my left hand straight down, 7&8 - change to my right hand in hammerlock behin her back (catch her left wrist with my left hand) Start prance: 1 - Forward L (Lead her to step and turn towards me) 2 - Forward R 34 - Same 56 - Same, Prep her to her right. 7&8 - She free spins to her left Connect R-L 1 Lead her forward and out (away from me toward the other rail) 2 Raise my left hand, thumb down to catch her right hand and turn her 3&4 A Full two 5&6 turns left.

&123 - Into cuddle
&1 - SIDE step, Step her BACK and then 23 - Step in place, Pull DOWN and back on my right hand to send her straight sideways &1 - SIDE step, step her out, then roll her in by rotating my right wrist in 23 - Step in place, She rolls in &1 - Step FORWARD, she steps back 23 - step in place, raise my left hand so she can step under and turn to face me

Typical Pattern: Natural, Spin turn. Left turn, Change step, Natural Turn, Twist turn from Backing LOD: 1 - L Back, deep CBM (Back pivot L) 2 - Forward Pivot Right 3 - Land L BACK ---She is outside partner L here 1 - Hook R behind L, unwind 2 - Raise RIGHT (not left) I am leading her to step side L here (She steps 1L, &R, 2L Side, 3Forward R) 3 - Back slightly T-H (She steps forward R between my legs) --- Finish with a: Left turn, change step Natural

Generic whip w/single turn: Forearm to forearm on 4. ------ Generic whip to spin-whip: 1-4 same, LOWER hand on 4, and flick behind her back. 5-8 same footwork, change back to L-R hold, then do a sugar to fix (reverse) grip ----- Spin whip to reverse whip: 1-8 same as previous, except keep L-L hold, then 12 Lead her forward toward me, 3 Flick her hand away, so she turns left &4 in closed 5 open left 6 turn to face her 7&8 tri-ple-step ------ Whip to walk-around: 1-4 Same, flick her right hand across her back, 56 LEAVE MY HAND THERE - SLIDE IT ACROSS HER FRONT AND CATCH HER RIGHT HIP 7 STEP BACK and towards her 8 back 910 Back, back (slide her left hand around the back of my shoulder) 1112 slide my hand down her left arm 13&14 Triple-in-place ----- Whip to walk-around w/outside turn. 1-10 same as previous. 11 turn RIGHT 12 push my right hand straight out to my left and then 13&14 Halo her for a full right turn.

&1 - Lead her back (and wind her up) 23 - Step in place, lead her with my right hand to turn left (My hand lands on her shoulder) &1 - Side, replace. Lead her back on wind her up to 23 - in -place. Lead her to step forward and turn left (I slide my hand across her shoulder and down her arm)

&1 - Back, replace. Push her back slightly to wind her up 23 - in-place. lead her straight forward to my right. I Raise my left hand and head loop myself. (she is now locked in with right in front, left across her shoulder) &1 - in-place (she steps in place) 23 - Forward (turning left), back. she stays in place

DanceStep.Description: Wing + Pattern + Back lock + Reverse chasse
DanceStep.Comment:
On short wall facing diag wall. 123 - Natural turn Backing LOD 123 - Back, Side, Hook behind (Whisk) Facing Backing LOD 1 - R Forward, Hold 2 & 3. (Wing) (Lead her around to my left 1,2,3, she is facing wall, hips facing me (LOD) still left) 1&23 - LRLR - (Reverse chasse) toward diag Center. On the chasse, close to face her (I am backing diag center against LOD) ---My new line of dance is the long wall, so I am backing diag-center-- Reverse to promenade: 1 L Back (she is outside partner R) 2 R Back (She steps between my legs) 3 L Brush and turn to promenade. Chasse: 1&23 RLRL - Close her
------ALSO finish previous pattern with a back lock:---- Twist turn review: 1 hook R behind L 2 unwind 3 raise and go back and down L --- Reverse lock: 1 back R & Lock in front L 2 back R 3 Step in front L and release R --- Back to lock? 1 R back 2 L Side 3 Cross behind R --- Reverse chasse: see above

Roll and lock (right side pass variation): 12 Back back 3&4 - Place right hand on her back, turn her to face me (she is now in closed) Finish with 5-8 of a whip 56 - Open left 7&8 triple-in-place ---------- Whip to closed: 1-4 of whip 5 - same (open left) 6 - Step SIDE HARD RIGHT (to change her direction) 7&8 Sailor shuffle (in closed) ---------- Ladies side pass styling: 12 same 3 She stops, facing away, holds her right hand over her head with her left hand supporting it. Bumps right 4 Bumps left 5 Step R 6 Turn and step back ---------- Pattern: 12 Back back 3&4 Roll and lock 5 Hard turn right 6 Walk down the slot 7&8 Side, replace, cross-in-front add Inside turn and man's head loop: 12 walk her down the slot and wind her up 3&4 - Lead her to inside turn left 1.5 times to face me (I triple in place) 5&6 - Head loop myself and place my right hand on her back add shoulder lead tandem turns 12 - lead her FORWARD, FORWARD 3&4 - Reach across to her shoulder and lead her to turn 1.5 turns left to face me 5&6 - I turn 1 turn right and connect

man's head loop: &1 - in place 23 - right hand loops over my head and onto my shoulder to lead her to my right side (my left hand is about at my belt buckle). &1 - in place 23- raise my LEFT hand and turn LEFT (we end with our hands crossed) &1 - in place 23 - Lead her to pass on my left side (our hands are correct)

inside roll: &1 - in place 23 - roll her to turn right with my RIGHT hand. she rolls in - my right hand is on her SHOULDER my arm in ON her BACK. &1 - Lead her with my elbow to wind up right 23 - Lift my hand so she can turn right to face me (hands crossed) &1 - in place 23 - change of place (our hands are now correct)

123&4 - Whip footwork, hold left hand to my hip 5 - same (open left) 6 - start turning right 7&8 - Continue turning right 1 turn to face her (while I do a double-hand switch behind my back) -------- She turns right 1-4 same 5 open left 6 roll her with my right hand to turn right (take my hand TOWARD my chest, not away) 7&8 - triple in place, or turn right one rev, or turn left one rev.

R-R 12 - Underarm turn footwork 3&4 - Underarm turn, except place my left hand on her back 56 - put my right hand over my shoulder, and get out of the slot 7&8 - lead her with my right hand to do 1.5 turns to her right ---- or 7&8 Let go of my right hand and let her free-spin 1.5 turns to her right (I can turn also)

#1: roll in with right hand: &1 - in place 23 - Roll her right, so my right hand is on her shoulder &1 - in place 23 - roll her out to my right &1 - in place 23 - roll her back in &1 - forward (lead her back) 23- lead her back out in front of me. ----- Roll out from man's comb over: &1 in place 23 - Man's face loop (she comes to my side) &1 - in place 23 - I roll out &1 - in place 23 - roll her in &1 - in place 23 - Send her out

---Short side Natural Spin turn 4-5-6 of reverse (not sure if this is two combinations or one??) Forward change Natural pivot twist (this was the twist and then the walk around ?low? to ladies? rise and forward and then into the lock steps below? ---Long side Syncopated back lock (lady ends up on back foot as in whisk) Drop lock (lady ends up with weight on front foot) Telemark Forward chasse Natural Spin turn 4-5-6 ---Starting short side Forward change Natural Back whisk (turning to right) Wing ---Starting Long side Chasse to right (forward cha cha cha) Back step, back step to promenade Forward chasse Natural turn

---------Short side Natural into corner Spin turn 4-5-6 of reverse (underturn to face LOD) 123 of Reverse Corte = Start Backing Diag Wall (Corner). 1 Back L, heel turn 145 deg to facing LOD, hold 2, 3 (her footwork is 123 of a reverse) Back wisk = Back, back, hook behind L (in promenade) Chasse (close her) Natural (into corner) Back whisk (turning to right) Wing (ending in left outside partner, I'm facing diag-center) --------Starting Long side Chasse to right (forward cha cha cha) Back step, back step to promenade Forward chasse ----------Short side Natural turn (into corner) + spin turn 456 of reverse Forward change Natural pivot twist (this was the twist and then the walk around ?low? to ladies? rise and forward and then into the lock steps below?) ----------Long side Syncopated back lock (lady ends up on back foot as in whisk) Drop lock (lady ends up with weight on front foot) Telemark Forward chasse --------Repeat: Natural + Spin turn + 4-5-6 of reverse, etc

Easiest breaks are: & point, the draw my leg back in. or: Out - Out (then roll hips for break) or: Back Back (Don't hop, place your feet) then bend, bend (knees), bend, bend ----- Generic Whip Breaks: ----- On 3 = 3 Count closed break: 12 - Same & - Place left foot on right knee and keep head pointed in direction she came from start turning right 3 - Finish turn and WHIP head around, LEAD HER SIDEWAYS (to keep her from stepping back) Hip roll through the break ----- On 5: 12 same 34 same Keep her close, lean slightly toward her. Brace her hand with my left hand (my palm against her fist) and do & - Back Left 5 - Back right (Legs apart) hip roll thru break ----- On 7: 7 - & Point ----- On 1: 1 - & Point

&1 - Back, replace 23 - Neck wrap &1 - I go side, lead her back 23 - Unwind her turning right we have crossed hands, left over &1 - Back, replace 23 - Turn her 360 deg right 45 - Turn her another 360 deg right release right hand, Lower left hand &1 - Next pattern

Sugar: on 56 - Slide R hand under my right hand then roll around and connect to her R hand (R-R) 1 open left, connect L-L over 2 Together R 3&4 - Wind her up a little on 3, then put her in sweetheart 5&6 Lead a 1.5 R turn with my right hand, separating my L hand when my wrist comes around She is facing me R-R, L-L over Do a left side pass to unwind.

Align - Diag Wall S - HT - Forward R - Turn 1/8 to R Q - T - Side L Down the LOD Q - T - Together R S - TH - Back L - Turn 1/8 to R (Step is actually straight down the LOD) Align - Backing Diag Center
DanceStep.LadysSteps: S - TH - Back L - Turn 1/8 to R Q - T - Side R Down the LOD Q - T - Together L S - TH - Forward R - Turn 1/8 to R (Step is actually straight down the LOD)

DanceStep.Comment: Align - Backing Diag Center S - TH - Back R - Turn 1/8 to L (to wall) Q - T - Side L Down the LOD Q - T - Together R S - TH - Forward L - Turn 1/8 to L (Step is actually straight down the LOD) Align - Diag Wall
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Align - Backing Diag Center S - HT - Forward L - Turn 1/8 to L Q - T - Side R Down the LOD Q - T - Together L S - TH - Back R - Turn 1/8 to L (Step is actually straight down the LOD) Align - Backing Diag Wall

DanceStep.Comment: Align - Diag Wall S - HT - Forward R - Turn 1/8 to R Q - T - Side L Down the LOD Q - TH - Together R (turn to R) Backing LOD S - TH - Back L - Pivot 1/2 turn to R (facing LOD) S - HT - Straight forward R down LOD, continuing to turn R (don't brush L) S - TH - Back L Align - Backing Diag Center against LOD
DanceStep.LadysSteps: S - TH - Back L - Turn 1/8 to R Q - T - Side R Down the LOD Q - TH - Together L (turn to R) Facing LOD S - TH - Forward R - Pivot 1/2 turn to R (backing LOD) S - HT - Back L down LOD, continuing to turn R (Brush R, then) S - TH - Forward R Align - Facing Diag Center against LOD

DanceStep.Comment: Dance 123 of a Natural - Align backing LOD S - TH - Straight back L (turning body to R) Q - T - Side R (down the LOD) Q - T - Together L S - TH - Side and Forward R (Deep compression preparing to power into lock step) (Left side leading - preparing to go outside partner on next step) Align Diag center (follow with a lock step)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Dance 123 of a Natural S - HT - Straight Forward R (turning body to R) Q - T - Side L (down the LOD) Q - T - Together R S - TH - Side and Forward L Note: Since lady is going left, she should be taking LARGE steps to get around the man

DanceStep.Comment: Align Diag center (actually diag wall of the new LOD) Left side leading Q - T - Step outside partner L Q - T - Lock R behind L S - TH - Step outside partner L Alignment unchanged Follow with a Natural spin turn
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Left side leading (going backwards) Q - T - Step back R (make sure toe is aligned with direction of travel - if pointing out in direction of chest, will get stepped on) Q - T - Lock L in front of R S - TH - Step back R (man is again outside partner L) Follow with a Natural spin turn

DanceStep.Comment:
Disco turns: L-R She turns - same as two hands He turns - lead her forward, place her hand on my waist, then turn left 1/2 turn
R-L She turns - &1, 2 Lead her forward and then flick my wrist to my right. 3 she turns to face me. He turns - &1, 2 Lead her straight forward, then let go (maybe lead slightly down) I turn left 180 deg, she turns left 180 deg.

Underarm turn breaks: On 3: 12 - LR - Same - Back, Diag Forward (cross to left) &3 - Scuff press - Scuff left foot on the way past right, bend left knee and PRESS into floor. Left arm went over her head and on her left shoulder, right arm on her hip to lock her in place. 4 Lower onto left heel 56 - Slow unwind to the right and slowly slide right foot to the left of my left foot an then: 1 - Continue ---------- On 5: Lunge (or other break) ---------- On 1: Lunge (or other break)

DanceStep.Description: Pivot, Back Lock to Promenade, Hopping steps?
DanceStep.Comment: Follows previous pattern: Natural, Tipple, Forward Lock -- Facing Diag-wall of the short wall Natural -- Backing LOD of short wall Pivot: S - THT (So you can pivot on ball of foot) - Back L, Rotate body to left S - ?T = Forward R (down LOD) (No rise) S - ?T - Back L (Up LOD of Long Wall) (Keep turning my Body left, since I need her to lock on the next step) (No rise) Back Lock to promenade: Q - T - R Straight back down LOD Q - T - Lock L in front of R S - T - Step R back and turn 180 deg right to get her in promenade (Hang here before stepping out) S - TH - Step forward L in promenade Hops: (not too clear from here on) S& - Step forward deep into my R foot and hop straight up with my L ankle on my right knee, turn her to closed Q - L foot forward & - R foot forward behind L Repeat: Q - L foot forward Q - R foot forward behind L To stop: S - Go deep into my L leg, then: S - Start progressive chasse
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Pivot: S - HT - Step R between his legs S - ?T - Back L (down LOD) S - ?T - Forward R Forward lock to promenade: Q - T - Still turning body to R Q - T - Lock L behind R S - T - Step ALL THE WAY around him and turn to promenade (facing LOD of long wall) S - TH - Step forward R down LOD Hops: Q - Step forward L and close to man, hop straight up.

DanceStep.Comment:
To change to R-R, do a ladies turn and change hands ------- I can do a she-turns, he turns: She turns: Easy - Same as other she-turns == He turns: Lead her forward (she will turn 180 deg) I do a pizza waiter over my head as I turn 180 deg left.
----------- Other spin: R-R Lead her in and turn her to sweetheart position Wind her up and send her back out
--------------Doorknob turn Lead left hand DOWN and twist so she turns 180 deg left.
Normal breaks on 1 and 5. Break on 3: &3 - Step L across the slot and go DOWN and turn to face her quickly. Slowly unwind and step R on 6
DanceStep.LadysSteps: &3 - She crosses her L in front of R and turns to face him, then slowly unwinds (as her leads it) down the slot.

DanceStep.Comment: Follows Natual, Backing LOD, Left shoulder leading Q - T - R Back Q - T - Lock L in front of R S - TH - Diag back R (Next step is where I rotate my upper body approx 180 deg from left to right - to promenade) Q - T - Straight back (small step) and pivot 180 deg R on ball of L foot (She takes a large step around me here) Q - T - Rise up on R here S - TH - Step L forward here

These moves are in response to Streched vocals in songs, such as ooooo's usually in the chorus. For an underarm turn: on 1 - Collect right, then Slide left with left foot and slowly slide in right foot on 3 - 12 = same, 3 slide down the slot with left, and bring in right foot (may want to curve it to the R to keep from getting too far away) on 5 - 12 = same, 3& Step, Step turn 180 deg to face partner, 4 - Tap L. 5 = Slide L, then bring R to L

Start R-R &1 - Back, replace 23 - Turn her Right to my right side (into sweetheart) &1 - Back, replace (prep her to step across R to her L) 23 - Lead her to sweetheart left --- Option 1 - Lead her back to sweetheart R &1 - Back, replace (prep her to step across R to her R) 23 - Lead her to sweetheart R --- Option 2 - Turn partnership around 180 deg &1 - Back, replace 23 - Forward pivot L, back r (she is now sweetheart L) --- Option 3 Double turn her (Same as option 2, except I left go and scoup her hand as she comes around) &1 - Back, replace 23 - Forward pivot L (She does 1.5 turns L), back r (she is now sweetheart L)

-------Posture Need to move my head up and back hips - Level, not rotated forward -------Forward step Don't lean back Don't Pitch forward onto a straight leg .. Keep legs bent equally and straighten equally on stride Compress into leg, keep knees bent equally push forward (concentrate on powering leg instead of receiving leg) Release heel and toe equally and immediately Straighten legs at the same rate Lower foot gradually (I always lower too fast on backward step) -----Promenade position Need to end up with my hips and shoulders facing my partner, head and feet pointing left ... on both wisk and telemark

DanceStep.Description: Hesitation, Zig Zag, Back lock, Running Finish, Natural
DanceStep.Comment: Natural turn: into short corner. Backing LOD of long wall. --- Hesitation: L - S HT - Straight back (under turn so she doesn't think spin turn) R - S Flat - Straight back onto a bent leg (both legs bent into a squatting position) L - S IE - Slowly draw L to R and Aligned Diag-wall of short wall --- Zig zag: L - S - Step forward L turning L (lead her to small chasse-similar to heal turn) R - S - Back L - S - Back --- Back lock Left side lead: R - Q - Back R L - Q - Lock L in front of R R - S - Back R --- Running Finish: L - S - Back R R - Q - Side L L - Q - Forward R down LOD of new long wall --- Natural:
Natural to backing LOD: Q& - Back L, Hop 1&2&3&4 - Chasse, Chasse & hop, turn 180 deg right repeat: Do forward lock to exit

&1 - Rock step Lead her to do a normal change of place Go into pizza waiter left hand over my head 2 - Step forward left and do reach turn to face back and continue turning (pivoting) right 180 more degL 3 - R Forward, pivot 180 deg more right to face her.

---- on 3: 12 Same Cup the back of her shoulder and release as I slide down the slot (curve to keep her from getting too far) slide down her left arm. ---- on 5: Overturn slightly on 4, shape my body away from direction of travel and slide. ---- on 7: Wind up left and slide right, -- or Tap right, wind up right and slide left.

Technique: Backwards step: Peel ball of foot off floor and push backwards. Receiving foot starts toe pointing back, roll onto ball. DO NOT place the heal down until the other foot brushes by. Footwork: HT - T - TH Rise and fall: Down - up - down - be sure to extend your spine forward on the 2nd and 3rd steps (Lady is extending forward [toward her partner]) Body (hips and shoulders should rotate in the opposite direction of the 3rd step) Ladies: All steps are rolling through the foot right now. Pattern: Start diag - Center Step 1 = & - Starter step Feather: step 2,3,4[outside partner] (left shoulder lead) Reverse Turn: (Lead lady to do a heal turn) step 5,6,7 Feather finish: step 8,9,10[outside partner] Three step: step 11,12,13 (right shoulder lead) Natural Turn: (Lead lady to do a heal turn) step 14,15,

Do 2 Flippys 1 - Back Left (same) & - Slight forward right and in front of her 2 - Step across her with L and pivot (reach turn) on left to her other side (She was doing basic in place)
3 - Back right & - Start curving her in 4 - She Steps across me with her L and pivots in front of me
To Exit: 1 - Lead inside turn (fingers point to my left)

Music: Wade in the Water Nightwalker - Michael Jackson Uhh
When there is a repeating pattern in the chorus, such as tap-tap-tap, we can (break in all the locations learned during breaks) &1 - Kick out, return foot or 1 - Kick forward 2 - Kick other foot forward or 1 - Bend, unbend knee or 1 - Hop 2 - Hop or Shoulders (down-down) or etc.. from warm up

1 - Side 2 - Forward 3 - Replace 4 - Side, 1- Slow Drag toe to close, then 2 - Back etc.
Cuban motion Slight weight forward Toe leads

&1 - Back, Replace 2 - Side, Lead her forward w/my R, lead hand down, and onto her back (she turns L). My L hand is at my R hip 3 Replace, she is at my R side -- &1 - Back, replace 2 - Back, lead her forward and raise my L hand 3 - Replace , she turns R to face me -- &1 - Back, replace (wind her up) 23 - Walk, Walk. Turn her L 1 rev (I turn 90 deg left to face her) 23 - Ditto -- &1 - Back replace (done)
Can stop mid-pattern and: hop hop Shoulder - down, down Knee, Knee Toe point, point Break on 3: Open her or face her to do the break on 5: open her or accelerate the turn or slide through

Long Side (Same as last week) Starter Step SQQ - Feather SQQ - Reverse SQQ - Feather Finish SQQ - 3 Step SQQ - Natural ------New: Hesitation: S - Straight back L S - Heal pull R brush past left and slightly to the side (Stay down in the knees) Turn from backing LOD to Diag center against LOD S - Slightly forward L Align = Diag center of the new SHORT wall Weave: S - HT - Forward R 1Q - T - Side L (Turning right to give a right shoulder lead) 2Q - T - Back R (right shoulder lead) 3Q - T - Back L (she steps outside partner R) 4Q - T - Back R 5Q - T - Side L (change to outside partner L) 6Q - TH - Forward R (left shoudler lead) Alignment=Diag wall of short wall Three Step: SQQ - Three step SQQ - Natual turn SSS - Hesitation Align = Diag center of new LONG wall Start pattern again.

Side by Side:
Across to my left:
Right turns

---- Variation 1 - L-R sugar push headloop 12 - Same 3 Left hand over my head, take elbow and right shoulder away from my partner. & 4 - Lead her back with my right hand (same) 5&6 - same ----Variation 2 - R-R sugar push headloop 12 - Same 3 Right hand over my head, left hand on her right hip & 4 - Lead her back with my left hand 5&6 - same

Whip to backward rotatating walk: 12 - Same 3&4 - Same Lower R hand 5 Step BACK and start rotating right, pass her L hand behind her back and 6 Catch her R hip with my R hand 7 Back 8 - Place her left hand over my head and onto my shoulder 910 - Back, back (she does forward forward) in a tight circle repeat 11&12 - Triple back , slide my hand down her arm ----Other backward rotatating walk 12 Back back, Lead a J to the left, so she turns R 180 deg 3 - she does &3 (tapping with her L, ready to spin L) (my L hand in holding the top of her L hand) 4 - Spin her L (halo her with my L hand) 56 - catch her R hip with my R hand and rotate to my L repeat 1112 - Release her and catch her L-R

Open break to spot turn (lead with my L)
Butterfly

Current pattern - add: Short Side: Weave 3 Step into the corner Natural turn (change slightly to lead into Hover): [Alignment - Diag-wall] Q [not usual slow] - HT - Plant the lady so she does a heel turn. Q - T - Rotate around her (my left shoulder should have rotated to point to wall) Q - TH - L Foot is pointing LOD of short side, (my left shoulder should be rotated to point backing LOD) Hover (Keep rotating my body left - She circles from my right to my left side): Q - Check my R foot slightly in front of my L foot (down the LOD) [She crosses BEHIND L] Q - L small step toward wall (continue turning her around me) Q - R small step against LOD (countinue turning her around me) my shoulders are almost twisted parallel to wall Feather finish SQQ - Finish facing diag-center of the long wall

Side pass w/headloop: -------L-R: 12 - Same 3&4 - Same, into pizza waiter, close elbow, turn shoulder - headloop 5&6 - Triple -------R-R: 12 - same 3&4 - Headloop 5&6 same -------Left side pass w/inside turn 1 - Open her slightly to my L 2 - raise her arm and place my R hand on her elbow 3&4 - Turn her left 1.5 turns 5&6 - Triple in place ------L-R Side pass w/headloop, I turn 1. rev right on 5&6 ------R-R Side pass w/headloop I turn 1 rev right OR left on 5&6

Change of place, change to R-R (thumb war hold) &1 - Back, replace 2 - Forward 3 - Forward L (Keep R way back), keep shoulder way back (so I am wound up for turn) (&1) - Circle my left leg around from the left to right and rotate to face her... then tap L 23 - Turn her 180 deg left into sweetheart &1 - Back replace 23 - Send her out
23 same 4 - smaller step, open left 5 - replace R 6 - Turn small step L 1 - Push side (facing new direction)

Align: Diag Wall Natural: S - Same Q - Same Q - Overturn to facing center (from here, timing is not (?) set) ? - Change weight to L foot and open the lady to backing LOD ----- Same Leg lunge: x - Down on L left leg (tilt slightly to left) (lady should be extending her R leg BACK) x - Push side onto a bent R leg - stay very level (styling - snap head to R) Slight rightward lead to change lady's head position to right ---- Lead out: DONT MOVE Lead LADY to her left foot and turn her to face me (I collect (draw in) my L leg, but do NOT change weight) ---- Finish w/a telemark to promenade S -Drive forward R etc.

----Left side pass w/ladies inside turn: L-R Slight lead left on 1 on 2, place right hand on inside of her elbow and pull in 3&4 she triple 1.5 L 5&6 same. ----Add Man's Headloop 4 - Pizza Waiter, hand over MY head 5&6 - Usually open left slightly and take her in closed ----Same starting R-R 1 - Slight lead left 2 - lead in and 3& - in a circle around her head 4 - Open R, L hand behind her R side 5&6 - Triple to open L, closed (my R hand on her L shoulder) ----Add man's L turn to L-R xx ----Add man's L turn to R-R xx ----Add man's R turn to L-R xx ----Add man's R turn to R-R xx ---- R-R -> prance 1 - Back (slightly L) 2 - Lead in and DOWN to get her to turn 3&4 - Bring R hand up on her shouder and put pressure down 56 - Prance L R etc.. 9 - Lead her FORWARD and wind her up 10 11&12 - Lead her to spin L 1.5 turns and face me
---- variaton: Man's tandem free spin

1 - Back L 2 - Forward, turn R 90 deg with R foot (to face her) 3 - BACK DOWN THE SLOT L (Spring her back and then forward) & - Replace R 4 - Step across the slot in front of her L (Brace my R hand against her left hand) 5 - Open L (R foot together) LEAD HER SIDEWAYS DOWN THE SLOT (Don't turn her to face the slot until the next count) 6 - L Side and turn 90 deg to face her 7& - Tri-ple RL 8 - Back R

Sugar 1: 1 - Back 2 Let go, she pushes on my chest. 3-6 same
Sugar 2: 1 - Back L, start turning R 2 - Step across R, turn with my back to her (she puts her hand on my back) &3 - Out, Out &4 - In, in (cross R slightly in front on L) 5 - Turn R (step L) 6 - Turn R step side R (both feet on the L track, R-R)
Sugar 3: 1 - Same 2 - Arms OUT, lead her slightly to my R so she can kick 3456 - She slides back
Technique: ALWAYS step BACK on 6 (tension the rope)
Change in technique: on 3 step: S - H Q - HT Q - TH Add to pattern: Natural, Impetus, Feather, 3 Step, Feather, Change of Direction, Feather

DanceStep.Description: Underarm turn + Man's headloop + Man's spin + Side pass
DanceStep.Comment:
Underarm turn: 12 same 3&4 same, keep her close, right hand to my face in pizza waiter 5 - Headloop myself, Step forward diag R, L knee behind R knee 6 - Untwist L, onto L and 7&8 - 1.4 turn L sideways to slot, L-R, feet together Side pass: 1 - L Side 2-6 same
Ladies styling on side pass: 12 Forward R, Forward L &3 - French cross RL (body turned L) Let your body arc forward to your 4 - R foot 5&6 Anchor

Underarm turn: 12 same 3&4 same - Finish leaning slightly forward, connect my right knuckeles with her left palm L foot forward, R foot back &5 - Step onto L foot, tap right heel (push her out) &6 - Step onto R foot, tap left toe (pull her in) Repeat Out: &5 same &6 Lead back + underarm turn

Lead a whip: L-R 12 - Same 3&4 - on 3 - push her R hand out, she does a 1.5 up the slot 5&6 - on reconnects R-R Thumbs down --- 12 - Lead her forward, 3&4 - lead down, twist in so she turns into my right hand 5&6 - Lead her down the slot
TECHNIQUE: Step back on 6

Similar to an underarm turn. R-R L-L Over 12 - Same 3&4 - Open R, headloop myself with my L hand, turn R on 4 5&6 - Head loop myself with my R hand, turn L (prep for a tuck) --- Two exits: --- 1. Tuck out: 12 - Lead HER to step BACK, replace 3&4 - Tuck her in 5&6 - She spins to face me --- 2. Tuck out: 12 - Lead HER to step FORWARD, FORWARD (I step back, back.. turning R) 3&4 - Actually - Tap L, Step L - Tuck her in (and sometimes have her lead off my chest) 5&6 - Lead her down the slot

Feet together, pointer diag center, move LOD, Right hand lower on back, left hand tighter. Forward walk: LS - Step on 2 RS - Step on 4 LQ - Smaller step forward (start opening her to promenage HERE) RQ - Step R in place, open HER to promenade - close my L leg around her leg LS - Step F on 1 RQ - Forward in PP LQ - Close HER RS - Step on 1, close ME (stay in CBMP, left leading)

----Zig Zag: Q - Forward L Q - SIDE R S - Forward L ----Rocking move: S - Forward R Q - Rock Back L Q - Rock Forward R S - Rock Back L S - Step back R (in CBMP) Q - Side L (same as promenade close) Q - Close R (same as promenade close)

Outside Partner (from Promenade): S - Same S - Same Q - Same Q - Step past her in CBMP
Technique: Stay left, Head up, Shoulders down, Arms out, Adjust for partner, Close hand (around hers), Tight stomach, Chest to her (parallel)

DanceStep.Description: Underarm turn w/man's spin + w/alternating spins
DanceStep.Comment: 12 - Same 34 - Same to Pizza waiter (she turns left - same as underarm turn) 5 Step RIGHT FOOT across to RIGHT and head-loop MYSELF 6 Unwind to left foot and 7&8 Triple (1.5 turn to left) + side pass out --- 12 - Same 34 - Same to Pizza waiter (she turns left - same as underarm turn) 5 Raise my left arm and Step under my arm to my left &6 Triple triple and face side + side pass her out --- Fancy side pass footwork for her: --- 12 Walk, walk forward (now leaning back) 3 - Hook R in front of L & - Step back L 4 Together R (leaning forward) (now do a x-body turn) 5 Forward L, pivot L & Back R 6 Back L ---- can free spin her on 2 on the side pass (must be R-L)

12 - Back, Turn her 90 deg so we are both facing side 34 - Scuf, cross L in front on R &5 - Step R, turn to face her, tap ball of L forward lead = push her away (like texas-push) &6 - Step together L, Turn back sideways, Cross in front R -- repeat 3-6 To exit, twist her wrist so she is facing away: 12 - Push away to make her switch feet. --- I do a left spin exit.

Long Wall: 1) 2 Walks (Start W, curve to DW) S S 2) Progressive Link (DW) QQ 3) Closed Promenade (DW) SQQS 4) Progressive Side Step QQS 5) Rock Turn (start DW, edn DW) SQQ SQQS 6) 2 Walk (Start DW, curve to DC) SS 7) Open Reverse Turn, Lady outside (start DC, end DW) QQS QQS End Long Wall, Corner to Short Wall 1) 2 Walks (Start DW old LOD, curve to DW new LOD) SS 2) Progressive link (DW) QQ 3) Open Promenade (DW) SQQS 4) Outside partner Rock Turn (Start DW end DW) SQQ SQQS 5) 4 step Promenade thing (1st 3 steps same as open reverse turn, 4th step, change to promenade)

Throwout (side pass)
Open to closed L-R Lead 12 of a whip 3& whip 4 Step SIDE to the rail 5&6 - Triple right (now in closed)
Throwout - ladies inside turn From closed: 12 - Back open left, lead her side (her: back, forward) 3&4 - Lead her around to my L side 5&6 - Triple in place
Throwout - Ladies indide turn to closed From closed: 12 - Back open left, lead her side (her: back, forward) Raise my L hand and wind her up slightly so she can turn R 3&4 - Lead her around to my L side (She triples 1.5 turns to her R) 5&6 - Triple in place
Throwout - Ladies inside turn + mans left turn (8 count) 12 - Back open left, lead her side (her: back, forward) Raise my L hand and wind her up slightly so she can turn R 3&4 - Lead her around to my L side (She triples 1.5 turns to her R) Place my R land on her L shoulder to stop her from traveling back, raise my L hand over MY head and 56 - I turn to my L 7&8 - Triple in place
Throwout - Ladies check From closed lead her around with my right hand. 12 - Back open left, lead her side (her: back, forward) 3&4 - Lead her around to my L side 5 Break forward (she breaks forward) 6 Back (she goes back) 7 Lead her forward on my R side (L arm up so she turns L - like underarm turn) &8 - in-place
After a 3 step: RS - Forward LQ - Side RQ - Turn R, Side LQ - Check forward to the R (outside of her) RQ - Replace LQ - Side L RQ - Step CBMP Diag L
Stacato movement Foot Retention on trailing foot Release foot on backward motion Head up Don't slide feet On link, turn on & (q&q) Release toe on backwards motion

Tuck out w/push break. Side-pass w/swivel Side pass w/hitch Locked whip to hammerlock, ladies left turn exit ALT: I double to the left Locked whip to hammerlock, to ladies wrap, Tuck, 2 hands over, to ladies free spin, Ladies Free spin, Quick whip

Closed turn: Very close to Outside turn (on 3 she steps FORWARD in CLOSED) Diag Center: S - Forward L Q - Side (rotate to face backing LOD) so I'm cutting her off Q - Back, She steps FORWARD in CLOSED Same finish as other version S - Back Q - Side Q - Together ----- Other move: From Promenade facing LOD: S - Forward L Q - Curving R Q- Side L (Cut her off) Body Facing Backing LOD (her next step is forward into me) S - Hook R behind L (Lead my rotating my RIGHT shoulder around) Q - Unwind as Q - She walks around me (Finish in promenade facing LOD) Technique: HEAD BACK, straight In promenade, my body is facing hers

Tuck to basket-whip ----1 - Tuck - basket exit 1-6 - Tuck, two hands over 12 - Back, back, left hand over her head (into a basket) 3456 - Finish 5-8 basket ----2 - Tuck - sweetheart exit 1-6 - Tuck, two hands over 12 - (I go) Back, back, lift left hand unto her left shoulder (in sweetheart) 34 - Open left, left go of left hand, with right hand lead HER back, back and turn her right 5&6 - triple in place ----3 - Underarm turn variation R-R 12 - Back, prep her to turn left; Forward 34 - Forward across slot turning R, R arm over R shoulder, L arm straight across to her L shoulder 5&6 - Lead HER FORWARD, then turn her R 7&8 - Triple in place (or turn) as she does 1.5 turns to her R ----4 - Same as 3 w/different exit 1-6 same on 6 - roll my left hand from over to under her shoulder, place my flat R hand on her R shoulder 7&8 - Prep her to spin L (she needs to step &7&8) 9&10 - Triple in place ----5 - Tuck into hammerlock, xxx exit
Remember these points in the 4 step change: on 4 remember to rotate my hips toward my partner

---Tummy whip: 1 back 2 diag forward - Lead her straight toward me down the slot. Right hand (two center fingers) on her tummy/upper R hip 3&4 Step across the slot then square up behind her (Left hand on her L shoulder) 5 Lead her back 6 Open her up to her R 7&8 Either single or double turn her right. ---Inside whip 123&4 same Raise L hand, thumb down 5 Lead her forward 6 Turn her L to face me 7&8 Anchor-in-place ---Apache Whip 123& Same 4 Flick my L hand to pass her R hand to my R hand behind her back 56 She turns to face me We are R-R (keep, or switch to L-R) 7&8 Anchor in place ---Cool ending (continue from R-R) 1 back 2 diag forward - Lead her forward Raise my R hand so she turns L (catch her L shoulder with my L hand) 3 Step across the slot, 4 Tap straight down the slot (My R hand is behind my head) 5 hook behind R (down the slot), 6 step side L Hook her L forearm/hand w/my R hand & bounce toward her, 7 bounce away, so she can spin 1.5 turns L, &8 (finish triple) 9&10 Anchor-in-place

Hammerlock variations: Basic: 1&2 3&4 56 --- Raise left hand 2 - She steps left (to her right) on R 4 - She pivots (rotates right) to face me (in hammerlock) 56 - Rock her back ---Exit 1 Raise left hand thumb down 2 She steps right on R 4 - She pivots (rotates left) to face me (two hands) 56 - Rock her back ---Exit 2 - I turn 2 I turn Left 4 I pivot leftwards under my L arm to face her 56 - Rock her back ---Exit 3 - Wheel 2 - Forward R (lead her forward with my R hand on her hip) 4 - Forward L 56 - Rock back -repeat, then use exit 2

Working on knees. Start with knees unlocked. On forward step, both knees go forward, push into receiving leg. On backward step, standing knee goes slightly forward as receiving knee extends back. SWING: Slight windup, swing onto toe. Far hip high, sending hip is low.

---Whip w/ladies outside turn Remember to keep left arm close to my shoulder, don't lead turn until 6 ---Whip w/ladies free spin Remember to bring R hand toward me when leading her spin ---Whip w/tandem free spin Wait until I lead her, then hook R foot behind L and triple to my R. Stay on the balls of my feet ---Ladies prance in place R-R L-L over. 12 - Lead her forward, forward to my L 3&4 - Lead her to step Forward, Pivot to her L on the ball of her foot, Step forward (back toward where she started). (I triple in place) 5&6 - Repeat to my R to exit her, give a slightly larger lead on 4, raise L arm, 56 she turns R to face me, 7&8 anchors, returns to starting position ---Ladies prance back to start Similar to prev, except I face back down the slot (to her starting position) when I put her in sheetheart. 5&6 - She prances away from me onto her L foot, toward me on her R, repeat, same exit ---Ladies prance down the slot Side pass foot work. 12 Open L and lead her to my L down the slot 3&4 Turn her 360 deg to her L, and prance her down the slot same exit
Side basic Forward break (New Yorker) Back break Open (back and forth) Basic Reach turns Man's full turn

---Apache Whip + ?Reverse? Whip 1-4 of Whip Pass her right hand behind her back and 56 Catch it with my right 7&8 Anchor (R-R upside down hold [thumbs down]) 12 Lead her forward (she does forward, forward L [pivot L]) (Flick her hand out to the right, so she turns left) 3&4 Roll and lock (she does back, together, forward) (Note stay turned side so she can step farther back, turning to face her on 5 will lead her forward) 56 Turn to face her, open R 7&8 Anchor ---Reverse Whip (Very similar to 2nd part of previous move) Lead like an underarm turn. 12 Lead her forward (she does forward, forward L) 3&4 Roll and lock (she does back, together, forward) (Note stay turned side so she can step farther back, turning to face her on 5 will lead her forward) 56 Turn to face her (this leads her forward), open R 7&8 Anchor ---Cutoff whip (Very similar to 2nd part of first move) Change to R-L Lead like an underarm turn. 12 Lead her forward (she does forward, forward L [pivot L]) (Flick her hand out to the right in a U shape, so she turns left) 3&4 Roll and lock (she does back, together, forward) (Note stay turned side so she can step farther back, turning to face her on 5 will lead her forward) 56 Turn to face her, open R 7&8 Anchor ---Fancy Whip pattern 1-4 Whip Release left hand (open whip) 56 Open R, Cross the slot and step with her down the slot 78 no steps, lean far left and stop her from turning (she steps onto her R and points her L down the slot) 910 Lead her to turn L back down the slot and roll and lock her 11&12 Triple-in-place ---Now free tuck out with a slide 12 in place (lead her to step back R, replace L) &3 she does French cross 4 ? 5 I slide across the slot - She slides down the slot 6 I cross in front, she steps L + sugar out

--Start shaping early --Loosen my hold on her back --on 2, power myself onto my toe from my STANDING leg --Fix frame on my right side - Shoulder down, Hand lower on shoulder blade, elbow up --Unwind my body when I am up (end of 3, rewind on the way down) --Lower slowly at end of 3 as I start powering forward

Need to smooth out rise and fall. Exercise: In place: Start body down, foot down. Body up, then foot up, foot down, body down. Keep knees and ankles together Side to side: Place foot to side, receive weight, up. Waltz basics: Compress (move your body weight in the direction that you will move) Push from standing leg onto receiving leg. redirect energy sideways, push side, then up.

Need to time my swing to coincide with my forward driving step. which will automatically create a left side lead which will take me outside partner. I need to smooth out my transitions. 1 Down/compress 2 Drive forward, swing, CBM, HT 3 T (on feather, I am stepping outside partner) 4 TH, Low slowly don't step forward, compress DOWN on 1. notes: CBM: Think skiing. Feet, knees, Hips forward (although hips are open due to the step) Ribs, shoulders Turned. Head forward. -- Keep tracking forward. Try to keep flowing: Do not shape on starter step. (L forward) Drive forward in cbm (R foot forward, swing L side forward) Step forward L w/left side lead next step, step forward R in CBMP (outside partner)
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Her footwork is T-H, T-H, T-H No footrise, only body rise. Release toe of powering (driving) foot on backwards steps.

DanceStep.Comment: 23 Break step, 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side (switch to R-R) 23 Step back, pivot L (total 180 degrees) She pivots and crosses sides 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side 23 Break step (still R-R) --- variation 2 (ladies turn) 23 Break step, 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side (switch to R-R) 23 Step back, pivot L (total 180 degrees) She pivots and crosses sides 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side (Lead lady to do 360 degree turn to her left) (her footwork - 3R back (pivot 180 L), step on 4R forward, chanee &turn [left next to R], turning L, push side 1L, break forward 2R) 23 Break step (still R-R) --- variation 3 (R-R, left under, ladies turn, man's turn) 23 Break step, 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side (switch to R-R, L-L over) 23 Step back, pivot L (total 180 degrees) She pivots and crosses sides 4&1 Cha-Cha-Side (Lead lady to do 360 degree turn to her left) This leaves us R-R L-L UNDER 23 Break step (I turn L, bringing each of my hands over my head) TECHNICAL NOTE: On her turn, wind her up earlier and make a SMALLER loop around her head

---Whip w/Man's R turn 1-4 Whip Hold L hand on hip to keep her from getting too far away 56 - Same Continue turning L 7 Hook R behind L Pass my R hand behind my back (L-R-L hand) done ---Whip w/Man's L turn 1-4 whip Raise left hand thumb down 5 step forward under arm 6 Draw R foot in under my body and 7&8 spin L 1.5 turns facing side, connect R-L then, side pass her out ---Fancy whip pattern 1-4 Whip Hold L hand on hip to keep her from getting too far away 56 - Same Continue turning L 7 Hook R behind L Pass my R hand behind my back (L-R hand) Finish R-R, thumb down. -L-L over (do prance thing) 12 - Lead her forward to my R 3&4 - Turn her L 180 deg (her footwork is step forward R and pivot L 180 deg, replace L, step forward R) 5&6 - repeat other direction 7&8 - repeat 3&4 and send her 9&10 - send her out We are R-R, L-L over Now do a side pass Move to L side of slot 12 Lead her forward, Forward separate my hands, R straight down to keep her close 3&4 step under my L turning L then straighten my L arm to keep her from turning 5&6 lead her to turn L 1 rev, now L-R -now do a free spin from L-R 12 Forward prep, spin her L 3&4 I turn R 1 rev 5&6 done

Twinkle: Align Diag center. S - L Straight forward (diag-cent) Q - R Diag to right (between her legs), up to toes. Rotate body R, send chest (not legs) in direction of next step. Q - L Step in promenade Lower slowly (foot and knee at same time) before driving onto next (slow) step. Feather?: S - R Drive straight forward with her in promenade Q - L Step forward toe left side leading, close her (she steps side) Q - R Step forward in CBMP outside partner. we are hip to hip in closed. First half of next slow (lower slowly, rotate my body to face forward and close my feet - at this point we are in closed position) Next half of slow is start of next twinkle. --- Open reverse turn: S - L Straight forward (diag-cent) Q - R Side (along same line) Q - L BACK (not together) she can either go outside partner or in line - depending on how I lead it S - R Back Q - Open side Q - Diag wall in cbmp

Always finish an anchor with your feet apart. Anchor back on 6 to tension the connection. Practice triple-forward. Step forward flat, Diag Forward toe, cross in front flat. Practice anchors: Left fott forward, turn RIGHT on post, triple, step (with feet apart) Take small steps. Straighten my leg on the anchor.

Twinkle setup: Diag wall L - Straight R - Diag Forward (TH) L - Ribs toward diag-wall strongly (so I am in front of her) We are in promenade --- Right turn: R - Forward strongly L - Side across the front of her R - Straight back (lead her outside partner) -- L - Drive straight back and heel turn on my L Head (Twist my body strongly to my L) R - Lift up onto my toe Make sure I STAY LEFT! L - Step out in promenade

Start R-R L-L over 12 Lead side pass on 2, lead down w/R so she pivots 1.5 to L 3&4 R over my head 5&6 Raise L and Step towards her, wrap my R hand around her back +++ Tuck out L BACK R BACK (Leading her forward) Now do tuck
Timing. 1 - Step 2 - Hold 3 - Step 4 - Step

Start is similar to a right turn. LRL - SQQ - Twinkle, RLR - SQQ - Forward, Side, Back --- Ladies outside R turn start backing LOD, shoulder lead R L - S - Back, lead her outside partner turn to face center R - & - Side (Lead her with my R hand to start turning R) L - Q - Together (Lead her with my L hand to continue turning to face me [backing LOD/Backing Diag Wall]) Turn to face her [slightly center of LOD] R - Q - step onto a bent knee (two hands connected, palms together, fingers pointing up) ---- L - S - Step outside partner (stay down, bent knee to bent knee) Now lead her to develope x - Q - Straighten my left leg x - Q - Bend my left leg ---- Now, lead her to do 3 pivots to her L R - S - Step back, lead her with my L hand to pivot L L - Q - Side (facing center) R - Q - Together My connection is similar to a roll and lock, but I DO NOT let go of my R hand... it continues around to her shoulder. ---- Finish with a left turn
DanceStep.LadysSteps: --- Ladies outside R turn R - S - Forward, outside partner L - & - Pivot R R - Q - Pivot R to face him L - Q - Pivot R to face him (bent knee) ---- R - S - Step back outside partner (stay down, bent knee to bent knee) Now do develope x - Q - Straighten R leg, slowly Point L toe forward (leaning back slightly to counter weight) x - Q - Lower onto L leg until R leg almost touches the floor (do not lower R leg) ---- Now, do 3 pivots to the L L - S - pivot L R - Q - pivot L L - Q - pivot L (do not step back R) (keep left, wait for lead) ---- Finish with a left turn

DanceStep.Comment: Dance basics: Relaxed posture, hold Demo Triple - Triple. Roll from inside ball to flat, then heel down, inside foot Ball-heel down. Rock Step - Keep heel up Try w/music Closed poistion - Right arm position, raise arms from back. Left hand relaxed.
