How to lead a rock in closed L-R hand position (her hand cupped down), connection Frame - How to lead a rock w/my left hand. Try w/music Transistion from Closed to open. Man moves back, keeps connection w/right as he backs up Try w/musice Transition from open to close. I place her L on my R shoulder. Try /w music (called) Try /w music (man leads)

Break on 1: Lunge R or L, followed by slow collect or Out, Out (the rotate hips) or Hop back (but don't hop) (then bend and straighten knees) -- On 3: 3 count closed basic: 12 Same 3 - Left leg up to R knee (flamingo style), turn body R 180 deg, the snap head R 180, push out to L. 4-8 rotate hips -- on 5: 5 count whip + push back break 12 same 34 same (keep her close) 5 Draw her in slightly, then pop her out with front of R hand and (slight) heel of L hand (we both go back) 6-x rotate hips -- on 7: same as break on 1

56 - Rock her back Let go of R hand 1&2 - Lead her forward (step in close to her) L hand turns thumb down between us 3- She turns L to face me &4 - Finish Triple 56 Rock back ----Variation (She turns, her turns) & - I step forward under my own arm 4 and turn R 56 rock back

This move is used to stall while the traffic clears. First three steps of a twinkle: S - L Forward Q - R Forward into promenade Q - L Forward in CBMP ------- Triple twinkle: S - R Forward (Body weight BACK) Turn her to closed (outside partner) Q - L DO NOT MOVE L FOOT, do not release L foot, Flex forward/up, then back onto this foot. Q - R Back S - L Back Turn her to promenade Q - Brush R and Move back down LOD Q - Step L ---- Repeat or do 456 of a twinkle to finish.

1&2 - Lead her forward, move toward her (like a underarm turn) Left hand, thumb down 3&4 - Lead her to turn left, keep right hand low... at her hip 56 - Rock IN-PLACE 1&2 - Lead her forward across my body to my left 3&4 - Unwrap her to her right 56 Rock-step

Start with a regular twinkle: 1S L - Forward 1Q R - Forward diag (wall) 1Q L - Forward (~ diag center) (DO NOT PUT HER IN PROMENADE) leave her in closed. Note: Shoulders are straight down LOD for all of zig zag --- Zig - zag: 1S R - Forward 1Q L - Forward, turn hips 90 deg R Keep shoulder square to wall - go from outside L (diag center) to outside R (diag wall) 1Q R - Forward 1S L - Forward Keep shoulder square to wall - go from outside R (diag wall) to outside L (diag center) 1Q R - Forward --- To finish 1S R Forward 1Q L - Forward, turn hips 90 deg R - DO NOT ALLOW HER TO TURN - I turn so she is in promenade 1Q R - Forward --- Exit using a normal twinkle exit =====technique====== On Step 3 - Step OUT (leap of faith) (not down) (large step) and land toe-heel-knee.

Sugar breaks: 1 - Normal Break --- 1 - Sugar tuck break Lead her forward, L - Scuff forward, press L. L hand flat against hers. Slowly turn herL 360 deg --- 3 - Sugar tuck break 1 - L Back 2 - R BACK & Scuff L forward 3 - Press L (body facing into the slot, rib cage extended down the slot) - Her fottwork: 1 R - Forward 2 L - Forward & scuff R forward, 3 - Press R forward 4 - Step R while turning R 5 - Step L while turning toward partner 1 - Forward R --- 5 - Normal break. ----------------------------Side pass breaks: 1 - Normal --- 3 - 1L - Back 2R - Forward &L - Scuff 3L - Press - Right hand on her R hip, lower left hand in front of her. slowly unwind. 4567 - Slowly unwind, cross R in front of L 1 L back -- her foootwork: 1R forward 2L forward &R Scuff R 3R Press L rest: slowly unwind.
Right hand over my L 12 - Rock step 3&4 - Triple step L 5&6 - Reach around R, LOW, connect L-R 12 - Rock step

1 Rock 2 Step - L hand LOW, lead her into me 3&4 - Forward, Forward, Forward 5&6 - Forward, Forward, Forward 12 - Walk (forward), walk (she does hook behind) -- continue exit: 5&6 - Stop moving she is at a 90 deg to my right 12 - Rock step 3&4 - Tuck 5&6 - her out
1 - Rock 2 - Step (Lead her into my R side) 4 - Kick L 6 - Kick R 12 - rock step
Start shaping early (on the way down) Back twinkle - Keep shoulders square

Minor breaks can be in the instrumental or in the vocals. do breaks from warm-up. & Point, & point. Shoulders Up down & down. Hop Hop (but don't hop) Knee flex (same as after pull back) (remember to raise feet off ground) Rotate Hips etc...

Underarm turn, switch to R-R -- 56 LR - Rock replace 1 - Lead her (to my) R, Tap L 2 - Step L - Touch her back w/my R hand 3 - Lead her (to my) L, Step R 4 - Step R (she touches my back) -- Continue in a circle Exit: 3 - Tap L 4 - Lead her to spin 360 deg L 5&6 - Tri-ple step -- back to basic 12 - Rock, replace

Back Twinkle: Point diag-wall do 1st 3 steps of left turn (moving straight, curve around her so she is on my left hip): SQQ - LRL - End up backing Diag wall, left outside partner Back twinkle: SQQ - R - TH - Back L - T - Back R - TH Brush, turn body to backing diag-center. SQQ - L - TH - Back R - T - Back L - TH Brush, turn body to backing diag-center. Repeat: Exit: Do a left turn from backing diag wall to facing diag wall - she goes from outside R to outside L SQQ - LRL ------ Technique: Always think of steps from split weight to split weight instead of feet together to start. --- Backwards step: Step 1: Push toe back (by opening crotch) lower (but keep tail down), push backwards and roll onto foot (dont lower until passing foot brushes by) footwork on catching foot is actually Toe-heal(kiss)-Toe(push next foot to toe). Step 2: Open crotch and land on toe of receiving foot. Step 3 (leap of faith) Brush and land TOE-HEEL-KNEE-TAIL.

Try passing my feet on move. Move side to side & forward and back in slot. Left side pass: Start facing side L-R 12 - L back, R diag forward (same) I am facing across the slot, so the next moves are E-W moves 3 - Check back L & - replace R 4 - Step across slot L 5 - Step onto R ball and pivot 180 deg L (reach turn) & - Replace L (in same place it was) 6 - Step across R (feet pointing across slot, body diag toward partner, look at partner) -- & Rotate square to partner (no step) 1 - Back L -----------------On underarm turn do pivots up and down the slot: 12 - L back, R diag forward (same) Turn 180 deg R to follow her down the slot 3 - Step down slot L & - step and pivot L on R 4 - replace L Change hand to R-R Body facing across slot, head looking up slot 5 - Step up slot R (give slack in arm - DONT LEAD HER BACK WITH ME) & - Step L and pivot R 180 deg. 6 - Replace R (back into starting position) -----------------On Tuck - SAME FOOTWORK as L side pass notes: Keep R hand thru 4, so I can pop her back with both hands: See her footwork
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Her footwork on Tuck ( 'S' pattern ) 12 - RL - Same 3& - RL - French - Cross (step WIDE) 4 - R - Step across (she is lead forward w/2 hands) 5 - L Walk a & - R WIDE 6 - L Circle (Finish facing across the slot) -- & - Turn R 90 deg to face him (no step) 1 - R step

DanceStep.Comment: 1-4 of whip. 5 Turn R 180 deg on L, step onto R (turn her also) (I am facing down slot the direction I will go, she in at my L hip ready to walk backwards down the slot) 6 Step down slot L -- stop her from moving so she can anchor -- these last few steps are the same as previous (styling) lesson 7 Step down slot R reach turn to L & replace L 8 - Step across R. (body facy across slot, face and arm down slot to partner)
Basic (change to ballroom hold - left hand high), 12 - L Touch, R Step - Lead her to tuck in Leftwards with my right hand 3&4 - Tri-ple-step - Lead her to turn 360 deg R to face me 56 - Rock step
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1 - Tap R 2 - Step R 3&4 or 4 - Either triple around corner or spin on R ball 56 - Rock step

DanceStep.Description: Class 1 - Starter step, Closed basic, Inside Turn, Tuck
DanceStep.Comment: See previous desc.

R-R, L-L under tuck: 12 - Same &34 - Tuck 5&6 - Triple Open left (facing into slot) R-R, L-L over Lead a left side inside roll: 12 - Step in place, lead her Back, Replace 3&4 Her inside roll Keep hands up, wrists together. 5&6 - Step under my arms, across the slot, turning R (facing into the slot) ---Repeat this pattern--- To Exit, do this pattern with a double head-loop: 3&4 - Her inside roll, keep her CLOSE, brush my left hand over her head, My right hand behind my head and FACE HER (don't stay sideways) 5&6 - Sha-say-side (so I move away) slide my left hand down her arm and connect.

----Problems with Frame: Left hand - is extended too straight. I need to bend my elbow more so I'm not pulling my partner left. Right hand - is locking her in place so she can't shift left. I need to direct my energy OUT not IN. Body - I'm twisting my body (breaking my frame) ----Waltz - - I need to LOWER SOONER and FASTER and STRAIGHT DOWN focus on LOWERING the rise is automatic. Two kinds of lowering: Down MY back - to go forward down HER back (my front) - to go back ----Viennesse Waltz Don't twist my body. rotate my HEAD and BODY around corner. Head back on L turns Head forward L on R turns Stay on my foot LONGER (especially on the SLOW)

56 - Rock Step --- 1&2 - Pressure her with my right (towards her) left away (we both rotate L 90 deg) double head-loop 3&4 - Move-away slide L down her R arm 5&6 Rock -- Finish with a he-she or ladies L open spin
56 --- change R-R 1 tap L - Prep her (to my) R 2 step R 3&4 - lead her around to her L 360 connect L-R 56 - rock-step
56 - Rock OPEN (lead her open with my L hand) --- 1&2 - Lead her to LEAN forward (triple-in-place) 3&4 - Straighten out 56 - Rock - slight LEAN back --- repeat to exit, close after the rock step

SWING! Right turn From Diag center 1 - S - R - HT - Feet and body turn 1/8 to LOD 2 - Q- L - T - SWING! Right hips UP!, body turns to wall, feet pointing back diag wall - Since R hip is high, body, etc is tilted LEFT 3 - Q - R - TH - Close feet, turn body to backing diag wall
12 - Back, Back (do NOT open to L, stay in front of her) 3 - Tuck &4 - and turn (her) 5&6 - tri-ple-step --- For a double, wind her up (in to my R) on 2 Note: be sure to halo her head
DanceStep.LadysSteps: Same as tuck, except return to starting position

DanceStep.Comment: Underarm turn footwork: 12 back back 3&4 tri-ple-step (but DO NOT turn, stay facing up the slot, after she turns, she will be facing my back) Place her R hand on my L shoulder (Her palm down, so she can feel when I back up) 56 - Point to the side R, Step (in) R [to move forward, step forward, for back, step back] 78 - Point to the side L, Step L 910 - repeat 56 (moving forward) 1112 - repeat 78 12 - repeat 56 (in place) 34 repeat 78 56 repeat 56 (moving back) 78 repeat 78 9&10 RLR - anchor - Triple around 180 deg to L and back

R-R Shake-hand hold Inside roll: 12 - Back, open L (prep her on 2) 3&4 - she does inside 1.5 turns L Head loop myself R, right hand on her back (to stop her) 5&6 volta R to other side of slot (R, cross in front L, R) 78 Hook behind R, Back L Now tuck her out (she ends up on the other end of the slot) 12 Prep open tuck 3 Step BACK (so she steps back and she winds up) &4 She tucks out 5&6 anchor-in-place (may need to chasse back if I'm too close)

Close her up 12 3&4 5&6 --open tuck: 1 - Lead her to step back with my L hand 2 - Let go of L hand, she steps forward 3 - entend my R arm out so she can wind up. & - she does single 4 - or double tuck (I can do a R turn starting here) 5&6 - Anchor-in-place

Dancing Baby: Before my forward step, I should be tilted back (my partner tilted forward) Footwork: Step 3 almost flat (instead of TH) to keep dance flat. Knees: Bend knees to turn body. Head weight: Keep head weight going around corner in a smooth rotation. More footwork: On step 3, close foot quickly and change weight.

Start holding hands. Tuck: 12 3 Drop R hand straight down and keep contact (she turns 180 deg R) &4 After she turns, my R hand is on her L hip (and her L hand) My L hand is high between us. --- Lead her forward, wrap her 360 deg L: 56 Lead her Forward, Forward. 7&8 Raise L hand and lead her to turn 360 deg L to face me. Lower both hands to her shoulders and finish with a basket whip finish: 910 - Back back 11&12 - An-chor-step

R-R L-L under -- 12 3&4 Tuck Send R hands over her head 5&6 finish tuck so she is facing down the slot (away from me) R-R, L-L both Over her shoulders (thumbs up) ---- 78 - Lead her straight back, take L hand over her head 9&10 - Turn to face her (anchor step)

DanceStep.Description: R-R tuck, shooting galery, reverse whip exit
DanceStep.Comment: R-R, L-L under Tuck: 12 3&4 - send both hands over her head 5&6 - finish R-R, L-L over --shooting gallery 12 Lead her to step forward, forward to my L 3&4 - Lead her forward, turn 180 L and replace, step across 5&6 - same on my L side -- repeat exit by triple step, send her out. ---reverse whip exit: 12 back, back 3 - Flick my l hand down and to my R &4 - She turns 180 deg L, her L shoulder into my L hand 56 - Lead her back, I open L 7&8 - Anchor-in-place

Head weight: Head should swing in the direction of movement opposite hips. -- R turns: Head is left, going forward
L turns; Head is left, circling backward toward back left quadrant of head (more swing on backwards step)

Basket whip footwork. 12 - Lead her FORWARD (bring my L hand straight forward and turn CW to keep her coming straight) 3&4 - Place my R hand on her upper hip (optional L hand OVER her L shoulder) and 56 - lead her back 7&8 - Anchor in place -- Optional I turn: I turn 360 deg R starting on 6 --- Optional she and I turn: 3&4 - I Place my L hand on her L shoulder (thumb down) and 5 - Open her up R 6 - Lead her to 7&8 - free spin 360 deg R (I do tandem free spin R)

Reverse whip footwork: 1-4 = (locked) Whip footwork 12 - Back back 3&4 - To closed (Raise Left hand between us, thumb down) 5-8 = Underarm turn footwork 56 - Lead her forward, side (She turns L) 7&8 - anchor-in-place --- Option: I turn R on 7&8 (I will wrap R hand around my back and pass hand L->R and then R->L)

R-R 12 Back, Open L (lead her forward, forward[Wind her up on 2]) 3&4 - Lead her to turn 360 deg L, immediately place my L hand on her back, thumb down and catch the back of her R arm to stop her from turning) 5&6 - Switch to the other side of the slot, lead her to step, step, step FORWARD (wind her up). I lead her to step forward by switching to my R hand over her R forearm. 7&8 - Pull back on her arm to spin her L 360 deg. 9&10 - Anchor in place.
On underarm turn, lady does step, step, CLOSE on 3&4. Shoulder, hips, etc during 5&6. Out on 1. --- or same for man (and lady) on (locked) whip (7&8)

Starter Step: BACK on 5 Forward L on 8 and FULLY DOWN at the end of 8. Slight CBM to L is wind-up for step on 1 ---- Feather: S On 1 and 2: CMB to R Push forward (Straighten both legs) This step should power the next two steps (I should glide through 3 and 4) HT R on 2 - Q T L on 3 DO NOT STRAIGHTEN L LEG as I pass over it Try to keep head level Stay on toe, but bend L leg as R leg brushes by. - Q TH on 4 This is the longest step (Leap of faith) Open thighs and extend leg as far as I can (Should be ahead of me, NOT UNDER ME) This guarantees that I will bend by knee and LOWER at the end of 4, since I need to get my body over this outstreched leg. -- done

from Left Turn: Align LOD and Do a Twinkle: LRL - Send her to center Do a check: R - Diag forward check L - Replace R - Step back toward wall She is open to me L, facing LOD then, Hold for 3 beats and Turn 360 deg left behind her and switch sides as I lead her to turn 360 deg R in front of me. Hold 3 beats and then lead her to spin 360 deg L into my R hip. (I need to be on my L foot) -- Now do the shadow: RLR LRL Remember to Keep down line hip high. To Exit: RLR Lead her (by pressuring her L hip) to spin out in front of me: She is facing me (backing line of dance) Do Canter step to change (fake) feet: R 1 L 23 + Natural 456 Connect here (shee needs to DRIVE forward) Natural 123

DanceStep.Description: Outside Whip, Apache Whip, Whip w/Free Spin
DanceStep.Comment: --Outside Whip: 1-4 Same, raise L hand Forearm to forearm 5 open L 6 Lead her to turn 7&8 - Anchor --Apache Whip: 1-4 Same, Left hand straight down 5 Open L 6 Pass her L hand to my R hand 7&8 - Switch to R-L --Whip w/Free Spin: 1-4 Same, Lower L hand, let go of L hand 5 Open left 6 Lead her to free spin L (I can optionally free spin R) 7&8 - Anchor, connect
Apache whip 1-4: 5 Open L 6 Hook the front of her hip with my L hand. 7 - Step BACK R 8 - BACK L Place her R arm around my back, hold on my shoulder with my R hand Repeat 78 13&14 - Triple away

Outside whip w/ladies double: 1-8 same, on 8 reach around my back with my R hand, turn 270 deg R I am on the rail facing across the slot, R-L Lead her into hammerlock 1 - Lead her BACK 2 - she replaces 3&4 - She turns 360 L into hammerlock -- optional I can prance her (First step for her would be away from me L foot) -- to exit: 11&12 - Lower the hand R on her back and turn her to face me.

Need to press my heal into the floor before driving forward/backward. Kick out foot on 6,1 of right turn (going into forward step) -- Pattern: L-R Both facing down the line of dance. 1 Forward L 2 Side R (Press palm-to-palm R-L) 3-6 Pivot around Rightward.

L-R Lead her forward 1 2 - Place back of my R hand on her R back (this tells her that her next step is pivot L) (then roll and lock) 3&4 - Push her shoulder through so she steps (Side R, together L, forward R) 56 - Same as whip ending 7&8

R-R Thumbs down (this can be done with a shake hand hold also) 12 - Back, Open R. Flick her R hand DOWN and out. 3&4 - She pivots R (side R, Together L, forward R) I raise my hand and catch her L shoulder. 56 - Regular 7&8 - Whip finish

R-R L-L Over 1 Back 2 Open R Lead her out (same lead as reverse whip) 3&4 - She does side-back-forward. I Lead across my face to L with my L hand. My R hand is flat on her back over her R hand. My L hand has her R hand in front of her leading her slightly toward me. I am on my L foot. Lead her to prance with my R hand (on her back) 56 - Lead her to step L (away from me), R (toward me). --to Exit: Let go of her R hand on 6 7 Prep her out (away) (She preps with her R arm) 8 Lead her to turn L 9&10 - An-chor-step.

R-R 1 Back 2 Open L (Prep her out so she will turn L on 3) Lower my R hand straight down as she turns 3&4 - She triples 360 deg L. I turn 180 deg L to face down the slot. My R hand is flat on her back over her R hand. My L hand has her R hand in front of her leading her slightly toward me. I am on my L foot. Lead her to prance with my R hand (on her back) 56 - Lead her to step L (away from me), R (toward me). --to Exit: Let go of her R hand on 6 7 Prep her out (away) (She preps with her R arm) 8 Lead her to turn L 9&10 - An-chor-step.

Entrance: Twinkle + Check and out (Facing down LOD, Hands together) LRL Forward, Side, Together (Hands press together) RLR Leader L hand through - Pivot, Pivot, Pivot (spot down LOD) (she pivots L) ---Exit: L - Lead her forward R - She pivots R L - She pivots R I connect and do a natural turn
---------Technique: Foot work on R turn: RLR - Same LR - Same L - FLAT (and press into heal for next step)
Stay on 1 longer (1/4 of a turn) On 2 (1/8 turn), body turns less (Body faces wall or center, both feet pointed diag-xxx {one forward, one backing}) on 3 (1/8 turn)
On backwards step: Weight into HEEL!

--Cross body lead+ --Inside double turn: (switching positions): Side L2: Wind her up (Keep L hand at shoulder level) Break (forward!) R3: Lead her to turn L 4&1: She does double turn L, STOP her by droping my L hand to my L hip, place my R palm on her L hip (we are both facing center... we will be moving BLOD) 2& - Push out of my L foot, raising my L HIP, Relax onto my R foot (DONT raise my R hip) 3& - Repeat 4& - Repeat 1 - Push out of my L foot, switch to R-L hold (wrist hold) --Check and pop: (note: this is HER footwork) 2 - Stop, she breaks back onto her R foot 3 - Lead her forward L 4 (I check FORWARD toward her) - Check her forward R (switch to my hand in her hand hold) & (and) - Replace (back) L 1 (pop - we both pop back) - Switch feet (R back, L tap forward) --Lead her to turn 1.5 R and sit on my L knee 2R - Wind her down (forward) and 3 - to have her to pivot L 4 - Pivot L & - Pivot 1 - Pivot - Catch her with my L hand pointed in an 'L' (arm pointed up) 2 - Sit her on my L knee (My l knee is bent, foot flat) (place my R hand across her front onto her L hip) Hold... 3 - Spin her out (she spins R) her steps: 4 - Pivot R & - Pivot 1 - Pivot --Done 2 - She breaks back R

--Footwork exercises: Up foot, down foot, shift weight to heel, down body, up body, shift to ball --- Down body (knees), up foot (heel up), up body, down foot (heel down) --Body movement exercise: Move Shoulders and Hips 1/8 turn from side to side keeping head and feet straight --Footwork exercise: R - HT, T, TH, H , HT TH --Add timing SQQ --Add two exercises together: Straight down floor --Heel turn exercise: Back, turn around on heel, fall sideways, step out --Pattern exercise: Diag-center; L - 12345, strattle horse on 1 23 Side 4 turn diag wall on 5, 1234 strattle horse on 5. --Put it together with a partner: Progressively get through entire 15 +1 steps

Cross body, overturn on second half: 234&1 - Start 23 - Overturn her - open her up so we are both facing in the direction of travel. 4&1 - Check and pop her to the side. Now she in on her L foot. 2&3 - Lead her forward, Side, together (far hip is high) (we are facing each other) 4&1 - Lead her forward, back - RLR - Forward, Side, together (we are both facing out) -repeat To exit: 23 - Break forward, replace. Then follow with an outside turn. 4&1 - Chasee 23 - Outside 4&1 - Turn 23 - We both back break 4&1 - Break (forward) and pop. 2 - Break back, while leading her forward and closing her & - Down on my L leg 3+4&1- Side onto my R leg 2 Break forward into a basic

1. Foot ball/heel exercises up/down body/foot 2. Footwork exercises. HT, T, TH, etc 3. Body turn exercises... body turns, head/foot stay straight 4. 15 steps turn on 1,5,5 5. Heel turn - remember to slow down closing foot (don't close until turn is done) 6. Practice 15 steps w/rise and fall + timing SQQ 7. Connector step - heal pull: S - Back R S - Brush w/ small side L S - FORWARD R (this is the starter step) --- Modification - two patterns down long side after natural: S - Back R Q - Side L Q - Forward R (This is starter for next pattern DOWN the LOD)

L-R 12 Lead her forward, Wind her up to my L Place my R hand on her forearm and take it toward me to get her to 3&4 She pivot, pivot, pivots forward 5&6 Anchor in place --- variation: 5&6 Headloop myself - then turn to my R and place my R hand on her back --- variation: start R-R 1 - Lead her forward, 2 - Open L, extend my R arm to wind her up 3&4 - same 5& - Head loop myself, 6 - step forward R turning L, place my R hand on her back ---

R-R 12 Lead her forward, forward (wind her up to my L) 3&4 - Turn her L 1/2 turn into shadow (keep her close) 56 - Walk R, Walk L (don't prance) 78 - Repeat 910 - Touch forward R, Step Back R 1112 - Touch back L, Step forward L 13141516 - Repeat 912 17&18 - Send her out (she turns 1/2 R) R-R L-L over 12 Wind her up to my L, start her turning R 3&4 She pivots L 1.5 turns 5&6 - Head loop me, headloop her, R hand behind her back 12 - Lead her back (Slight), forward 3&4 - Lead her to free spin LEFT, I free spin R 5&6 - anchor in place

Crossbody to 2 hands open: 234&1 cross 234&1 body Two hand open 2 - Break BACK: 3 Turn my R shoulder toward my partner, close my L hand to my R hip as she charges me (to my R side) I turn L 4&1 - Step forward, cross in front, side (L) Now my left shoulder should be forward. -- Hit, hit 2 - Shift to my R foot (straight R leg) 3 - Shift to my L foot (straight L) --Option 1 (break): 4&1 Turn 90 deg R and cha-cha forward. 23 break, forward, continue --Option 2 (cha-cha forward) 4&1 - Brush R - R forward, L lock, R step 23 break forward --Option 3 (pivot side - same direction as option 1) (Note: keep arms WIDE) 4&1 - Forward R, channey turn L , Side R (grab her hand) 23 - Break forward.

Typical: (1) triple foward, (2) triple foward, (3) triple foward, (4) Break forward. --variations (3) Step, fan other leg (do NOT step) (4) 2 Step, & tap behind (or tap in front for backwards steps)
To Lead (3) Fan: (2) triple forward: 4& 1 - Wind up by bringing my R Forward This also causes her to step on 2 - She can't lock back because I'm holding her back from stepping Fan her by fanning L (bringing my &3 - L side slowly Forward) --------- To Lead (4) Tap step: 2 - Bring my L side sharply forward & - Tap behind 3 - Replace

Start with a Reverse Turn: Diag center: SQQ - LRL - Lead her to do a heel turn. (Now backing line of dance) SQQ - RLR - TH,T,TH - Right side leading, closed position SQQ - LRL - TH, T (shoulder lead), TH, (outside partner) SQQ - RLR - HT,T,TH - Right side leading, closed position -- Heel pull exit to Promenade: SQQ - LRL - TH, H + IE of foot + IE of L foot, H out facing diag center. TECHNIQUE: STAY LEFT! Stretch FORWARD (direction)
Point diag wall: S - Forward Q - Check forward Q - Back S - Back Q - Side Q - Side (outside partner) facing diag-center

On anchor or Triple Step do: point step (out, front, back or side) or tap step (in) On Walk walk do: Kick ball change Instead of anchor do: 4 - Push out (or across slot) 5-8 - Drag other foot in, then step.

Triple in Place RL Hook behind RL Tap in front RL Tap in back RL Tap in front/back RL Tap in RL DT Tap Front RL DT Tap Front, Side RL Kick front RL Kick side RL Kick front, Side RL Sailor shuffle RL Hook behind RL + add arms Turn RL Double RL --- Kick ball change RL --- Isolations: Head RL DT Head Tic Toc Head UD DT Shoulder up down RL alternate Shoulder rotate back RL alternate Shoulder rotate fwd RL alternate Rib cage RL (8, 4, 2, 1, cha cha) Rib cage expand contract (8, 4, 2, 1, cha cha) Rib cage Four corners (RL) Rib cage Rotate Hips side RL Hips Fwd Back (8, 4, 2, 1, cha cha + RL)

----Out-out variation: 23 - LR - Break back, replace 4 - L - Step forward & - R - Out 5 - L - Out 23 - Hip roll -or- shoulder roll -or- Hip-Hip -or- rib cage
----Check and pop variation: 23 - LR - Break back, replace 4 - Check forward & - Pop back 5 - Feet together 23 - Knee-knee -or- shoulder -etc-

----Slide and roll combinations: Entry: 23 - RL - Break back, replace 4 - R - Step forward & - L - Step Forward (to the L), turn 90 deg R 1 - R - Step together THEN: ---Exit 1 - Turning lock: 2 - L - Step slightly Forward turning R 3 - R - Step forward turning R 4 - L - Step forward turning R & - lock R in front of L 1 - L Step back
---Exit 2 - Slow turn: 2 - L - Step slightly Forward turning R 3 - cross R in front of L - Step forward turning R 4 - L - Step forward turning R & - cross R in front of L - 1 - L - Step back
---Exit 3 - Left Pivot: 2 - Step slightly forward L - , wind up R 3 - Back R - pivoting L 4 - Forward L - pivoting L & - Back R - pivoting L 1 - Forward L - pivoting L 2 - Break Back R
---Exit 4 - Basic: 2 - Drop into L knee 3 - Step forward R turning toward my partner 4&1 - Lock back
going backwards: 4&1: LRL - Back, Lock, Back 2&3 - Triple (hook behind, replace, side) 4&1 - Triple 2&3 - Triple 4&1 - Triple 2 - RL - Break back, replace

back lock: 4&1 - LRL 2 - Kick out R 3 - Turn 180 deg R (leave kicked foot there - toe pointing at partner) 4 - Step forward R (away from partner) 1 - Turn 180 deg L 234&1 - play (hips, shoulder, body roll, etc) (or just for two counts and triple back) 2 - Break back R
23 - RL - Break forward 4&1 - Back - lean back, then snap my head forward

--Start Diag-Center Long wall: L - Starter RLR - Feather --Reverse Wave: LRL - Reverse (to backing LOD) RLR - 3 step (backwards) LRL - Feather (backwards) [left outside partner] RLR - 3 step (backwards) LRL - Open Impetus (back, heel pull to slight side, forward) [open lady to promenade] --Pointing diag wall of SHORT WALL RLR - Feather [close lady] LRL - 3 step RLR - Natural LRL - Impetus [No turn] --Finish pointing diag center of LONG WALL RLR - Feather LRL - Reverse RLR - Feather finish LRL - 3 step RLR - Natural LRL - Impetus (Back, side, FORWARD) ----If you still have distance to corner of LW, finish Diag center and start a feather and repeat --Finish pointing diag center of SHORT WALL RLR - Feather LRL - Reverse RLR - Feather finish LRL - 3 step RLR - Natural LRL - Impetus (Back, side, FORWARD) --Finish pointing diag center of SHORT WALL REPEAT PATTERN

Natural top: 23 - Back L, replace R 4&1 LRL - Forward, cross in front, Diag back 23 - Hook in back, Step 4&1 - Hook in back, Step, step forward She should be by my side, momentum going back 23 - LR - Break back, replace check & pop: 4&1 - LRL - Forward, replace, side ----Variation 1 = Forward ocho 23 - Lead her forward (on 2), turn 41 - Lead her forward (on 2), turn --- Two exits: --Exit 1: 2 - Step SIDE R 3 - Step Forward L (into her) 4&1 - Cha Cha Side --Exit 2: Speed her up to a QQ on: 23 - Lead her forward (on 2), turn 4&1 - Turn R and have her walk forward +Lift my hand and have her walk behind me 23 - Cucaracha side, replace 4&1 - Cuban cross -----Variation 2 = Spin her: 4& - (SAME) - Hook in back, Step, 1 - Raise my hand so she can spin (I step forward) +Lift my hand and have her walk behind me 23 - Cucharacha side, replace 4&1 - Cuban cross
Slower on Sl-low Push on 'low' Teaching: Got students to dance pattern

--Entries: R-R (on forward basic) 23 Break back, replace 4&1 Lead low and to my R, so she is in sweetheart (L hand in front, R hand on her R hip) --Alternate entry: Same, but wind her up to turn 1.5 L. Have her turn into my chest, quickly connect to the front of her R hip ---Sliding doors: LR Forward break (she breaks back) LRL Cha-Cha in place hook L behind R, replace R, Slight side L (Lead her slight R to prep her to slide L) RL - Cucaracha R side, replace (lead her to cucaracha L then move R) on her hips or shoulders RLR - Lock forward, have her move R +repeat ---Exit: RLR - In place LR - Wind her up RLR - Spin her out L ----Banana entry: LR 23 - Side break Face each other and do L-R LRL 4&1 - Rotate backwards, my R hand on her R hip --Banana: 2 - Down on my R leg (she breaks forward L), twist L 3 L - up RLR 4&1 Forward, forward, forward in a Rward circle LR 23 Break, replace LRL 4&1 back, back, back in tracing the circle backwards banana repeat ----Inside turn R hand on her R shoulder, L hand fingertip-to-fingertip with her L hand out front R Lead her straight out (with my R hand on her shoulder) L Lead her to reach turn back toward me (she turns 180 R) 4&1 lead my R hand toward my R hip and then in front of me to my L (she will turn to be back in sweetheart) --repeat

Stay forward of my partner on feather, open impetus Hands: Left hand around her HAND NOT FINGERS. Right hand - FINGERS TOGETHER - Cup her lower shoulder blade Don't stretch left hand too far, keep energy from right hand going right

Technique: Transfer weight to a bent knee and up foot. Delayed Straightening of leg-foot-to hip. --- Open Chasse: On forward basic: 2 L Forward. 3 R Side (Remember, Hip Left, L left straight, R Foot UP, R knee bent, Weight on RIGHT.) 4 L Together & R Side 1 L Together (Hip to R, R leg straight, L foot up, L knee bent, weight on L foot) 2 R Back 3 L Side (L) (Hip to R) 4 R Together & L Side 1 R Together -- to exit, do a forward break 2 forward, etc. -- Variation: Closed chasse R 4&1 moving R 2 Open L, break back 3 Side R, Split weight 4 - Turn Lward & - Turn Rward 1 - Turn Lward, step forward on L foot 2 - Step through on R foot 3 - Step Side L 4 R Together (finish of open chasse) & L Side 1 R Together Do an open chasse.
L-R &1 - Break back 23 Lead her to turn R 180 deg into my R hand exit with Her 180 deg R Turn or 180 deg tuck out or 1.5 inside turn (R) lead with RIGHT hand, finish 2 hands

234&1 Outside turn 234&1 (Finish On My R) 2 - Tap in L (pointed R) (My Lead brings her forward and slightly R, then STOPS her - she thought she was going to do a Forward break) 3 - Tap out L (pointed L) (This turns her slightly to her R, so her next steps are kindof backwards) 4&1 - Back L, Side R, InFront L (Repeat for the other side:) 2 - Tap in R 3 - Tap out R 4&1 - Back R, Side L, InFront R ---To Exit: 2 Forward Break L (lead her to do a forward break)
2 Forward R, Slide back R 3 Forward L, Slide back L, 4&1 Step R, rotate on R heel, Rotate on R toe

Forward = Quarter-turn Start diag-wall S - R - HT Q - T - Body wall Q - T (Close feet) S - TH - Still on Rail, foot turned out in direction of next move Backward = Progressive chasse S - R - THT Q - T Q - T S - TH + knee (to do slow) Natural + Spin turn: S - HT - Forward R Q - T - Turn to back LOD Q - TH - Feet together (spin turn:) S - L - Ball (kiss heel) (R Pivot) S - HT + UP (Keep L in contact with ground) (Keep turning R) S - TH
Technique: On backward steps, place no-weighted foot BACK (out of way)

23 Open break 4&1 Chasse 23 360 deg turn to left (she turns 360 R), lead with my L hand over my head 4&1 Chasse ---Barrel roll: 23 Back break 4&1 Chasse R-L (Fingertips, palm up) 23 360 deg turn to left (she turns 360 R), lead with my R hand over my head 4&1 Chasse --Variation: 4&1 Sweep hand down and over my head again (I turn another 360 L) (Our footwork is pivot, pivot, side) ---Double crossover 23 Open break 41 Another Open Break 2&3 Chasse 41 Open break 23 Another Open Break ---------TECHNIQUE---------- Straight Left Leg (with some weight on it) Bent R leg (With weight into the toe-ball) Push down into R Leg until straight Transfer weight onto Bent L leg (on ball-toe)

Forward basic: 23 Check and Pop 4&1 (Lead with my shoulders) (she is back on her R foot) Swivel: 2 - Lead her forward and swivel her to her left (tango style) (I drop back on my R foot to counter her) 3 - Lead her to my R and get her ready for the natural top (I turn R and shift to my L foot) Natural Top: 4 - Hook behind R & - step L 1 - Hook behind R 2 - Step L 3 - Cross in front R Check and pop out: 4&1 (Lead with my shoulders) (she is back on her L foot) Cross body out ... ---Note: Just like a natural, I can repeat the pattern

Forward basic: 23 Check and Pop: 4&1 (Lead with my shoulders) (she is back on her R foot) Forward into reverse top: 2R - Turn her L (so her next step is straight back) 3L - Step FORWARD into her (My L foot is the post for the reverse top) (she steps back R) 4R - Step FORWARD R into her (footwork HT) (she hooks behind L) &L - Elvis to the L (keep L foot in place) 1R - Step FORWARD R (repeat) ---exits: --1. Repeat for 8 beats (must exit here) --2. Check and reverse: 2L - LIFT L foot, check forward while I contra R shoulder hard Forward 3 - Replace R chasse L while rotating R 4 - Side L (while rotating R) & - Together R (while rotating R) 1 - Side L (while rotating R) 2 - Hook behind R (I am in a natural now) --3. Forward basic 2L - Forward into her 3R - Replace 4&1 - Chasse Left --4. Open break (Actually release her early (on &L?) so be are open and: 2L - Forward break (open break) 3R - Replace 4&1 - Chasse Left

From Progressive Chasse: Slight variation on the last step: S - L - Slight Shoulder lead on forward step (which brings this step slightly forward rather than sideways when right quater turn follows) ---Forward Lock S - HT - R - Slight R shoulder lead - OUTSIDE PARTNER - Step forward Q - T - L - Forward, R SHOULDER LEAD Q - T - Cross R in back of L Natural turn: S - TH - Forward... etc (see tipple desc)

Into a corner, Start with - Natural turn: S - HT - Forward. Q - T - Side Q - TH - Together (Ending Backing LOD of long wall) --Tipple (Curving chasse): S - TH - L Back Starting to curve R (slight) Q - T - R Side Q - T - L Together S - T (Not TH, NEED TO BEND KNEE TO SLOW DOWN) - R Side (Facing LOD or Diag Wall of short wall) (Forward Lock) Q - T - L Forward Q - T - Lock R behind L S - TH - R Forward (Start natural spin turn) S - H - L Forward outside partner

Basic step is (similar to tango ocho). Standing on L, bring R toe in to back of L foot, pivot L foot 180 deg R, Step forward R. pattern 1: 23 LR - Open break 4&1 - Chasse Hand to hand - wide & - Slight turn to L 2 - Figure C to R 3 - Figure C to L 4 - Figure C to R &1 - Lock L behind R, step out R --repeat to exit, do an open break ==Pattern 2: X-Body lead 4&1 - Lower L hand, turn and then follow her out & - Rotate hand R to turn her toward me 2 - Turn hand R so she does a figure 'C' 3 - Figure C back 4&1 - turn her back and have her lock to my R? ==Pattern 3: Same as 2, but I lock toward and away from her

Short wall LOD: Natural Heel Pull Variation: Back L, Side R, Together with a hop L (Now facing LOD of long wall) Hop (wait for the start of a measure) 1 Hop R, forward (she hops R forward) 2 Hop back 3 Hop L, Forward 4 Hop back 5678 - Repeat 1234 - Repeat 5 Hop L, Forward 6 Hop back (Land ON L LEG) 7 STEP FORWARD R 8 HOP FORWARD R Q - Forward L Q - Lock R behind L S - Forward L S - Forward R QQ - Chasse part of the right quarter turn

Technique on walks: Push from HIPS, driving foot should turn out with hip. Footwork is ball-heel onto a straight leg! ---Entry 1 (from shadow): R-R 2 - L - Back (lead her back) 3 - R - Replace 4&1 - LRL - Lead her into shadow (L-L, R hand on her shoulder, left hand over her L hand) 23 - Forward, Forward 4&1 - Lock 23 - Forward, Forward 4&1 - Lock 23 - Lead her to spin out ---Entry 2 (from outside turn): 2 - Back R (she does back L) 3 - Replace L 4&1 - LRL - Lead outside turn Lower R hand, lead out [forward from me] (to keep her turning to shadow) 23 - Step R, Step L 41 - Step R, Step L (change to her footwork) 2 - BACK R 3 - replace L (lead her L side forward so she will lock forward) 4&1 - RLR - Lock forward 23 - LR - Walk, walk 4&1 - LRL 23 RL - Walk, Walk 4&1 - RLR 2 - L Forward - Lead her forward 3 - R back - Spin her out L --- Exit 1 Basic (Remember to synchopate out to get back on my footwork) --- Exit 2 Reach turn, check and pop

23 Back break 4&1 = Hip-Hip (Powered by knees) or 4&1 = Rotate, Rotate (end up on R hip/foot) or 4&1 = Shoulder, Shoulder (end up with R shoulder back) or 4&1 = Bicycle backward with R foot (end up on R hip/foot) or 4 Tap R to Right & Cross R to across front of L 1 Step on R 2 - Forward L Note: To lead her to do a bicycle, don't back up on 4 - back both arms and do a upward rotating motion toward her or (Figure 4) 4 Kick R & Swivel R 180 deg 1 Step R (This can be done on the end of an outside turn or after a hip twist on the end of a natural top)
Hopping pattern & Tipple & Forward lock

Start from an outside turn: R-R 2 R B - She does Reach + 3 L Slide to my LEFT - Turn 4&1 Lock forward (Lead her to my RIGHT) 2 - Lead her OUT (away from me) 3 - Lead her IN (toward me) & - (NO STEP) Lead her away from me 4&1 - Now lead her from my right to in front of me to my left. (My L hand is on her shoulder, my R-R to her R) (I am facing R, she is facing away from me L) 2 - Figure C with my L foot (facing L) 3 - Figure C with my R foot (facing R) 4&1 - Figure C (facing L), Lock, step --Repeat going the other way ----Exit 1 = Push through (see description) --Exit 2: Cross-body 2 - Step toward her L 3 - Replace 4&1 - Lock in place 2+ Lead cross body with my R hand
Instead of an open break: 2 Step forward L Pivot around my L foot to my L (180 deg) Lead her FORWARD (in the opposite direction) 3 R Step forward 4&1 Lock forward 2+ Reach turn

Disconnect from Partner 234&1 - Forward basic 234&1 - Backward basic Circle around her on the left, arriving on HER left (and on her footwork): to Her left: 2 Forward L & - Side R 3 - Back L 4 - Hook behind R & - Side L 1 - Forward R I am now on her footwork, R hand on her R shoulder, L hand over her L hand. (I should be behind her to her L) 2 Break Forward L 3 - Replace R 4&1 - Chasse L (LRL) 2 Tap in R (Keep pointing to 10 o'clock) 3 Tap out L (Turn to 2 o'clock) 4&1 - Back R, Side L, Forward R (moving to my L) 2 - Tap in L (Turn to 2 o'clock) 3 Tap out R (Turn to 10 o'clock) 4&1 Repeat Rward 23 - Repeat 4&1 Repeat Lward 2 L Step strongly toward the L (leading her out) 3 TAP R and pull her in slightly (I am back on my timing now) 4&1 - Cha-Cha in place (keep her close, open her to the L) 23 - LR Reach turn R (Lead her to Reach turn L) 4&1 - Lock toward her, Left hand up and pointing R ---exit 1 23 - RL Walk around her and lower my L hand 4&1 - Force her to lock backwards

Technique points: --First two steps are Straight down the diagional-- Forward twinkle: ---Entrance: LOD L HT Forward R Diag T Brush L Diag TH (Open her to promenade) --- R Diag L L Straight (on diag) R Brush Diag R (DO NOT change her direction, close ME) I am outside partner R --- Twinkle: L Forward (on diag) R Forward (on diag) L Brush (on other diag) --Repeat on other side R Forward (on diag) L Forward (on diag) R Brush (on other diag) --To enter a backwards twinkle: L Forward R - CUT HER OFF (turn around) L Back (I should be on her LEFT) -- Backwards twinkle: Back R (diag) L Back (diag) R Brush and other diag --Repeat on other side L Forward (on diag) R Forward (on diag) L Brush (on other diag) --To Exit: R BACK (Small step, turn sharply to L) L Step forward between her feet R Step forward (Continue into forward twinkle, or exit with promenade)

Two hands connected, 2L - Back break 3R - Replace (R side toward partner, she step forward strongly with her L foot) 4&1 - In place, turn 180 deg R, R side BACK slightly (she had R side back slightly) 2R Shift R, 3L Shift L, 4&1 Lock step forward (since R side is still back, this makes her lock)

DanceStep.Description: Two hand inside turn on L to diamond L over R hold + pizza
DanceStep.Comment: Two hands connected, 2L - Forward break 3R - Replace 4&1 - check and pop, open L 2R - Side - she steps forward Raise R hand point to L 3L - Together - she turns 180 deg R (drop R hand on her shoulder, send L hand over her head 4&1 - Cha-cha back Hands L over R, in diamond config ------Pizza delivery pattern ending: 2L - Forward break 3R - Replace 4&1 - check and pop, open L Slide L arm up into pizza delivery position 2 Hook R around L 3 and unwind under L arm (pulling her forward with R hand) 4&1 in place to face her

2 hands connected: 2L Forward 3R Replace 4&1 open R, bring her forward so she is in front of me ( I am facing across the slot) 2 Hook L behind R - Lead her foward 3R Step side - Bring her back 4&1 - Step, Side, In-front Facing her ---Turn away ending Release R hand (L-R) 2L Reach- 3R turn left (facing her) Reach around with my R hand (R-R) 4&1 cuban break RL 23 - Lead her outside turn to her R RLR 4&1 circle around the front of her to her R side (R-R L-L) ---Sliding doors (kind of) 2R - Forward (lead her to break back) 3L - Replace (Replace) 4&1 - cha-cha-left (she does cha-cha-R) repeat opposite side repeat same 2 - Lead her forward 3 - Have her face me done!
DanceStep.LadysSteps: back,replace forward forward forward forward, replace back, back, back

DanceStep.Comment: Technique: Remember to Go straight diag through 1 and 2 turn to diag on 3 (don't curve) Keep shoulders pointing down line of dance, turn hips to direction of travel Doing forward twinkle Twinkle to Left: L Forward (diag Center) R Forward (diag center) L Turn to diag wall Twinkle to R transition: R Forward (diag wall) Lower L hand and push through (she turns 180 deg L) (My L hand is in hers, my R hand on her R shoulder blade) L Forward (diag wall) (She continues diag wall) Hold step (so I can FAKE to her footwork) (She continues diag wall) (I may have to put some pressure on her R shoulder) -- Twinkle in shadow: R Forward (diag wall) L Forward (diag wall) R turn to diag center --repeat --Exit: Twinkle in shadow: R Forward (diag wall) L Forward (diag wall) R turn to diag center (Raise L hand, to turn her R) L Forward (Diag center) chasse: 2R Side (she turns R) &L Together 3R Step into closed position ---NOTE: Can do a hesitation (Check before the twinkle in shadow) 1R Forward 2L Replace 3R Side step (small) (now, face diag center) repeat on other side Continue with next twinkle

From a cha-cha basic, fall away: L2 - fallaway to Promenade position and break back R3 - Replace LRL 4&1 - Turn to face my partner and Chasse to the L R2 - Turn to promenade and Step forward (in the same direction at the chasse) L3 - Close her R4 - Turn to promenade and LR &1 - Lock and step 2L - Break forward (note: this is not the usual foot I use to break forward) 3R - replace 4&1 LRL - Lock backwards 2R - Face her 3L - Turn to promenade 4&1RLR - Face her and chasse R ---Exits: (1) Basic cha cha (2) Forward break (3+4) See forward breaks (next)

DanceStep.Description: Break, then chasse R or figure + inside turn to break
DanceStep.Comment: ------Break, then chasse R: 2L Forward break 3 tap-R Step FORWARD, then close to face her (Lead L hand forward, in and downward [in a backwards C], palm to palm R) 4 RIGHT - Close to face her &1 LR - Continue chasse -------Figure 4: 2L Forward Break 3 Close R foot pointing down against L ankle, then pop BACK onto a straight leg 4 RIGHT - Close to face her &1 LR - Continue chasse --------Inside turn L-R 2R - Forward 3L - Replace 4&1 - Lead her forward to my R L hand up pointing to R to lead inside turn + wind her up to turn L 2R in place - Lead her to turn L 3L in place - She turns L 4&1 - Lead her out of the turn (typically 90 deg to the L of where I started) 2R - Break forward

From forward twinkle: Diag wall 1L - Forward 2R - Replace (Lead her side to my right) 3L - Side (to my Left) 1R - Forward in a clockwise circle 2L - Forward in a clockwise circle 3R - Forward and turn Rightward so she is on my left --repeat --Other exit: 1 2 3 1 2 (roughly facing diag wall again) Raise R hand so she turns 1 rev to her R 3 (she shychopates &3&) --Continue with forward twinkle TECHNIQUE: Toe-Heal on step 3 (not HT). Don't look DOWN (toward ground) on twinkle (gently turn head to direction of movement) Keep right arm up and connected. Don't pump left arm.

DanceStep.Description: Inside Turn + Check + Reverse Top + Natural Top
DanceStep.Comment: R-R RL 23 4&1 - Open L Lead down to make her pivot 23 She pivot, pivot L 4&1 She does pivot, Pivot, Side RL 23 - I lead her to break forward. Hands: R-R in front, L hand on her L shoudler blade Simliar pattern: 4&1 - Open L Lead down to make her pivot 23 She pivot, pivot L 4&1 She does pivot, I brush my R hand over my head and place it on my R shoulder Hug her: (start slightly in front of her) L2 Step across the front of her - Hook my hands around her ribcage so I can lead her BACK R3 Place my R arm on her back (again hooking her ribcage) Check and pop: 4 Step toward her by slightly hooking my L foot behind my R foot. Lead her toward me &1 and pop (away) Reverse top: (Remember to keep her L always, turn to my L) R Step side (lead her side L) L Elvis (turn L, slide L foot into (in front of) R R 4 Side (she hooks L behind R) L & Elvis (She steps side) R 1 Side Check and reverse: 2 L Check (stand up straight not like v.waltz) 3 R Replace Natural top: 4 Side L (lead her side [to my] L) & Hook R behind L 1 Side L 2 Hook R behind L 3 Side L Back break and hip twist: (I know how to do this) Technique: - Leg straight on 1 - Move rib cage - Keep quicks and slows clear

Hold: Twist body to L, head faces LOD Footwork: HT Walk forward: S L - Walk turns slightly to L S R Open to promenade: Q L - Forward a - Open her Lward to promenade Q R - Plunk her on to her L leg (DONT STEP BACK) Link: (NOTE: stop, don't do next step until end of slow) S L - Forward in promenade (keep L leg closed around her leg) Q R - Forward Q Split weight - Close her -> In closed S L - Close her all the way ---

Two walks Link Closed Promenade Left Walk --Rock: S - Step forward R (with full weight on my R foot) (R Hip FORWARD) (Step forward forcefully so she can feel the lead, she tilts her head back) Q - Back L Q - Forward R S - Back L (Full weight) Q - BACK R Q - SIDE L Close Her (split weight) S - R Close R to L --Inside Reverse Turn: Q - L Forward turning to L Q - R Side turning more L S - L Continue down LOD across R foot Q - R back down LOD (turning to BACK LOD) Q - L Side (Close her) S - R Close R to L +Two walks to Diag center of short wall + Link + --Twist turn (from promenade) S L Forward (in promenade) Q R - Start cutting her off Q L - across LOD (cut her off) S R - Tuck R foot behind L foot and (QQ) unwind (she steps SL, QR, QL and then I turn her to promenade)

x-body to shadow: R-R 23 lead her to break back 4&1 open L 2 Lead DOWN so she turns L to 3 shadow (I am rotating L) 4&1 Rotate L to her L side (in shadow) 23 Lead her to break forward and replace 4&1 lead her in front of me ---exit 1 - single turn 23 - Lead her to spot turn R 4&1 - Lower hand ---exit 2 - double turn 23 - Lead her to spot turn 4& - Lead her to turn again (faster) 1 - Lower hand ---exit 2 - double turn + faceloop 23 - Lead her to spot turn 4 - Lead her to turn again (faster) & - Lead her WIDE so she slows down 1 - Lead wide she continues to turn R and catch her L hand with my L hand (low) and slip my right hand onto her shoulder 23 - face loop her (she breaks back) 4&1 - she steps forward 23 - Lead her to step forward 4&1 - spin her L to open ---Turkish towel: 23 - R-R forward break (regular) 4&1 - Cha- cha - left (and start leading turn) 23 - lead her to spot turn R and I do a jazz box (Cross in back, forward) 4&1 - Lead low to open her up (she does cucaracha R) (I step Side R, Cross in front L, back R) (R-R [on top for tall girls, low for short girls], L-L) 23 Back L, replace (lead her forward, replace) 4&1 - cha-cha-left repeat for L side --exit 1 (free spin): 2 Lead her forward, down 34&1 - She free spins 1.4 L --exit 2 (to shadow) 2 Lead her to turn L 3 switch R hand to flat, thumb down on her shoulder 4&1 - continue forward 23 - We both break forward in shadow.

On slows, step on the second half of the beat. On backwards steps, driving foot footwork is L (normal ballroom footwork) Release toe [drive from heel], R (different footwork) Release heel. To do the stucatto movement, keep some weight on the back foot (like it was stuck to the floor)

RL 23 Forward break RLR 4&1 Cha Cha L (R-L) 2L Forward Back break (wind her up to her R) 3R Forward (Lead her to pivot R past me) 4L Side (moving same direction) (She pivots R) &R In place (She pivots R) 1L In place (facing Wall, to her R) (She is facing center to my R) (I stopped her by leading my L side slightly) (My R hand in on her R hip) --Cha cha to Side & Bring R to L (R leg is bent, weight on R - ready to push) 2R Push side with L foot (turns) points away from direction of movement, L Hip high, R leg bent (weight on R leg) (no hip rotation) &3 - Repeat &4 - Repeat &1 - Repeat Switch to R-R 2 - She breaks back 3 - Replace 4&1 Check and pop --- ? Finish +++Technique note (in warm-up): on Full reach turn + pivot out, take last step big and to the side

DanceStep.Description: Underarm Turn Fake to double inside turn
DanceStep.Comment: Underarm Turn Fake to double inside turn: RL 23 Forward break RLR 4&1 Cha Cha L 2L - Sneak my R hand onto her L shoulder and PUSH her to break forward R (she will resist... which is her wind up for L turn) 3R - Reach my R hand over her shoulder and lead her to ROTATE L (not to step back) 4&1 - Lead her to pivot, pivot, then R arm down to her hip level, then 2 - Forward break

DanceStep.Description: Double open break and extra cha-cha to the side
DanceStep.Comment: 2L Forward 3R replace 4L Forward 1L Replace 2&3 - Chasse L (remember to do double break on the other side) ----or do extra cha-cha ...same 1L Replace &2 (See technique description on previous move) &3 &4 &1 2 - Open break on other side

From promenade: SL - Forward (Diag wall) QR - Forward QL - Forward (her next step is L crossed behind R since she is moving sideways) Q Check Forward R while turning R (she is as described) QL - Back - Backing LOD Q Side R - Facing Center, moving LOD & Together L - " Q Forward R (Between her legs) Follow with a link.

I'm facing wall, she is to my L , facing ALOD. 2L Forward (she checks slight forward ALOD) 3R replace 4 Hook L behind R (lead her forward to her L) (she crosses R in front of L) & Replace R (she steps back L) 1 L Side (down LOD), She steps forward R -- 2 R cross over L to L (wind her up slightly to her R - she steps forward L) 3 L replace R (she turns L 180 deg on L) 4&1 R Turn down Diag W ALOD (Cha-cha-step) 23 - Break forward, replace --bring her into side-by-side: 4 - Lead her forward to my hip & turn her L 180 deg 1 - Push away, so she is on her outside foot, tapping in side foot (I also am tapping inside foot) ---In-out 2&3 - Turn R to face out and lead her to do mirror. Keep free (L) hand over R hand 4&1 - Turn L to face in and have her do same. ---Exit: Put my R hand on her back 23 4&1: and do cross body lead

Check: (Left) foot forward (Brace foot, don't move body forward) Keep pressing forward with right foot. Push HIPS forward. When I return to original position, She pushes us out. --- Technique: head back, up Don't break shoulders, adjust to partner from elbows down --- Point head in direction of travel (Not at lady) (Slightly left of direction of travel when traveling in closed)

Similar to the Chase: From promenade: SL QR - start cutting her off QL - Close her SR - Outside partner (She steps BACK in closed) - S?L Rock back (turning us to L) S?R - Rock forward (turning us to L) SL - Step back (down the LOD) - Closed promenade: QR - Back QL - Side SR - Together

Start facing wall Keep shoulders parallel to wall S - Down S - Step L rightward under her L shoulder S - Hold S - Recover (she pushes us out) Spanish drag: S - Step back L and turn R Closed promenade: Q - Back Q - Side S - Together

2 hands, lead her to curve L into sweetheart, Keep circling around HER, keep her in place. 23 LR - Forward, replace (flip L hand to lead her to turn L) 4&1 - Turn her into sweetheart, while I'm circling around her (from her R to her L) ---- in sweetheart --Back R pivot exit 2R (Hook R behind L) Lead her to step back L and start pivoting R (let her go - she can single or double her R pivot) 3L Side 4&1 Check forward R (to my L), replace L, Side R +reach turn (single out) Forward L Turn R Cha-cha back L, Lock R in front of L, back R --Pizza Waiter + Turkish towel exit 2R (Hook R behind L) Lead her to step back L and start pivoting R (Keep both hands) 3L Side (Raise right hand over her head and use it to lead her to pivot R) 4&1 RLR - Keep circling around her (Right arm in pizza waiter, left hand in R elbow) (Jazz box R around her) 23 - L Forward, R Side R 4&1 LRL - Circle in front of her 23RL Lead her to spot turn R 4&1 - Chasse R

L-R 2L Forward to her R (my L) (My R arm is up) 3R Slide R (My L arm across my Face) 4&1 Continue to circle around her, turn L to face her, place my R hand on her shoulder +Natural top 2R hook R behind L 3L Side 4&1 - Send her out 23 - Wait 4&1 - Bring her in (hands on her hips) 23 - Wait 4&1 Wait 2 - Break forward +X-body out

Start w/Head L S - Down (Head R [Don't turn much, move it to the R of your spine]) S - L Forward S - Hold (Head L) S - Recover -- Spanish Drag S - Turn R, Step Back (Slight shaking movement, so she can slow off) Q BR Q - TL S - Close
Diag wall Q - Forward L Turn 180 deg L Q - Step under your body R Q - Back in outside partner L Q - Close her to promenade R

Cross-body: 23 LR - Forward, replace (open L) 4&1 - Lead her forward R-L 23 RL - Overturn her, lower R hand and rotate R so she turns away 4&1 - RLR - Lock forward (driving her forward) & - Rotate R hand clockwise to turn her to face me 23 - LR - Back back (she does swivel (to her) R, swivel L [with her weight back] ) (My lead is rotate hand counter-clockwise, clockwise) 4&1 - LRL - back, lock, back (she does, swivel, lock (forward), step (forward) (my lead is rotate hand counter-clockwise, lead [her] forward, forward) repeat on other side 23 - LR - same 4&1 - LRL - back, cross in front and rotate R, side (start of natural top) natural top: 23 - Hook, side 4&1 - Hook, Side, TOGETHER (stopping her in closed) Cucaracha: 2&1 to the R 4&1 to the L repeat 2&1 + 4&1 (and collect) Wa-pa-ta x-body to open break: 2 - hold &1 LR - Forward, replace + open L 4&1 - Chasse side 23 - Over turn her 4&1 - Open break +swivels (see next move)

Open break 23 LR - Forward, replace 4&1 LRL - Chasse facing her 23 RL - Forward, BACK PIVOT (I need to overturn to get her to feel the start of the swivels) 4& RL - Forward (traveling to my L(, lock - Arms shoulder width, height. Pull back slightly on L hand, lead her forward with R. 1 R - Forward (Pressure back (L) hand) , swiveling L 2 L - Forward (to my R), swivel R 3 R - Forward (to my L), swivel L 4& - Forward (to my L), Lock Repeat on the other side: to exit: 4& - Same 1 - Forward (not swivel) 2 Break forward
Give the lady some room on the chase.

R-R 23 LR Wind her up to turn L into shadow 4&1 bring her in R thumb down (over her shoulder) 23 RL Both break back 4&1 Send her across to my L repeat Exit with her on my R: 23 Break back 4&1 Hold my R hand still, lead her forward with my L hand --Turn in shadow: into shadow... get her on my L 23 Break back, replace 4 Lead her to pivot L & I pivot L 1 back 23 Back, replace Then send her across to my (new) L --Similar to last, but I Face her 4 slip my far hand to her shoulder, close hand on hers & Step side around her 1 slip my far hand to her close shoulder, break in front of her and look at her. (Note: make sure I have her break BACK on 23) exit: Same or: 4& Send her to my L 1 Wind her up L 2 Lead her back to pivot, pivot, Pivot R --Chasse together Lead her into shadow on my R (fake footwork to match her) 23 back replace 4&1 chasse curving L repeat, exit on R ---Cha Cha twinkles: Lead her into shadow on my R (fake footwork to match her) 23 back replace 4 Forward (slightly to my R) and turn slightly L & Side R 1 Together repeat repeat exit: 2 BACK L 3 Forward 4&1 lock forward (wind her up to pivot out L) 2 Tap R behind L (this is the fake) 3 forward 4&1 lock forward
CONNECTION Tail down Head up Body vertical Step into her space

DanceStep.Description: Push back, fake (Forward break alternatives) + technique
DanceStep.Comment:
Forward break: 23 LR Break, replace 4&1 Chasse L 2 R Step toward her (bring her in) and 3 L bounce her out (in a leftward rotational motion) 4 Ronde with R leg and hook behind L (4) (we are both facing LOD now - movement is backward for both of us) & Side L (inward) (she mirrors) 1 Check forward R --out = Forward break L -------Fake: 23 RL Break, replace 4&1 LRL Chasse L 2 L Step Forward (Lead her to step on her L, not check onto it like a forward break) 3 Turn L to face her, Tap R (My lead hand (L) hand rotates downward, palm up, thumb back) 4&1 Chasse R ---or on Chasse, full turn R 4&1 Channea turn R
Technique: On break, Toes point OUT Keep weight on back (bent) foot Keep body upright One leg bent, one leg STRAIGHT! Chest up, out

Technique: Keep Thumb in Rotate body slightly R to be parallel with lady Right arm: Lower, so lady can 'drape' over my arm Stretch elbows OUT Shoulders DOWN arms LEVEL, FORWARD Bend legs for shorter ladies My left hand faces in. Wrap fingers around her hand --- Compress MORE! end of 3: DOWN (if backward, free leg should be fully extended) 1: Drive flat forward or backward (stay in leg LONGER) 2. Roll through foot, swing sideways onto toe (foot UP, body DOWN) 3. Push onto bent leg, then hydralically straighten leg (foot UP, body UP) end of 3: Drop straight down (Foot then body) (onto ball if going BACK, onto heal if going forward) 1. roll though foot and drive.

---From open break: 2L Break forward 3RTapOrHold Turn to face her (lead from L hand, hand fans down) (R leg bent, pressed into L leg) (Wind up L) 4R Step strongly Forward (leading her to spin L) &L Chaines on Foot, turning back to face partner 1 Push R foot out Finish with a forward break: 23 LR Forward break, replace ---From hand-to-hand (leading her to break back) 2 R back 3 L Replace (wind up slightly L) 4 R Forward strongly (lead her to chaines R) 1 L Chaines L 2 R push out R (facing her) ---From Reverse? basic: 23 LR Forward break, replace (Lead her to turn back, I STAY facing LOD) (L-L arm-wrestle position) 4&1 I rotate L, she rotates R to R-R I can lead her to turn on synchopation, Or I can turn, or both ---------Chaines Technique-------- Step out R, turning R slightly, Bring L to R (weight on L) Turn on L, push out onto R

pattern: Reverse Reverse Change Natural Natural Change Reverse Reverse Change Natural Spin Turn Back Lock to open (Diag center of short wall) Natural (outside partner) Triple-pivot Twist Turn (remember to Lower through twist to speed her up) Double back-lock "Throwaway" (down line of dance) ----------Technique-------- Frame should always be the same Place lady on correct part of foot (ball or heel) LOWER FULLY ON 3 on 1, Stay on standing leg LONGER

Technique: Swing SIDE of hips Don't break frame EVER (I break when doing complicated moves) ---Pattern: From "Throwaway" 1 - Hold (start to move) 2R - Back (open her to promenade) 3L - Forward (Toe, heel, knee) --Chasse: 1L(S) &R(Q) (Knees still bent, so I can continue to rise) 2L(Q) (Close is FAST) 3R(S) --+ Natural

234&1 x-body 23 Change hand to wrist hold, overturn cross body (both facing same direction) 4&1 RLR Push out, and pull back (Side break) 2&3 LRL Diag forward, Side, Together (R hip UP) (Hand forward or toward partner) (we are facing each other) 4&1 RLR Diag forward, Side, Together (L hip UP) (Hand UP or back) (We are facing away from each other) 2&3 Repeat 4&1 Repeat (Lead her to side-by-side) 23 Forward break 4&1 Chasse 23 Outside turn 4&1 Chasse ----Other pattern: R-R 23 Open break 41 Curve her to turn L to my R (in sweetheart position) (I FAKE to get on her footwork) 23 LR BACK, replace 4&1 LRL Diag forward, Side, Together (R hip UP) (We are doing the same step) 2&1 Same other side 4&1 LRL Same 23 RL BACK, Replace 4&1 RLR Lock-Step-Forward 23 L Step, TAP R (I FAKE back to my footwork) (I wind her up, forward L, Turn her L to PIVOT,) 4&1 RLR Lock-Step-Forward (She does PIVOT, PIVOT, Side) 23 LR Forward, replace

Technique: Don't use to heel of my R hand to bring the lady L (in closed pressure should toward me on her shoulder blade) Don't break frame Stay down in back locks Don't lower on Twist turn
Double Reverse Spin: 1 L Forward in CBM turning L (Place lady on her heel) & R Across lady (Heel turn for lady) 23 Continue to turn L on R foot until I'm facing original direction
DanceStep.LadysSteps: 1 R Back in CBM turning L Heel turn L & L 2 Side R 3 Elvis L

DanceStep.Comment: Start from fan: 2 Check forward L, lead her to change weight to R 3 Replace R, She steps forward L 4 Lead her to step forward R & She locks L behind R 1 She steps forward L (My R hand at her eye level, palm forward, thumb down) 2 Lead her to step diag out (to my R) 3 Lead her to turn on her R foot to face me 4 R Charge her (R side leading) & Lock L behind R 1 Step forward L 2 Lead her to break back

Start from fan: 2 Check forward L, lead her to change weight to R 3 Replace R, She steps forward 4 Lead her to step forward L slightly out & She locks R 1 She steps forward L (&) (My R hand above her head I turn her R down LOD) 2 I Hook R behind L / Lead her to step toward me down LOD 3 I slide L / Lead her to step away from me (&) Lead her to turn 180 R toward me I will lock forward: 4 Forward R - lead her to step back toward me L & Lock L behind R - She locks R behind L 1 Step forward R - She steps forward L (&) Turn her 180 deg R (We can rotate Rward) 2 L Break forward - she breaks back 3 Replace R (DO NOT SLIDE R) / she replaces L (&) Turn her 180 deg L to face me I do a cuban cross, she does a lock forward (small steps): 4 Cross L in front of R & replace R 1 Step back slightly L & Turn her 180 deg R 2 step BACK R / She steps FORWARD L 3 replace L / She rotates L to my L side My arm is at hip level, swing hold, ready to power outward. 4 - Cross R in front of L (she mirrors) & - replace L 1 push out L (into fan)
very similar to spot turn 2 lead her to step toward me down the LOD (&) turn her R 180 deg before she can step out. 3 she steps side 4&1 we chasse side
No lead on new yorker, we both turn
Open break

Technique: Toe lead. Full weight over forward foot on forward chasse. Spiral: Alemana to side-by-side facing: end of 1 - Lead her to spiral (stir R hand, then turn hand to face away from me) (she does spiral on L) 2 - Cucharacha L - She steps away from me R 3 - Replace - she walks behind me 4&1 - step in place - she locks behind me 2 - Cucharache R - she walks toward me (on my L) 3 - Replace 4&1 - Chasse L ---Hand to hand 2 hand to hand, break back L 3 replace 4&1 - lock FORWARD (on 1, spiral R) 2 - Step forward L 3 - Step forward R, reach turn R 4&1 - lock BACKWARDS 2 hand to hand - break back L OR cucharacha L (in closed)

--Outside partner: Hips need to be turned toward my partner. Head weight, rib cage needs to be LEFT. --Pivots: Start (winding up) Turning early CBM on 1 (normally on 2) Make sure I step SIDE on 3 --Hook: Feet at hips width After unwind, bring her into closed and SMALL step forward --Locks Left side leading Large step 1, she is driving --Throwaway: start hips and shoulders (her) to wall, turn her by only turning my HIPS ... --Double reverse: Step CBM on 1 Large step SIDE on 2

Legs: Weight leg, Straighten leg (drop opposite hip), push hip back (Like walking up stairs) Ribcage rotates in opposition Swing arms from side-to-side (not forward) Be sure to finish movement: Slow, Slow, SLOW, Q, Q (finish S on 3 - don't start moving side)
Frame: Shoulders BACK into sockets Elbows forward Pressure inward Stay on MY SIDE --- Waltz - Lower before moving

Technique: Straighten legs, especially on 1 and 3 (also 2) --Closed chasse: basic: 2 L Forward 3 R SIDE 4 L close & R side 1 L close 2 R BACK 3 L SIDE 4 R close & L side 1 R close ALT: continue doing closed chasse's to L (in pairs of 2) EXIT: 2 L Forward 3 R REPLACE --Fallaway: 1 R Side (&) Open her Lward (I open Rward) (in closed) 2 L Step BACK 3 R SIDE (to face her) 4 Turn Lward - split weight & Turn Rward - split weight 1 Turn Lward - weight on L (desplonde = raise R foot) 2 Step Forward R 3 L Side - Close her to face me + Closed chasse Lward (see above)

--Check and pop: 4 Forward R & L replace 1 R Back (next to L) 2 L Forward (normal forward break) 3 R Replace 4 L back & R Replace 1 L Forward (next to R) 2 R Back (back break) 3 L Replace --Cuban Cross 4 Cross R in front of L & L Replace 1 R side R 2 L Forward Break 3 R Replace 4 Cross L behind R & R Replace 1 L side L 2 R back break 3 L replace --Advanced cuban cross: 4 Cross R in front of L & L Side L (Right next to R) 1 R push side R rest same -- Wa-pa-ta timing break forward: &3 instead of 23
Roll topline with partner Keep down LOD hip high Press into floor when driving forward Lower completely at end of 3

Technique: Turn with my hands, move with my body. Keep right hand still, increase pressure to signal swivel. Promenade Swivels: & Turn 90 deg L, turn her to promenade 2L Break back 3 Replace & Turn to face her 4L Side & Chasse 1 Left & Turn L 2R Forward & Turn L 3L Side & Turn L 4 Forward & Lock 1 Forward 2L Break forward ---Now do reverse back
Foot goes straight down the LOD on 1 and 4 DON'T cross the LOD (overturn) or I will be knocking feet with the lady

R basic: 4&1 RLR 2L Open break, except take her weight onto the foot 3R Turn L 90 deg to face her, take her L hand w/my R hand. & Turn (more) 90 deg L (Keep her R hand w/my L hand so I can open her up to step backwards) 4&1 RLR Back, Lock, Back (Step BACK with her) & Turn 90 deg R to face her (Lead the R hand down and back in an arc - hold her on her L [back] foot) 2 Tap L foot forward (&) Turn 90 deg L into promenade 3 Step forward L 4& RLR Step, Lock, Step forward (by the end of this move my L lead hand should be way in front) Lead down and back to get her to pivot (1) (R) Pivot R 90 deg 2L back pivot R 90 deg 3R Pivot R 45 deg to face her 4&1 Chasse L
Swing hips through on 2 Don't break at the waist Stay on 1 longer (espically when I'm going backwards, since I'm on the inside, I need to open up)

Remember: 4&1 = Small, Small, Big On turns, keep hands in front On Chaines turns, step SIDE on 1 (Don't turn to open break until 2) On check, do NOT transfer weight onto forward foot, remember to keep back foot on ground, pushing forward. Pattern: 2 - Step forward w/partner (do not check) 3 - Turn Side to face partner, lead back hand down and back to keep partner from stepping (we tap) 4&1 - Chasse side ---or 4&1 - Chaines turn - Step, together (3/4 turn), step side

Back change (preferred going into corner on short side) Technique - Waltz, get down lower Stay on 1 longer Butterfly: Twinkle R check in front L replace R Step side R --Turn to face her, R palm to her L palm -- Turn to face down LOD ----exit: Lead her DOWN and back slightly so she spins in front to her R while I: L Step R Check in back L Replace --1: R Drive forward while turning R

4&1 RLR Basic (moving R) ---Underturn (don't start toward forward break): 2L - Press toward partner (L shoulder toward partner, while drawing them in) 3R - Bounce off (replace) while moving right: 4L BACK &R side 1L Foward --repeat on r side --alternative: 2L - Press toward partner (L shoulder toward partner, while drawing them in) 3R - Push harder (to start partner moving) (Lead her to pivot with RIGHT hand) 4 - Pivot L & - Pivot L 1 - Pivot L 2 - Press toward partner (on other side) ---exit: 2L - Press toward partner (L shoulder toward partner, while drawing them in) 3R - Push harder (to start partner moving) (Lead her to open open - KEEP R hand) 4L Hook behind R (toe) &R Small side (toe) 1L - Step FORWARD 2R - Forward break

Waltz technique: Bend and PUSH side on 2 - stay DOWN. Drop at the end of 3. Viennese Waltz patterns: From R turns: on 4 (LRL) open her up, raise L hand, she turns 456 and opens (we are both facing same direction on outside foot) Butterfly (see previous) Moving (butterfly?): 1L Forward (facing partner) 2R Side (still facing - R arm softly in front) (spotting partner) 3L Together (still facing arms cross) 4R Forward (Backing partner) 5L Side (back still to partner, left arm forward) 6R Together (turn to face partner) -repeat --Exit: 1L - raise L hand, she turns R 2R step 3 Check L in front of R to my R She does a develope (kicks L foot) Pause? 4L Lead My L hand down, she turns L 5R I drive forward and connect. ----Fallaway 1L Forward (facing partner) 2R Side (still facing - R arm softly in front) (spotting partner) 3 Cross L behind R Lead her to spin L (I spin R) 4 R forward 5 L Together Chaines 6 R Side

Alternate lead for spin across: Start: both on outside foot R-L Lead R down to turn her L Raise my L hand thumb down as I cross IN FRONT of her End up on the opposite site. ---Same leg lunge: Same entrance as Develope: 1 - Check L across front of R as she turns R Stand behind her and STOP her on her L before she can step back 2 - Switch to my L foot 3 No weight change 4 - Push out onto my R leg - She does the same - I support her with my R knee behind her L leg. 56+ Hold here. ---Backwards walk thing: Reverse turn: 456 to Backing LOD 1(23) -- Back R - leave R forward and lift off ground (lead to L) 4(56) -- Back L - leave L forward and shape to R 123 - Continue reverse turn. ---Round and round thing: Starting with her on my LEFT: (she will do a jazz box) Check L in front on R (she steps back R) Replace R (she steps side L) Side L (she steps forward R) (Now she in on my R) Run R (in a Rward circle) (she runs L) Run L (in a Rward circle) (she runs R) Reach turn R onto my R (read turn onto her L) --(she is on my L again)--

R-R Open break, curve her in. she chasses into shadow, I fake (step,step) to change to her footwork, I lock her in on my R 23 LR Back, replace 4&1 LRL Forward, Side R (turning L), Together L 2&3 RLR on other side 4&1 repeat on R side 23 R BACK, L replace 4&1 RLR Lock forward 2 L FORWARD CHECK 3 R Replace back 4&1 (don't step or Step Forward, step Forward) --- 2 Break forward

23 L-R Open break 4&1 LRL - Forward, Side, Together 2 Hook R behind L 3 Step Side, turn 90 deg R 4 Hook R behind L & Step Side 1 Hook R behind L -- 2 Step Side 3 Hook 4 Side & Hook 1 Side -- 2 Hook R behind L 3 Step Side, turn 90 deg R -exit: 4 Hook R behind L & Step Side 1 together. -- Cross body exit -- or pivot exit 4 Pull my R hand to the R off her back She does Back pivot R & She does Pivot 1 She does side 2 She does back break (I do forward beak) -- or same pivot exit, but I also lead her to spin with my R hand
Lower on 3 BEFORE moving forward Keep shoulder blades OUT not IN

Lead R down to turn her L Raise my L hand thumb down as I cross IN FRONT of her End up on the opposite site. ---Same leg lunge: Same entrance as Develope: 1 - Check L across front of R as she turns R Stand behind her and STOP her on her L before she can step back 2 - Switch to my L foot 3 No weight change 4 - Step out slightly onto my R leg & - Step together with my L leg 5 - Push onto my R leg.

--Intro to spoke-- Start by walking around (Rhythm starts) Castenetes - Walk in rightward circles (canter rhythm) (music starts) Raise R and Turn her in R turns, Finisn aligning backing LOD left leg free (break in music) Do naturals (staring with back natural) roll her out on 7, on outside leg on 8 (moved two locations along LOD) 1 in; 2 out; 3 cross in front with left hand leading to outside foot; 4 in, 5 out, ??? 1 turn L in front of her (heading toward middle), 2 reverse, 3 reverse, 4 roll her out to middle, ??? --Spoke stuff-- 1 turn to twinkle (Forward L, ball reach turn R, forward L - connect R-R with partner to L), 2 twinkle out (RLR), 3 twinkle in, ... 8 Twinkle in to my partner. Hands on her waist - 1-4 turning R 5-8? - Naturals toward outside of circle, Finish align backing LOD Raise her R hand, Step fwd L, Hook R behind L (turning R), R side (into shadow) (change to her footwork) --Transition to Lilt line-- 1-8? Naturals in shadow Roll out, Lead her to develope into the middle Reverses in place (Move to Lilt line start) Start facing opposite line. 1 Reverse 2 Reverse 3 Reverse 4 Lilt 5 Lilt, 6 Reverse, 7 Reverse, 8 Lilt (ALL ALIGNED), 1 Lilt 2 Reverse 3 Reverse, 4 Roll her out (to start of cross line) --Cross to finish-- 1 Fallaway, 2 Fallaway backing, Fallaway facing, Fallaway backing (facing other partner), Fallaway out (facing new partner), Fallaway (backing), Fallaway facing, turn around R 1 Fallaway back in (backing), 2 fallaway facing, fallaway backing (facing my orig partner), fallaway away (facing), fallaway facing, fallaway away (facing) (in end position) 1 Check L to R, replace R, Step L to L (she does jazz box L), Run R, Run L, Reach turn R (to face audience), repeat, spin her out to face audience.

DanceStep.Description: Basics, Zig Zag, Back Lock, Running Finish
DanceStep.Comment: Pattern: SQQS - Quarter Turn to Right SQQS - Progressive Chasse SQQ - Natural turn ( I step outside partner to lead) SSS - Natural Spin Turn SQQ - Reverse turn (back half) (finish facing LOD of short wall) SSS - L Forward turning to L, R side (lead her to heal turn), Turn shoulders back R so she will step forward R (outside partner) QQS - Back lock - R back, lock L in front of R, R back QQS - Running Finish - L back (she steps forward outside), R side, L Forward S - I step forward R, outside partner (first step of quarter turn)

Start doing basics along the long wall:
Quarter Turn to Right (SQQS) Progressive Chasse (SQQS) (repeat those two) Natural Turn (SQQ)
These are very common moves. Here is a site that actually has videos of these patterns: http://www.ballroomdancers.com/Dances/dance_overview.asp?Dance=QS
Spin turn (SSS) 456 of a Reverse turn end (with man) aligned facing line of dance of the new short wall. (SQQ)
Here is the confusing part straight from the ballroom book - Lady's footwork. S = Slow Q=Quick (Also, the diagram I attached to this email shows your footwork)
ZIG ZAG, LOCK AND RUNNING FINISH Lady This is a very popular figure, consisting of the first part of the Zig Zag, a Forward Lock Step ending with a Running Finish. Commence backing the LOD. 1. RF back, turning body to L. S 2. Close LF to RF turning on R heel and making a heel turn to face diag. to wall. S 3. RF forward, outside partner, diag. to wall. S 4. LF diag. forward. Q 5. Cross RF behind LF. Q 6. LF diag. forward, still moving diag. to wall. S Now into the Running Finish: 7. RF forward, outside partner, turning body to R. Q 8. LF to side, body backing diag. to centre. Q 9. Still turning to R, step back RF, R side Leading. Now moving back down LOD. S 10. LF back, partner outside. S
Contrary Body Movement. CBM on 1, 3 (slight), 7 and 10. Steps 3, 7 and 10 are placed in CBMP. Rise and Fall (Body). Commence to rise at end of 3: continue to rise on 4 and 5; up on 6; Lower at end of 6. Rise at end of 7; up on 8 and 9; Lower at end of 9. ---
Start Polka Chasse (Note: This is one of those wierd patterns that are not in the book - fortunately there is only one student that I know who can do this move... your daughter, Christina!)
11. LF Hop (Lady backing wall new long wall, ready to start polka chasse) Here is where things get fuzzy for me: Chasse down the floor: Q&Q&Q Hop, Turn &Q continue doing this pattern and exit with a double-(man forward) forward lock. I'm not sure of the timing of the lock exit...maybe QQ& QQS
Finish with a: natural, spin turn and start over again.

Technique: STAY LEFT! MAINTAIN BODY CONTACT! STAY VERTICAL! On the end of the tipple move SIDEWAYS not forward and bring her around me.
ZIG ZAG, BACK LOCK AND RUNNING FINISH Man The figure originated from the Running Zig Zag, now seldom danced. It consists of the first part of the Zig Zag followed by a Back Lock, ending with a Running Finish. It is an important figure for the keen dancer to master as parts of it recur in more advanced variations. Commence facing the LOD. 1. LF forward, turning body to L. S 2. RF to side, on same LOD, back parallel to wall. S 3. Continue turning slightly to L, and step back LF,partner outside, diag. to wall. S 4. RF back. Q 5. Cross LF in front of RF. Q 6. RF diag back, still moving back diag. to wall. S Now into the Running Finish: 7. LF back, partner outside, turning body to R. Q 8. RF to side and slightly forward with body almost facing the LOD. Q 9. LF forward, preparing to step outside partner, L side Leading. 5 10. RF forward, outside partner. S Contrary Body Movement.
CBM on 1, 3 (Slight), 7 and 10. Steps 3, 7 and 10 are placed in CBMP. Rise and Fall (Body). There is no rise on steps 1 and 2. Commence to rise at end of 3 (NFR) continue to rise on 4 and 5; up on 6; Lower at end of 6. Rise at end of 7; up on 8 and 9; Lower at end of 9. Note that the rise is taken from the ball of foot on step 7. The L heel does not lower to the floor. Body Sway. Sway to L on 8 and 9. Amount of Turn. There is a quarter turn to L between steps 1 and 2 and a slight turn to L between 2 and 3. Make three-eighths turn to R between 7 and 8. The body will turn slightly less and will complete the turn between steps 8 and 9. Footwork. 1 H T. 2 T H. 3 T H. 4 T. 5 T. 6 T H. 7 T. 8 T. 9 T H. 10 H. General Notes. Although step 3 moves back diag. to wall the body should be backing between wall and diag. to wall. This will ensure better contact with partner. Steps 7 to 10, the Running Finish, can be counted QQSS or SQQS. Both are correct. Try to use an upward stretch of the body on step 7 which will help the man to move freely and lightly on these steps. Step 10 will become the first step of any Natural figure.
-------- Antonio,

Slip pivot: Forward: R forward (should be in chair position, back straight, leg bent) Push backwards onto a toe, close and collect her (I must move) TH backwards (continue pivoting on R foot) Backwards (her): L Forward (chair) back onto R toe, pivoting R and closing to him L Forward TH (Continue turning L, keep R hip into him) ---technique--- - When stepping forward, concentrate on the standing (driving) leg.
